author: freebornangel
title: Would you like to help yourself?
body:
<iframe width="854" height="480" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ps_97NS8870" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


You know, in that self help kinda way?

Well, the thing that separates us from the gorillas and bears is that we can pass knowledge across our generations.

If it weren't for books, and maybe thumbs, we wouldn't have risen above subsistence so quickly.

We would still be having to pass knowledge through oral histories, and when you start talking about jsons, apis, metallurgy, chemistry, botany, etc, I think you can see how that would quickly break down.

You would have to be in the same room long enough to assimilate the knowledge with somebody that can lay it out to you in terms that you can understand.

Could you imagine trying to build Steemit if everybody had to be in the loop to hear it audibly?

It would be impossibly complex, a logistical nightmare.

So, that being said I have tw
root_title: Would you like to help yourself?

title: No true communist,...
body:

http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/murray-bookchin-to-remember-spain-the-anarchist-and-syndicalist-revolution-of-1936

They were bombed back into submission, from the air.

title: Athens thanks the local police for their service,...
body:
<iframe width="520" height="293" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/P4MMRd7u_CE" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

From the report:

(The) 17th of November is the day where the student revolt against the dictatorship in Athens, Greece in 1973 is being commemorated. 

The 3 day commemoration leads to a march at the streets of almost every city in Greece, but mainly in central Athens, where a usually a massive march is organized towards the American embassy, that is being accused of co-operating and imposing the junta regime at the time.

Them folks sure know how to thank a cop,....

author: freebornangel
title: One more broken editor post.
body:
Well, with the editor out you get to see the thing that I usually clean out of my poor attempt at coding this post.


If you are not aware, Kurt thought that this world was a Disneyland for Dummies.

At one time, he was in favor of lining up those on the left and executing them in a wholesale slaughter.

But, when I met him he claimed to be an anarchist, a peasant anarchist, to quote him.

So, there must have been a real departure from what he grew up advocating.

I can't say for sure, I missed my chances to get an in depth interview before he died.

We'll just have to remember him as the good natured fella just trying to improve the folks around him,...

author: freebornangel
title: The editor is still whack, tyvm,...
body:
Well, is the editor back on line?

I guess I'll know shortly.

I see that changes have gone through on the interface.

I guess some things are better than no things, but I sure would like to see the sp delegation thing put to bed.

So, I see the editor is not all the way back, when I hit enter and move the cursor up to erase something the erasing starts on the last entered line.


THIS IS VERY FRUSTRATING!


I guess I'll see if I can make a different type of post,....


[img]http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/28/good-morning-steemitada40.jpg


Nope, looks like we get one string of input and no edits.

THANK YOU, CODERS!!  /S


Well, at least us stream of consciousness folks won't have our voices silenced, just the folks that like to go back and edit what they have written.



Thanks for taking time for me,...

author: freebornangel
title: The roof, the roof, and the emporer, is on fire!!
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/23/hold-up-this-08ptpf20896.jpg


As much as I hate being a curmudgeon some days, on other days it comes in handy.

If steem is created to create the reward pool.

If this steem is then divided 90% to Steempower holders and 10% to everybody else, ie, witnesses, sbd interest, reward pool, etc.

Then it is impossible to buy and hold steem without daily losses in value.

This loss can be mitigated, or even reversed by a rising steem price.


This loss can be recouped by draining the reward pool.

This loss can be recouped, and even exceeded, by becoming a successful author.

But not by everybody.


My math needs to be crowd sourced not just because I haven't done much algebra lately, but also to garner respect as to it's accuracy.


If the inflational losses are recouped, and/or exceded, though posting and curating, what is the break even point?<
root_title: The roof, the roof, and the emporer, is on fire!!

title: Why Bitcoin won't save the world, and why Steem has only a slight chance.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/23/xlargeb9eb6.jpg


Bitcoin won't save the world because rich people will ensure that all the rules favor the rich at the expense of the poor.

Steem is unlikely to save the world because that is the way the central developers are taking the platform.

IF it was up to them we would all bend over for the large whales.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/22/friendlyfiref4979.jpg


It may just be me, but it seems to me that votes are up and payouts are down.

This tells me that the experiment is crumbling and the whales are back to sucking up every steem that they think they can without causing open revolt like what led to the experiment in the first place.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/12/05/5a53e6afa5106b9.jpg


If this is the way that the developers continue to allow the platform to go Steem will end up being just another bs shitcoin.

Which really sucks because

author: freebornangel
title: Steemit's cashout feed.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/22/wages-keep-you8a79f.jpg


https://steemit.com/cashout

This link will let you use your new found voting weight on those posts that you missed yesterday, and the 30 days before, in the order that their payout windows expire.

I think that voting your extra votes on 0 payout posts, or those you think underfed, in cashout gives us a chance to keep some users that would otherwise have been less appreciated.

If you are a whale, you can smirk about how you extended their payouts.

'Oh, you thought you were getting paid in 30 minutes, well take this!!'   *extends payout window 6 hours*

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/22/wages-dont-mean-bec7elb4bde.jpg


But hey, what does an old hobo know anyway, I don't have a Gucci bag sitting on the hood of MY Maserati,....



Thanks for taking time to read what I had to say!

body:

I was reading @krnel's post: https://steemit.com/hardfork/@krnel/change-hardfork-17-to-get-some-things-passed in which he states that there are 0 witnesses against the sp delegation.

I seem to remember one, at least, that said that perhaps this issue needed to be revisited in light of the purview I had shared with him.

Let me go on the record here.

Sp delegation allows the whales to make an end run around the wall created by the experiment, they can power up their favorites, or sock puppets, and we go back to the way things were before @smooth and @abit took the reins in their own hands.

Perhaps slowly, boiled frog like.


From the 'chatter' I have 'heard', I can only figure that some crapitalistic veiwpointed boss has come into the room and decreed this as a thing.

It is good crapitalism, it allows the rich to exploit the poor some more, and what good is power i

title: Ok, Ok, what the heck is happening here?
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/23/hold-up-this-08ptpf20896.jpg


My vote is giving .01usd on a new post.

I only have 1500sp.

Other people with comparable sp are not giving .01usd.

I got a vote from @berniesanders  that registered lower than me in the vote list.

I thought those were based on sp.

More sp, higher on the list.

But when I went to see what was up with Bernie he has 17 times more sp than me.

Soooo, if you can tell my why my math is acting like somebody has 'shared' some sp with me, that would be nice.

//edit//

Now my account value is out of whack, too.

I should be over 300usd, but I am not.



Thank you for your time,.....



Have a perfectly peaceful day.

Vote FBA King of the World

author: freebornangel
title: Just another crappy day in paradise.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/14/2.593b1a.jpg


Not much going on here at The FreeBorn Society.

One of our associates got pulled over for driving all pilled out.

She had a car wreck a decade ago, and three dui's in the last year.

I think she is through driving, at night for sure.

She has a son that she treats like a princess, I see some bike riding in his future.

She was going to pick him up from work.

title: The Coming Age of Steam!
body:
Kurt Saxon set the bar for the survivalist community.

His work compiling documents that had passed into the public domain and packaging them into books and cd's was an ambitious under taking, and a vital accomplishment.

He read The Anarchist's Cookbook, and thought those folks were idiots and endangering folks with their hairbrained ideas, so he set himself the task of making a better book.


Take a few minutes to read him in his own words,....

body:

It is raining where I am at and the temperatures have come back to normal, we have had an unusually warm winter.

I've been back 4 winters now, and two of them were record settingly warm.

I'm betting this one is, too.

It sure makes getting deported from paradise that much more tolerable.

I was sooo tired of being cold that I cut all ties and moved south into the tropic of cancer, man was I loving it.

At least until I ran out of money and got deported.

They all thought that was the funniest thing, me, not so much.

I got dropped in Houston with $90 and only friends to seek out, my family has either died or are estranged.

Winters were the least of my worries.

Luckily I am a really, really lucky person.

I make being me look easy, beware the jealous.

Why a person would

The Abc's of Anarchism by Alex Berkman

Then your data set may not be up to snuff.

There is more to being an anarchist than seeing a circled A on a skateboard and liking the idea of not being told what to do.

The test of an author's book to determine it's classification as a classic is it's ability to read as if it was written today.

title: Wheels of Rage!!
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/05/when-tyranny-comes-haqndu4207d.jpg


WHEELS OF RAGE

Table Of Contents

A Freeware Novel Of Action & Adventure

By Kurt Saxon

Mostly true story of the Iron Cross motorcycle club of the seventies. Nearly all ex-Nazi storm troopers, they outclassed every bike club in southern California. Being borderline psychotics helped. Their exploits got them headlines and jail time. Big Mike Brown, formerly George Lincoln Rockwell's bodyguard, was club president. The book, used as a character reference, helped get Mike four years in Federal prison for an attempted bombing of the U. N. A psychiatrist, after reading "Wheels", pronounced it the best study of a sub-culture he had ever read. 


Below you will find the links to one of two novels Kurt Saxon wrote many moons ago.

http://www.survivalplus.com/wheels/toc.htm


With thanks to @riskdebonair for giving me a chance to plug one o

author: freebornangel
title: Why I started downvoting the cheetah bot.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/04/when-tyranny-comesa5766.jpg


The cheetahbot does a wonderful service for us here.

It is an invaluable tool for checking content that has been taken from others and passed off as the reposter's own.

This is something that is necessary to keep the community well informed.

Absolutely essential.


My problem arises when the cheetahbot doesn't check it's facts.

When the cheetahbot references the op's own content as questionable this is bad.

Here are two examples:

https://steemit.com/anarchy/@marcstevens/dissent-welcome-prove-states-citizens-governments-actually-exist/

https://steemit.com/news/@tftproject/michigan-cops-can-legally-have-sex-with-human-trafficking-victims-during-investigations/


Both of these posts were commented by cheetah as questionable.

Both of these posts will not be voted by any number of bots.

Bot voting is a fact of life

If nobody complains then there are no complaints and things don't get better.

Another soldier tidbit that is good to know is, a soldier never runs when s/he can walk, never walks when s/he can stand, doesn't stand when s/he can sit, and won't sit when s/he can lay down.

It's just a fact of the environment.


So, my complaint today, and qualifying content, is that we need a ballot for issues in the hardfork.

title: Can we get voters listed differently?
body: Grrr, forgot to click on the editor, why do ya'll hate that thing sooooo much?? http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/21/happiness-is-homemade8c22b.jpg When we look at who has voted on our posts we see a list from the whales down in order of sp in the account. I would like to see them listed according to the weight of the vote that was given. @Fyrstikken gives us all 1%votes but gets placed in the list as if he had voted with 100% I would rather see his name where he actually fell in relation to the other votes that I got. If I get a 100% vote from somebody with less sp than he has, and that person's vote brings more rewards, the higher value vote should be listed higher in the list as having given more, imo. Thanks for all you do for us. The natives have been restless lately and I don't want you to forget that some of us have great gratitude for what you have made possible for us. Especially when it seems to you that we just don't agree with anything you like,....

author: freebornangel
title: Can we get a downvote button?
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/21/rule-by-forcediseasse776d6.jpg


Downvoting is going to persist on Steemit as a thing.

This is just fine, we need an acceptable outlet to express dissent.

Flags are for content that offends nearly all of us.

Downvotes can be allowed to be irrational.

Some trolls just like downvoting, and we need to make a space for them to express their views, too.

At least until they get downvoted off the UI.


So, can we get a downvote button, perhaps hidden in the flag as a choice in a dropdown menu?


'You have chosen to flag this content, do you want to downvote because you don't like the content or it's rewards,  or to bring authoritarian eyes to it because it is likely to harm Steemit?'


This allows flags for 'illegal' content while allowing downvotes for rewards being too high, and content that makes us emotional.


Provided we acclimate
root_title: Can we get a downvote button?

title: Thank you Steemit developers,....
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/21/rbfe593de.jpg


https://steemit.com/hardfork/@timcliff/hardfork-update-curation-being-added-back-to-comment-rewards-revised-curation-and-reward-curves-for-both-posts-and-comments


It looks like community input is being given weight.

Perhaps with the new curve we can all count in the math.


I am still opposed to the influence sharing.

Whales have their influence, nothing to be done about  that now, but to let them institutionalize the negative effects of that by allowing sharing of sp weight is just a bad idea, imo.


Community uproar over the guilds shouldn't be appeased by the curve bone when the second half of the problem is allowed to be made worse.

By allowing whales to farm out what is rightfully their's we merely change guilds from groups to individuals with the same agenda, use whale influence to speak over the rest of us.


Steemizen

title: Speaking of math skills,...
body:
I don't use them often because I generally trust folks to be honest.

It's a character flaw of mine that when I project, it's expecting good from people, and rarely have folks lived up to my expectations.

So, every now and then I like to just check facts on my own.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/23/hold-up-this-08ptpf20896.jpg


I thought I noticed something out of whack in my author rewards, the math was soooo far off that it stuck out enough for me to notice.

Here, I will illustrate.

0.875 SD, 13.890 STEEM, and 21.705 STEEM POWER

This is my reward for a comment.

IF the Steem Power represents half of the author rewards then the other two should add to equal 21.705 Steem.

Further, if .875SD is equal to 13.890 that equals an exchange rate of 15.874.

This means that the exchange rate is not very fresh, as the internal price has been below .12 for some time.

IF we presume that each adds to the left half

author: freebornangel
title: Announcing Submedia.tv's new show, 'Trouble'.
body:
subMedia.tv is excited to announce the launch of Trouble, a brand-new monthly show offering an in-depth anarchist analysis of the dynamics and forces shaping today’s movements. Trouble is an attempt to cut through the fog of misinformation that clouds our understanding of the world. It will broadcast first-hand accounts and perspectives from organizers on the ground, with the aim of provoking people into taking bold, collective action. The subMedia.tv collective has been producing radical films and videos since 1994.

Join us on Sunday February 26th at 8:00pm EST for the launch of our first episode of Trouble, “Black Snake Killaz: The Untold Story of the Red Warrior Camp.” The subMedia.tv team takes a close look inside the dynamics that played out behind the scenes at the Standing Rock encampment, including serious disagreements over which tactics to use to best stop the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL).


https://submedia.tv/trouble/
root_title: Announcing Submedia.tv's new show, 'Trouble'.

title: Do you understand the Federal Reserve?
body:
It is neither federal, nor a reserve.
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/22/keep-working-stop-rzaj6rc5f67.jpg


I'm going to take a minute to explain your monetary system to you, don't be surprised if you want to throw rocks at banksters when I am through.

The Federal Reserve is a privately owned bank that creates money from nothing and loans it into our economy.

http://www.federalreserve.gov/faqs/currency_12771.htm

They say that they print $100 at a cost of 14.3 cents.

So, the banksters make $99.857 for each $100 bill circulation.

Then they charge interest on top of that.

They never create money for interest, they only create money for principal.

That means that in order to pay off the interest incurred by your loan you have to force somebody else's loan into default.


Let me put that into a more relatable form.

If GM loans out 1000 cars to 10 people on 10% interest then you would clearly see that it is impossible to give GM back more cars than the factory created.
It is physically impossible t

title: How I became an anarchist.
body:
And why anarcho-crapitalism is not a thing.

Well, it is a thing, but all false flags are things.

Lies.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/22/im-sorry-if-fogr6vf1f28.jpg


In 1985 I was walking down a street in Frankfurt when I saw a circled A on the wall.

I asked my buddy what that was about.

He said 'anarchy'.

I said, 'No taxes?'

He said, 'yes'.

I said, 'I'm in'.

I instinctually knew that taxation is wrong.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/21/rule-by-force-hcq5kg9fbc8.jpg


I've identified as an anarchist ever since.


In the early 90's I had life arranged so that I could further my education at home.

I started with Ayn Rand.

I was a card carrying Libertarian, for a couple years.

I moved on to L. Ron Hubbard.

We sure could use some ARC remediatio

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/09/you-know-what-89lrml96a65.jpg


I'm told that the way voting and curating works is if one person is the only person that votes and that one person votes only one post that all of the rewards pool would go to that one author.

I still haven't totally wrapped my mind around how the votes interact.

I do know that the reason my posts round down is that later higher weight votes take from my predicted payout to make up the reward for the higher sp account's beneficiary.

The higher a post goes on the trending page the shorter the payout tail becomes.

If this is, in fact, the case, I can only surmise that when a post gets voted to the top of the trending list to the tune of $1000 and double the normal number of daily voters show up to vote in those unusually high rewards, that could've enticed folks to stay around, to reward an inside member of the high sp account's 'approved' list, that somethin

author: freebornangel
title: Is there a trading bot out there?
body:
I use @steemvoter to support the authors on my list and earn a modicum of curation awards.

It compiles the first list of posts that I read each day.

It simplifies my experience here.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/25/459554528400777229cac6c.jpg


Now that I am learning more about Steemit I have put my attention to the internal market.

If I can buy low and sell high, I can multiply the rewards I get.

So, I am watching the feed waiting for my trade to go through.

It's pretty tedious watching a pot for a boil.

Especially when the flame is low.

So, I got to noticing that some bids would disappear and be replaced just that quick with a bid that wasn't in the queue a moment before.

Now, my experience with the internet is somewhat limited, but that reeks of bot trading to me.

Which led me to the question, 'Where do I get one?'.

If you can answer that, kindly put it in a comment?
root_title: Is there a trading bot out there?

So, my math may be off a little, bear that in mind.

Further keep in mind that I may not fully support, nor accept as gospel, some of the words that I put in this, or any other, blog.


I figure the most of you accept this censorship as perfectly acceptable, and therefore, in your mind it is not really censorship.

IF you don't agree, or identify, with the title you move on.

You don't give the content a moment's more thought.

After a while you learn which authors you can just scroll on by.

And that is perfectly acceptable.

You don't have to support anything that dings your

They don't have time to just live in the house that their hard work has provided for them.

They don't have time to spend raising the children that they can afford.

That lovely trophy spouse doesn't get but minutes a day.

Mostly spent solving first world problems.

author: freebornangel
title: How are you gonna compete against free?
body:
As if you haven't noticed, if I had to make my living at a penny a word I'd be living under a bridge.

I've spent most of the last two decades looking for short, concise phrases that can pass through crowds quickly.

I think that the only way to appeal to the less well read masses is to get the message down to a level that they can identify with quickly.

If it doesn't fit on a sign it is too long.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/02/keep-working-stop-s7mq0wb5182.jpg


I've linked to some good books that describe what a world without wages will look like.

I'll do it again, not that you are likely to read them, in the aggregate.

Looking Backwards by Ed Bellamy

And Then There Were None, by E. F. Russell

title: What is going on in steemit?
body:
The rewards pool, as it has been explained to me, is not dependent on who votes, how, when, or for what, the pool is what it is.

IF the pool isn't dependent on the total sp of the voters, then why has the trending page dropped so precipitously?

Where has the pool gone?

Payouts were much higher when Steem was a dime?

Has somebody implemented an austerity measure that spreads out the wealth a little less pointly?

Is the fact that there is less at the top evidence of more at the bottom?

title: Clarence the Mighty Martian Killer.
body:
By Kurt Saxon.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/20/pmjb4062d.jpg


http://www.survivalplus.com/defense/page0002.htm

Chapter One:


THE DAY MARS INVADED WASHINGTON


Clarence hated Martians. He had hated them since he'd watched a science fiction story on Martian invaders a few weeks before on the ward's TV. This hatred and then fear was reinforced by a rerun of the old Kevin McCarthy version of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers". He was the only person in the State Hospital who realized the Martians were getting in just like plant pods, growing bodies occupied by the souls of Martians.

To Clarence, movies were true and on purpose. They were made and shown to alert him to the dangers to those he loved, which was everybody. He retained them and called up incidents from them in flashbacks whenever he was uncertain. His guides saw to that.

So Clarence knew all about the Martians. But his doctor would not believe him. Not

author: freebornangel
title: Should the Steemit account vote to encourage users?
body:
I must not have been clear yesterday.

The proposal was that the @steemit account start voting for folks.

I proposed that we find a way to make that voting equitable.

I'd think that it wouldn't be hard to set the bot to vote only people that it hadn't voted in the last 30 days.

I haven't seen recent stats on how many posts are going up a month, but i'd think a 10% vote from the steemit account would be a nice boost.

Much better than a kick in the pants.


Have a perfectly peaceful day!

FBA

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/01/billhicks2793e.jpg
root_title: Should the Steemit account vote to encourage users?

author: freebornangel
title: For a few cents more,...
body:
We could have a whale come by and upvote us at 100% power!!

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/12/28/utopai2e02f.jpg


I'm sure that we could reach consensus on everybody wanting the biggest whale of all to come by and vote us once a month.

IF you disagree with having a whale vote your content, despite it being the worst post ever posted out of all the posts ever, then speak up and let us know.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/12/28/emmaprostitution996fc.jpg


My proposal is that the steemit account should vote the 40 votes a day that is optimal to maintaining voting power.

I think that there should be a bot put in place that votes the lowest sp first, but works it's way through all active posters so that each account gets one sequential vote.

Once the bot votes you, you shouldn't get another vote until everybody with a post in the last 30 days has had theirs.

title: Who is going to put the email feature up?
body:
<iframe width="1280" height="720" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/i28UEoLXVFQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


One of ya'll in the steem community could set up an encrypted email service, I'm sure.

So, the questions are who, when, and what would that cost.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/28/6036930776845598890b961.jpg


As a dedicated frugal shopper I would hope that we could crowdfund a free  option for all members.

Perhaps a small ongoing subscription fee, maybe the value of ten votes per month?


I'd like to finance it through votes, but that is unfair to the authors that don't use it.

title: Put your money where you mouth is,....

Ok, steemit, I see a lot of ya'll saying you are here for the community and the content.

Then I see the same people voting with bots in curation trails that follows those that earn the most money.

That seems inconsistent to me, so I came up with an alternative.

I first vote what I like, or don't like but appreciate the effort at changing my mind, in my feed of folks that I follow because they voted for me.

Then I go here: https://steemit.com/cashout

I limit my votes to those with less than 10 votes and whose efforts I want to encourage.

I still run my steemvoter but to limited number of low post authors that I would look to support if I was doing it manually.


Now, does that get the highest curation rewards?

NO.

Does that put my money where my mouth is on not being here sol

author: freebornangel
title: Ecuador's Standing Rock.
body:
https://intercontinentalcry.org/ecuadors-standing-rock/

The Shuar community of Nankints in Ecuador’s Southern Amazon region was evicted in August 2016 to make way for a Chinese copper mega-mining project. The mining company, through a court order, has claimed these indigenous territories without prior consultation or consent from the affected communities, who have lived there for hundreds of years. The land allocated for the project covers over 41,000 hectares and the forced evacuation of other Shuar communities is expected.

Since the August eviction, the county of San Juan Bosco has been militarized to quell protest. In November, several Shuar people attempted to reclaim the indigenous territory of Nankints within the San Juan Bosco county. Clashes broke out with police and military personnel guarding the mining camp, leaving several injured. The Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of Ecuador (CONAIE), and the Confederation of Indigenous Nationalities of the

title: Pennies from heaven?
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/12/05/5656297486302699525775a.jpg


If you took the time vote for authors that you like up to their 30 day payout window rather then just voting for the newest and latest, it's possible that you will help yourself, and the authors, more.

Votes that are made in the second payout window go into their own pool that may, or may not, increase the value transferred by you to the author.

I'd think that data on this is lacking.

Perhaps you will decide that voting the older posts of a few authors are better than rewarding flashes in the pan that come through the twitter (new) feed when you run out of folks in your personal feed.

I know I am going to start ignoring the trending in favor of finding older material that deserves the money more, imo.


You, of course, must do as you please.



Have a perfectly peaceful day!<

New video from the fierce riot that “exploded” in Athens on December 6, 2016, commemorating the 8th year since 15 years old Alexis Grigoropoulos murdered in cold blood by a policeman in the Exarcheia neighborhood of Athens, on December 6, 2008.

Everything started a few minutes after 9 pm, on the night of 6 December 2008, when a tense argument between two cops and a group of youngsters ended with the policemen leaving the scene, but only for the murderers to park their patrol car a few blocks away and return to confront the kids with their guns. One of the two cops (Korkoneas) aimed towards the kids and fired two shots. One of the bullets struck 15 years old Alexis Grigo

author: freebornangel
title: Lucy Parsons
body:
More dangerous than a 1000 rioters,....


<iframe width="520" height="293" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m1AOZlUflgo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Lucy Eldine Gonzalez Parsons (c. 1853 – March 7, 1942) was an American labor organizer, radical socialist and anarchist communist. She is remembered as a powerful orator. 

Parsons entered the radical movement following her marriage to newspaper editor Albert Parsons and moved with him from Texas to Chicago, where she contributed to the newspaper he famously edited – The Alarm. 

Following her husband’s 1887 execution in conjunction with the Haymarket Affair, Parsons remained a leading American radical activist as a founder of the Industrial Workers of the World and member of other political organizations.


Thanks for learning about history that has been denied to you by design,...


FBA
root_title: Lucy Parsons

https://intercontinentalcry.org/dakota-access-pipeline-bursts/

From the article:


Pipelines leak. It’s what they do. And the Dakota Access pipeline will be no exception.

The 1,168 mile-long pipeline is intended to transport crude oil from the Bakken oil fields in North Dakota to Patoka, Illinois, passing through South Dakota and Iowa. From there, it will connect with another pipeline to transfer oil to terminals and refineries along the Gulf of México.

However, its construction has hit a snag in Standing Rock, North Dakota. Since September the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe and allies from around the world have been pushing hard to prevent the pipeline from cutting through Sioux Treaty territory.


https://intercontinentalcry.org/

title: What is going on with me being blocked from powering down?
body:
I mean, it's bad enough that the new folks are getting 50 steem for signing up and I had to start at three, but now that I have my 10x (thanks @steemsports!!), I still can't power down?

I don't really want to exit the platform, and my curation awards are already plenty low, but the fact that I am being blocked when I have met the conditions set at the outset is rubbing me the wrong way.

I get that folks would create accounts just to cash out that 50 steem, but I have clearly demonstrated that I am not one of those, I don't have the coding skills to create the bots needed to make that profitable.

I think instead of requiring 10x the amount started with that perhaps a other metrics could be used, ie, number of posts, number of followers, reputation, use of the platform, whatever, but to put out a hurdle and then the hurdle be false, raised after the fact, that is not conducive to bringing in the masses.

So, can somebody please tell me why I can't power down even

title: Insurectionary Anarchism
body:
<iframe width="476" height="268" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iwwosQvWxig" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


Illegalism is an anarchist philosophy that developed primarily in France, Italy, Belgium, and Switzerland during the early 1900s as an outgrowth of individualist anarchism.

The illegalists openly embraced criminality as a lifestyle.

Not to be confused with the concept of "popular illegalisms" created by Michel Foucault in Discipline and Punish.


Emergence

Illegalism first rose to prominence among a generation of Europeans inspired by the unrest of the 1890s, during which Ravachol, Émile Henry, Auguste Vaillant, and Caserio committed daring crimes in the name of anarchism, in what is known as propaganda of the deed.


Influenced by theorist Max Stirner's egoism, the illegalists in France broke from anarchists like Clément Duval and Marius Jacob who justified theft with a theor
root_title: Insurectionary Anarchism

title: Michail Bakunin September 1870
body:
<iframe width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Gu2pVPWGYMQ?list=PLK9Sc5q_4K6aNajVLKtkaAB1JGmKyccf2" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

The Paris Commune and the Idea of the State 

Well, then, who am I, and what is it that prompts me to publish this work at this time? 

I am an impassioned seeker of the truth, and as bitter an enemy of the vicious fictions used by the established order — an order which has profited from all the religious, metaphysical, political, juridical, economic, and social infamies of all times — to brutalize and enslave the world. 
I am a fanatical lover of liberty. 

I consider it the only environment in which human intelligence, dignity, and happiness can thrive and develop. 

I do not mean that formal liberty which is dispensed, measured out, and regulated by the State; for this is a perennial lie and represents nothing but the privilege of a few, based upon the servitude of the remainder. 

Nor do I mean that individualist, egoist, base, and fraudulent
root_title: Michail Bakunin September 1870

body:
<iframe width="854" height="480" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KOQ4pkUAFbA" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>


The frogs were hanging out in the pond.

One day some of them got tired of just jumping and swimming.

They prayed to the great frog, 'Oh, great frog, send us a king.'.

The great frog said, 'But I am your king.'

The regular frogs said, 'Yeah, we know, but we want a king we can see and touch.'

So the great frog sent them a log.

The little frogs were soooo happy.

They could frolic in the water and lay on the log to get some sun.

Life was good.

Then the frogs got bored, again.

They prayed to the great frog, 'Oh great frog this king is boring, send us a king that does more than float around.'

So, the great frog sent them a stork.

author: freebornangel
title: So you call yourself an anarchist?
body:
Maybe an agorist or voluntaryist?

Which label you use to communicate your ideas to others is not really important.
What is important is the definitions behind the words.

Truth be known, most of us are communist.
http://www.gutenberg.org/files/624/624-h/624-h.htm
No, not what happened in Russia or China, neither of which was communist, but were state owned crapitalust dictatorships much like America today.
Here is a link: https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/emma-goldman-there-is-no-communism-in-russia
I would have made it a link but the editor buttons aren't up there.
What is up with that?

You know, I think until that editor is back there isn't much point in me posting because I can't link my sources.

So, if you know how to help me overcome this that telling me would be great.

title: Just another day in the only paradise we get. Make the best of it?
body:
Ya know, it's a good thing that I didn't come here expecting to pay back any loans.

I'd be facing the collectors by now.

Well, looks like the slogging will be continuing.

Thanks to all of you that will take the time to read and/or upvote this.

I'm not here to make money, I am here to make history.

When the revolution finally frees us from rule by bully people will go back to document those that put their lives out there in defense of the freedom most people didn't miss.

I should be one of the few in the class of '85.

Perhaps, with a little encouragement, I will type up how I became an anarchist.

Maybe Berwick will beat me to the punch and ask me himself, but I doubt it.

This square peg doesn't willingly squeeze through round holes.

Me and Al Camus.

Anyway,...

Thank you for being here.

P

Not having to think for yourself or worry about meeting the demands of survival.

Your masters will take care of you.

Every Sunday

The workers(including day to day managers, sometimes the same person) in the mines and factories exist outside the crapitalust paradigm.
If the accounting department doesn't account they wouldn't know it for weeks or months, look at Enron.
Work is real world, justifications that make some wealthy and most poor are not.

If I wrote my rules down on paper would you follow them? Of course, not.
Look what they did to David Koresh for being too uppity.
So, we see words on paper don't control where nobody obeys.

100% of the consumer goods in the world are the production of the hands of the wage slaves in the mines and factories.

Crapitalusts.

title: Are you ready to walk on the wild side?
body:
All activism comes at the risk of everything you value, if freedom isn't worth the lives of your children, stop now. 

Bow to your slavemasters, and teach your children to do the same. 


But, if your children's utopia is worth your life today then pull up a chair and open your mind. You may find your answers in this conversation.


Keep working, stop paying is the short route to utopia. 


Everybody from the guy that collected the raw materials to the girl that delivered your finished product to your door, or the shelf, did so with absolutely no knowledge of what was happening in accounting. 

You with me? 


If accounting never accounted for anything they would not know and could continue working as if everything was perfectly crapitalistic. 

I'm sure you agree so far? 


Ok, when everything is free demand at the factories will go up.

title: My vision of what steem should look like.
body:
I'm not silly enough to think i could do a better job than the guy that put his heart and soul into building the place.

So, i say we return to the way he left it.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmYz5dgC4JKrXxBzTpPX1LuWyKjDNzWCFTQEnD6pQ43KSf/what-is-holding-5ad67b.jpg

I'd keep stinc's ability to delegate, rather than give, steem to new accounts.

I might even agree to keep the ability universal, i do delegate half of my steem power.

I give it to people and causes i support, not vote bots or paying customers.

But the changes they promised would lead to mass adoption have resulted in a 97% rejection rate.

I'd say that math was crystal clear.


@dan had already crunched the numbers, he is a math guy after all, and his solution was the n2.


Now, at the time of the hardfork the word from on high was that square roots couldnt work in reward curves due to blockchain requirements, but that was obviously a lie, the curation curve

I mean, I know I don't need the karma attached to exploitive employment practices, I got enough problems.


My question is about how 'we' want the internal market to work.

Should we have to get a bot?

Should we restrict bots?

I don't know.

The person I'd ask hasn't responded to me the last couple of times I asked him questions, but I get it, he likes his things neatly boxed, and knowing their place, and I don't really fit into that category.


I think the playing field could be leveled by requiring an age of at least one minute before any trade could occur.

This would give regular folks a chance to get their bid's considered in a timel

author: freebornangel
title: Rule by force is the problem.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/08/when-you-force-32jv03.jpg9df82.png


From the very earliest days of our lives we learn that violence is the way to get what we want.

It is a very rare child that doesn't learn, and learn early, that we are controlled by those around us most willing to use violence.


Why do you do what mom says?

Because she will launch shoes very accurately.


Why do you do what dad says?

Because he gets all scary when he yells.


Why do you not play behind the school after school?

Because the bullies will get you.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/28/46030197492390708395dba.jpg


We allow this rule by force paradigm, despicably created to control us, to gain a foothold over our everyday lives because it is one of the oldest life lessons in our memories.


Never have we known a time that we were not kept in bounds by the referees.
root_title: Rule by force is the problem.

body:

We used to have a feed called cashout that would let us watch as posts hit their payout times.

I used this feed to shame the whales about their lack of concern for the little guys.

Now that feed is dead, thank you HF17.


Golos still has their's.  https://golos.io/cashout


Why did stinc decide to hide what is happening at payout?

Why is stinc soooo prone to doing things that make everybody else wonder about their motivations?

What motivation ends in denying transparency on the platform?


The current feed is https://steemit.com/payout and https://steemit.com/payout_comments.

The feeds don't give a chronology of what is getting paid out, it appears random to me.


So, what gives, Steemit inc?

Why are you hiding this info from normal users?

body:
Once this hf17 fiasco levels out perhaps we need to revisit the parameters of the experiment.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmcSk4Rs4RjpecUjgwKW2PW38rDLtjcDbmpiX6TdhGvhtw/steemit-is-the.jpg


Has the 800mvest limit done a good enough job?

Would 400mvest give even more power to the little guys?

We already see what letting the whales run wild gets us.

Why would letting their sycophants run wild improve who makes it to the trending page?

Sock puppets alone mean that the same folks that gave us .07usd steem are still at the helm.

What level of whale disconnect is needed to make being a minnow attractive to 'good' content creators?

If limiting voting power to 800mvests has energized the base enough that a hf17 had to be pushed through to get many of them to quit in disgust, how much would a limit that doubles their impact do for the bottom line.


Steemit was rolled out as primarily a way to onboard folks to crypto-currencie

Energy Fuels Completes Drilling Near Grand Canyon

Uranium Mining Could Begin June 2017 at Sacred Site

by Haul No!

April 16, 2017

GRAND CANYON, AZ — Energy Fuels Inc. recently reported that it has completed drilling of it’s uranium mine shaft at Canyon Mine, which is located just miles from the Grand Canyon. The company is now creating a plan based upon results of the drilling before it can resume construction at the site. They have also temporarily fired most of their workers.

Energy Fuels threatens that uranium ore extraction could begin at Canyon Mine as early as June 2017.

author: freebornangel
title: The reward curve is not the problem.
body:
The reward curve is super linear to solve abuse issues.

Linear voting has problems with gaming for rewards.


If we made a stairstep plan that mapped out how to up the limit on the 'experiment' that tracks increase in the market cap we can keep super linear voting, while not running off all the newbs.


We only have to do the math that ups voting limits, currently 800mv, as I understand it, with an increase in market value.

Inflation is based on market value, as it rises the reward pool grows.

At some point, I presume, we grow large enough to support super linear voting.

Maybe we don't.


Until then I think we should reduce the limit to 400mv to give yet another boost to the newbs.


Newbs are where we are gonna find our 1 million 100usd investors.

The more welcoming we make this for the newbs the quicker we can raise the voting limit.

The math can be worked out to ensure a smooth seam
root_title: The reward curve is not the problem.

title: Full course in glass blowing!!
body:
Have you ever wanted to learn the art of glassblowing?

It's not that complicated, you just need the right tools, a little know how, and practice.

You could set up a workshop in your garage, if it was fireproof.

title: Why the end of the market economy is inevitable.
body:
I'd like to assert it will be because the crapitalust dupes finally read a book, but even a utopic dreamer like myself knows those odds are somewhere between a fat chance and zero.
Morons dont read,...

But, that doesnt invalidate my assertion.
The market economy is gonna end.
Only a couple things need to happen before we can all be replaced by robots and central dining areas.

We know the elites have their plans.
They spell them out for all to see in 8 modern languages and 4 ancient scripts.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_Guidestones
![georgia-guidestones_t5.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmV5sc4csL3hwK2FKc2RCnftYL6etk4hJFEq2TheLSMKM2/georgia-guidestones_t5.jpg)
[Source](https://vacationidea.com/georgia/georgia-guidestones.html)
If there are 8b of us then only 1 in 16 of us survive.
No need for markets then, we will all be slaves eating in mess halls.

Or, on any given tuesday we can exercise our collective power and simply continue to do the work while refusing to pay for anything.

title: How to survive in a down business cycle.
body:
Keep working, stop paying.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/10/keep-working-stop-r8ly2l00ae8.jpg


It really is this simple.

Those that worked up to today made all the goods on sale at the local stores.

When the business cycle dips they can't afford to buy those products back from the crapitalusts.

By simply continuing to work producing the goods the goods will continue to be on the shelves whether the accounting department falls in a lake, fudges the numbers, or get real jobs.

The accounting department is irrelevant to the production of goods.

The cashiers can be replaced by inventory management software that tracks what is taken from the stores in order to re-order the goods.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/10/keep-working-stop-4rswmh54c8a.jpg


The only reason you didn't think of this yourself is that you were intentionally misled by those that control your sources of information.

You have been

author: freebornangel
title: If you read it, vote it.
body:
An experiment.


Steemizens currently tend to want to pick winners.

We all like winners, right?

Losers, not so much.

The contradiction in this is that by picking winners we create losers.

Not all bad if you buy into the popularity scheme.

Not so popular with those deemed unworthy.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmWiWpLv8GKwkh5HNKbYAC1WbVug142QCVReGECfPZAG9n/popular-people.jpg


I know my content is getting read, and passed up, by far more voting weight than is currently showing up in the totals.

I don't like it, but that is how it is.

So, I devised an experiment of my own.


My experiment has been to vote everything I read, and to read everything I vote.

I use @steemvoter to populate a read first list, and then vote what I have time to read.

If I don't like what I read I vote with a lower percentage.

By voting even when I don't like the content I don't punish unpopular speec
root_title: If you read it, vote it.

No worries about the lights going off, it's paid, too!

In fact, you now have time to move around and meet your neighbors.

No longer do you have to slave 40 to 60 hours a week in the mines, factories, and warehouses of the stockholders.

You still have to put in 20 hours, that is the keep working part, but you got your whole life to get your 20.000 hours in, it doesn't have to be right now.

author: freebornangel
title: Crime is the exclusive domain of the sovereign.
body:
As I've  been saying, the game is new to us, we are not new to the game.

Often I've wanted to look back and see the world as if what I was discovering was actually a discovery.

But, the truth is that the game is as old as the first two men that decided it was easier to hit their neighbors with sticks than to work real jobs.

Some time after that one of their progeny noticed that if you could fool the folks into thinking that they were free they would submit to slavery willingly.

Mikhail Bakunin came along in the mid 19th century and was putting his voice to what a lot of folks were feeling.

One of his more famous quotes is that crime is the exclusive domain of the sovereign.

This is why we will not be locking her, or anybody else, up.

The key benefit of ruling is doing so with impunity.

The little lives don't count, so it is ok to snuff them.

Those of you not ready to stand up for your freedom are buying into this game.

You a
root_title: Crime is the exclusive domain of the sovereign.

When the balloon goes up it will be too late to get ready.

If you come to my farm with an ounce of gold you might find it only gets you a chicken.

Better to have chickens, and the ability to convert them to food, than gold, for most of us.

But good luck selling that to the true beliebers.

Crapitalism is the one true god, and gold it's king.

title: Building Steemit is about establishing customs.
body:
All cultures thrive or die according to their customs.

If we eat the producers the non-producers will degenerate into savages.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmceWo7McKs84iPy1tHrD1ergTTN7GojwiR9TF8q4thdiD/lothroprevolt.jpg


It's just the nature of cultures.

Here on Steemit we don't like to see folks spamming the comments with posts.

Although it's my opinion that we should encourage linking relevant content.

Hopefully by putting brackets around your text and parenthesis around your link, no space.

https://steemitimages.com/DQma7WTZpLbBFGinXEq82vhcDsfyk8iia2HgThzsyP3n5Lb/its-a-simple-59318c.jpg


We don't like to see folks abuse other folks.

It is this culture of expected standards of behavior that will define our growth.

I don't know about you all, but I sure like seeing my vote give out dimes on posts with lots of prior votes.

title: Do you want to get your own numbers for your posts?
body:
I have been looking for somebody to ask this question of the blockchain for me for close to a year.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/28/good-morning-steemitada40.jpg



Finally, thanks to https://www.asksteem.com/ now I just query the blockchain myself.


This is the code that pulls posts from the last seven days with payouts less than a dollar.

net_votes:<20 AND created:[2017-06-05 TO 2017-06-11] AND pending_payout_value:<1

If the age is more than 6 days 12 hours then you can't upvote, but this list is in reverse order so that down is back through time, just like it should be.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/29/60469306229523662364491.jpg


If you are here to help the little guys you can find them there, just change the dates, and keep an eye out for updates from @thekyle that simplify the matter.

title: Do you wonder how many of your votes come by bots?
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/25/13825647234a1.jpg


I was wondering how many of those votes I was getting were by bots.

I asked myself, are those votes automatic?

Does my content not matter to this many supporters?

I'm ok with that, better to give out an average to a happy few, rather than ride the ups and downs as defined by fickle popularity, imo.

I think that last post has given me an answer.

Welcome to Steemit!!


Not many automatic votes and a definite lack of support for that content.

Who knew that the little guy getting support would be soooo offensive to folks not offended by my regular content?


I guess it just goes to show that folks are reading and voting, or not, what I have to say.

Good to know!



Have a perfectly peaceful day.

Keep working, stop paying.

author: freebornangel
title: I'm at a crossroads, Steemizens, I need help with a decision.
body:
I've gotten tied up in this project bike, and I have enough in it that I hate to just let it sit in it's shed, but I have reached the point that I can't justify putting more money into it.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmS524dUjqFELpqxjMjDzHScug7Stb18HGMrtc241HYLr9/IMG_0016.JPG

https://steemitimages.com/DQmf6CBJV1AZkWyhVSg6sP962SuwE1QHSpaq76VZc5XJ6ey/IMG_0017.JPG


It has been a two year project.

The first year was getting the previous swing arm bolt out.

It had been cut, drilled, and given up on by the fella that had the frame before me.

We beat on it ourselves, half heartedly.

We finally got it out, but not before chasing a lot of false leads.

It was comical, I had a crash helmet and a punch on a stick, and my buddy had the big hammer with the questionable handle.

He said, 'Hit it hard enough, and it will come out.', I was having my doubts until the third lick when it moved, the next two hits confirmed we wasn't trippin',
root_title: I'm at a crossroads, Steemizens, I need help with a decision.

The email said you had it all under control.  #67272

You had the transfer wallet number you needed, you validated the transfer had occured, but it has been 8 days since then.

I'm sure you are swamped with support tickets, but this support ticket has had everything done for 8 days.

Making me wait at this point is just poor customer service.

When your support rep says everything looks good, and then I still haven't been refunded 8 days later, perhaps you can understand my need to speak up.

title: Josiah Warren, first 'murican (A)narchist.
body:
So, I am guilty of mostly presenting my own proposal, mostly because it suits me better.

I like the idea of putting in whatever minimum of labor is necessary to insure that I don't live as a parasite on those that have  worked before me, while not enriching further those that don't work at all.

I don't have a problem working for my living, I just don't like the cut that the crapitalusts think I got coming.


Seems to me the easiest way to do this is to keep working, while not paying for anything. 

I think letting the blockchain keep track of my consumption, the average amount of man hours needed to keep us all even, and when my light stops blinking, I no longer have to seek out labor that needs done for the human race, I can just do what I want to do.


Now, what I propose is not the only way to bring on the robots without soft kill weapons, as the Clinton/bush cr

title: It ain't braggin', if you can do it.
body:
Welcome to Voices from the Shallows #2!

Not everybody who is somebody is popular already on Steemit.

Some people who are somebody can't get a break, on Steemit.

Huh? @skeptic?


Anyway, here is a minnow swimming in the shallows that could alter the paradigm.

He can't do it alone.

He won't make it to the trending page, today.

Lord knows I won't be carrying him to the trending page, but some of you can, dear readers.


The Marcratic Method is known to a select few.

If you take the time to watch a few minutes of this you still won't know about the Marcratic method.

title: Saul Alinsky, Man of many talents.
body:
Perhaps you have read The Jungle by Upton Sinclair? 

It describes the life in the back of the yards.


Saul made his name by changing life for folks at the bottom of the crapitalust pyramid.

Upton Sinclair wrote a book, Saul organized the meetings.

He got out of the ivory tower and lived life rather than write about it.


It is no wonder that they seek to slander his works at every opportunity.

I don't know, I wasn't there.

title: Are you a speculator?
body:
Boy, I sure am.

Whenever something doesn't go in a way that I thought made sense I immediately speculate something.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/28/6056206611167395978f360.jpg


I will tell a story that was related to me by proximity,....


So, there was 5 of us in this cell at the county jail.

This old guy was playing solitaire at the only seat and level spot not a bed or floor.

He mumbled, 'Fuck Christ'.

Which was observed to be unusual among the others.

He did it, again, 'Fuck Christ.'

Now, the others in the room were starting to give him room, what with the potential for lightning, and all.

And then it dawned on some of them that the old guy was Jewish, he didn't believe in a Christ,....

That was the end of it.

Some folks tried to forget.

He got out a few days later, the owner of the tow truck didn't want to press charges on a guy whose pickup he had 'impounded' and held for

author: freebornangel
title: Subforum for #inthewind
body:
Can we get a subforum somewhere for #inthewind motorcycle posts?
I hesitate to put it under motorsports as lifestyle would be closer to what most non-racing riders do.
This will give a central place to look for folks that like to ride to live.


I'm still in favor of an editor, because I don't want to type out all the strokes needed to make a link when I can copy and paste, but I would be satisfied with a cheat sheet that was a little more concise than the [current one](https://blog.ghost.org/markdown/).

The preview is working just fine.
Drag and drop for pics is needed, but I guess that would require additional expense to hold the pics?

There are not too many reasons that will keep me from posting here everyday.

It is almost there for me, thanks @jesta.
I have been trapped on forums ever since fedbook blocked me in '12, and prefer a forum's ability to centralize information better than what we get posting posts to Steemit.

author: freebornangel
title: What can we learn from the hardfork?
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/12/05/untitled339fb.png


So, if we apply the lessons learned from this hardfork to the larger world around us we can see what will happen when the 1% no longer suck it all up.

Imagine what the world would look like if we could reset the reward structure of the whole world.

It really is as easy done as a hardfork.

We just pick a day, say, Tuesday.

On Tuesday we all just go to work like nothing was any different.

Except now instead of needing money to pay for things you just got to wait until supply meets demand.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/10/keep-working-stop-r8ly2l00ae8.jpg


Some things are gonna be scarce until production ramps up.

Other things will have their demand go to zero, and those folks will need to look for some other way to contribute.

I would think that shortening product miles would be a good efficiency investment.

http://www.steemimg.com/im
root_title: What can we learn from the hardfork?

Kurt Saxon may have been a little premature in his doom and gloom in the 80's, but it looks like his prophecies are coming to be.

Too bad he didn't live to survive them.

He did leave us with the hard work done.

He curated what was available in the diy genre and left us with an amazing amount of reading to do.

When his other books come into the public domain we will have even more to look through.

Today I have brought some of his community defense plans to your attention.

I hope you use the info wisely, there is a war on for your mind,...

author: freebornangel
title: Resteems for old posts.
body:
Some days I just don't have the energy to pump out good content.

I'm sure, dear reader, that some days I just don't bring it.

Perhaps you feel the same.


I propose that we be allowed to resteem our own posts.

Now, without some limits this may get tedious, so I propose restrictions on the free use of the resteem button.


1.  No posts newer than 30 days.

2. No posts that have been resteemed in the last 60 days.

3. No more than 3 resteems a week.

4.  Each resteem should be given a marking that indicates that it has been resteemed, and it's past payouts.


I would guess that this would have to be changed at the blockchain because each resteem would have to be a 'new' post for payout purposes.

In this way, authors can get compensated for previous content.

No longer will we only be as good as our last post.

If you like this idea, let the devs know, they won't listen to me alone.</
root_title: Resteems for old posts.

title: Tradeqwik pays!!
body:
If you haven't gotten in on the Viva economy you are definitely missing out.

Yesterday their exchange, @tradeqwik handed out dividends to holders of TQS.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmYBvHf1gQRGR55KekEx1MhkobN6AKUs6obynpLbqpF1w3/you-bought-the-595c22.jpg


Normally they would give out dividends on 20% of the trading fees of the platform, but this time, to make up for past delays, they paid out the dividend on 100% of the fees.

That is 5x's what they promised us for buying into the exchange.

The really great thing about these dividends is that they come in the various coins accepted by the platform.

I am now the proud holder of litecoin, ethereum, and Mexican Pesos that I otherwise wouldn't have.

It's a nice way to get a faucet that doesn't want to lock up your coins for as long as possible.


You can read more at this link:

I mean, if he wasn't interested in being social why would he join a site dedicated to being social?

There is no doubt that the community there is strongly biased towards the anonymous crowd.

They may down play it now, but when I got there in '15 it was all the folks could talk about.

You can't know that you got something wrong unless you entertain ideas that disagree with what you believe is true.

How can you know that crapitalism is not the only way to do things if you never examine alternatives to it?

author: freebornangel
title: Thanks for bearing with me, dear readers.
body:
I've been in a transitional period in my life.

My non-profit hasn't been properly attended to, shut down for way too long.

My posts have deteriorated in quality.

No bout a doubt it, the home team is looking weak.

That will change when I get resituated in something more permanent.

I have been living out of a backpack for almost 4 years.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmbh7uH4r9kbFkNyjGZ7eY1icsCEi8HRM7PMaBuPmM4QZU/profile.jpg


However, I don't think that the fall off in rewards can be attributed entirely to my personal flux.

When I get situated I will take the time to begin learning the code that lets me gather the data I would really like to see make it to the front page, not that it will.

Maybe the data will set my doubts to rest.

I hate thinking that folks are just greedy, but we know that greedy people are out there.

Crapitalism is the game and I would expect the best social media to attract the best crapitalusts.

Today in Steemit History:

The reward pool is at 685,513 steem.

There were 16,043 posts.

The simple math says that is 42.73 steem each.

If we allow 25% for curation rewards then each author could expect that s/he had a cut of 32.04 steem each.

However that is not how Steem works.

I don't know if we can ever bring enough stake to bear on the witnesses to get the hardforks to favor everybody rather than just the insiders, but it's a nice dream.


Enjoy your 42 steem, even if they were voted to somebody else for you.

title: Social engineers at DefCon25.
body:

August 7, 2017   

Las Vegas, NV

Ever since DEFCON 18, there has been a village within the conference dedicated to the art of human hacking, also known as Social Engineering. By the village's definition, social engineering is "any act that influences a person to take an action that may or may not be in their best interest". 

This year, SEVillage not only hosted the Social-Engineer Capture The Flag (SECTF), but also SECTF4Kids, SECTF4Teens and

author: freebornangel
title: Go outside and meat your neighbors!
body:
If you are worried about the crap hitting the fan on the news and want to do something, get out and meat your neighbors.

Now I know that is going to make you look a little weird, but this may be the price you have to pay to avoid riots in your neighborhood.

It's not all that hard, just set your grill up in the front yard and send the kids to invite everybody over for hot dog, hamburger, or something vegan.

Folks that know each other typically talk out their problems.

Even gorillas rarely harm each other in their fights, they toss leaves, thump their chests, but debilitating injuries happen less often.

They know it is detrimental to the survival of the species.

They certainly don't team up into teams that only communicate through violence.

That is reserved for the 'higher' animals, humans.

I mean, who doesn't want to gang up for more rewards, right?

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/25/568774975209615360abf35.jpg
root_title: Go outside and meat your neighbors!

author: freebornangel
title: My two cents.  #4!
body:
Steemit, and stinc, would benefit from making peace with it's content creators, imo.

The price is stagnating because the word is getting out that if you don't brown nose the haves, you will forever be a have not.

There is no point in joining unless you are already popular.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmRa1YqmozXgjcoBhYdpgSNq5S2vWcDazX7X3ugyZrtcz7/stop-claiming-to.jpg


Now, there aren't many people in the world, especially in the developing world, that want to join in for more of the same crap they get handed in real life.


If I got to kiss butt on an old white dude to get a job, well, why would I invest into Steemit for more of the same?

Even if those white dudes ain't so old.

What happens, too often, if you ask me, is that folks come from nothing with fire in their bellies.

Even those that come from limited privilege often take off like they have something to prove, but just as quick as they get comfy, they lose that fire
root_title: My two cents.  #4!

author: freebornangel
title: How, and why, to delegate SP to @spaminator.
body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/11/bush05a97.jpg


Spam, and minnowboosting vote buying schemes, are why you're not getting closer to the ideal post rewards of ~40usd.

If you divide the pool equally each author would get a total of ~40usd for all their posts, each day.

Anything that takes us farther from this goal is bad for everybody except those getting voted more than 40usd in rewards.

Those 1000usd posts means that many, many people got bupkiss.

Yeah, yeah, they earned their sp and can vote it how they please, I get it, but to set up vote bots and to spam the network is beyond my pale.

Spaminator is an attempt to get some of those ill-gotten gains back by downvoting them, but the amount is overwhelming them.

Their downvote has no bite at some point.

You delegating sp to them helps.


Simply take this link, put in your info where it appears obvious to do so.


https://v2.steemconnect.com/si
root_title: How, and why, to delegate SP to @spaminator.

title: How, and why, to delegate some sp to @sherlockholmes.
body:

@Sherlockholmes is working to out the multiple account holders that are using their accounts for scams.

If you don't support that, why are you here?

Simply fill in your username where it says to, figure out how much you can spare in vests(50,000 is about 24sp), paste the link in a browser window, sign in with busy.org's steemconnect, and viola!

A responsible Steemizen is born!


https://v2.steemconnect.com/sign/delegateVestingShares?delegator=yourusernamehere&delegatee=sherlockholmes&vesting_shares=50000.000000%20VESTS


To rescind the delegation just make up the link again, but with 0vests this time, in a week your sp will be returned to your wallet.

Read more here:

https://steemit.com/delegation/@timcliff/tutorial-how-to-delegate-sp-to-another-user-using-the-steemconnect-tool-from-busy-org

title: So, you want to call yourself an Anarchist? #3
body:
Do you know who Leon Czolgosz was?

There is a reason for that, don't you think?

If I was running things secretly, from the background, so that I didn't have to expose the force that keeps me in power, as much, I sure wouldn't go out of my way to expose the ideology of anybody that was opposed to me.

Just like you don't get Howard Zinn until you take specialized classes at certain universities, you don't get anything on Leon in high school.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmRgN6D9RknytXPdqMRSuYTgcpLdYBQp13hHYCKPKettMT/czolgosz.jpg

https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/robert-a-pinkerton-detective-surveillance-of-anarchists

https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/voltairine-de-cleyre-mckinley-s-assassination-from-the-anarchist-standpoint

author: freebornangel
title: Forced PowerDowns of Spam Accounts.
body:
As if the witnesses don't already have enough worries,... 

I think that an option to force an account to power down, in order to cease it's transactions, would be a good thing.


If I am not mistaken simply holding steem or sbd doesn't give you authority to transact, one has to have sp.

That being the case, if a consensus of the witnesses says that you are spamming the network they should be able to force a powerdown of the sp in the account.

The steem and sbd's would still be in your wallet, but if you didn't transfer them out before that last powerdown you will have to find a friend to transfer you enough sp to withdraw it.


I don't know how that would play out irl, but I do consider final action necessary to insure that spammers and scammers don't continue to ruin our good thing.


Perhaps we should go to a referer code in order for new folks to sign up, possibly with group codes to increase ambiguity to origin.
root_title: Forced PowerDowns of Spam Accounts.

author: freebornangel
title: Why you shouldn't support the whalevoters and gangs.
body:
When a whale votes, everybody else's vote loses power.

If a whale votes with enough sp to take up 10% of the votes cast on any given day, that 10% comes at the cost of everybody else that voted.

The only way to spread the math out is if the very largest whales don't vote.

If you join one of the gangs to be better rewarded what eventually happens is only gang members get rewards.

Did you notice the drop off in rewards when they came on the scene?  I did.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/03/25/iww-poster-smallf86e5.jpg


If you are gonna delegate sp to somebody, pick somebody you like and delegate it to them.

If your posts are not getting rewarded, work harder, or longer.

When you buy votes from the whales all you are doing is making them even more powerful, if they voted their full weight our votes are diminished in proportion.

They can literally suck up the pool in such a way that nobody continues to play.


<
root_title: Why you shouldn't support the whalevoters and gangs.

The few are very happy that the many are making them even more influential over who does, and who doesn't, get rewards on this platform.

title: Can I get a little customer service?
body:
It would be nice if somebody would put out a post, or link to one, that explains the curation reward curves.

I've been here over a year and haven't seen one post that explains how the curation reward curves are affected by time, weight, and the reverse auction.

My question is about these little pilot fish that vote me before the reverse auction ends.

Does their place in line change the rewards down stream?

At what point does the order in which your vote occurred start to impact curation rewards?

At what point do these little sucker fish start to harm the host?

https://steemitimages.com/DQmdgDuH44FJbCGVcJDjzxFMaRa1zW447zW4vx26EJtSCAU/dont-look-at-59adc8.jpg



Have a perfectly peaceful day.

body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/02/08/how-do-you-zjg7i19d050.jpg

That thing is an oxymoron.

Moron is the operant term when dealing with one of these.

They claim to be all gung-ho about anarchism, a real true belieber, but they haven't done the barest reading on the subject.

Perhaps they've only read the latest publications, who knows.

The facts are that anarchism has always been a response in defiance of crapitalism.

That is just a fact.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmQ3FZccVtPmCqdJsMSLCkQrZdZ8QTW5taq3c7qJrh51pd/i-prefer-selflearnin.jpg


Just as you wouldn't want to have your bridge built by somebody that had never read an engineering textbook, why would you accept as authoritative a viewpoint from someone that so clearly contradicts the foundational documents of the philosophy?

author: freebornangel
title: Ferguson, an after action review.
body:
This is an AAR of what went down in Ferguson from the purview of the folks that made it happen.

You call yourself an anarchist, do you know what it takes to wear that term in context?

Read, and learn.

Your minds' freedom depends upon it,....

   

In February 2015, after months of confrontations in response to the murder of Michael Brown, a number of anarchists from the St. Louis area gathered to reflect on their experiences in the streets, their role in predominantly black struggles, and the ramifications of arson and gunfire in protests. 

We had sent some discussion questions to get the ball rolling, but mostly they let the conversation take its own course, speaking with admirable frankness and vulnerability. 

The result is an important historical document, of interest to anyone who might one day participate in something similar. 

This transcript originally appeared in

title: Voices from the Shallows. #11
body:
As you may know I use these reports to highlight Steemizens that haven't broken into the mainstream.

It's not easy getting positive attention around here, it probably never will be.

The reward pool is only so large.

The whales only vote for so many people.

Lucky you if you can get rewarded, you must have put in some effort.

Luckily, for you, that effort wasn't rewarded in the same fashion as today's voices.

@skeptic was there, but he didn't have the heart to quit.

He still gets pushed around in a continuing dustup with the one who's name is dangerous to speak.

Not for me so much, and probably not for you, but @skeptic, for sure, should not be saying it.

author: freebornangel
title: My two cents,...
body:
Some days I just don't have the energy to pump out good content.

I'm sure, dear reader, that some days I just don't bring my 'A' game.

Perhaps you feel the same.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmRZakgpv4CmAss8djv8DB1fc2q6nBWvyfdNYyE7Exhc5P/this-is-the-59ed3f.jpg

I propose that we be allowed to resteem our own posts.

Now, without some limits this may get tedious, so I propose restrictions on the free use of the resteem button.


1. No posts newer than 30 days.

2. No posts that have been resteemed in the last 60 days.

3. No more than 3 resteems a week.

4. Each resteem should be given a marking that indicates that it has been resteemed, and it's amount of past payouts.


I would guess that this would have to be changed at the blockchain because each resteem would have to be a 'new' post for payout purposes.

In this way, authors can get compensated for previous content.

No longer will we only be as good as our la
root_title: My two cents,...

author: freebornangel
title: Greece: Alternative Economies and Community Currencies. Parts 1, 2, and 3.
body:

author: freebornangel
title: When you gang up to increase rewards you disadvantage everybody else.
body:
Using the voting bots to improve your visibility does long term damage to Steem.

The money is concentrated into hands that already have enough to make steem worthless and it comes from rewards that could have gone to an author of actual 'good' content.

The distribution of steem is so lopsided that it was easier to take away a reward curve that rewarded later minnow votes with increased value because the whales couldn't control their voting and had swallowed the entire reward pool.

The n2 didn't need to go, those that couldn't keep their hands out of the till needed to go, instead now they trade their votes for sbd.

Yeah, sticn!

The only way to even out the playing field, so that folks will want to play, may be for the whales to undelegated except to @steemcleaners and @spaminator, vote very low powers, and stop trading votes for cash, imo.

Then we can discuss those gangs that mimic whales.




I came here expecting to

title: How to delegate sp.
body:

Paste the link in a browser url bar, sign into busy.org with your active key and you should see a successful delegation screen.

https://v2.steemconnect.com/sign/delegateVestingShares?delegator=yourusernamehere&delegatee=recieverofdelegationusername&vesting_shares=50000.000000%20VESTS

title: Just another crapitalistic day in paradise. #18
body:
I try not to complain too much, I am, after all, the sum of my choices, and I don't have it sooo bad.

Today I am enjoying a day off, given to me by my renter as an incentive to believe that I am free.

I know that were I to actually be free I would only do work that I really enjoy rather than work I don't mind doing in pursuit of later goals.

I just want to retire to a town where it is warm and this job will have put me over the top when it is done, potentially.

Really I do it because I know what it is to not have someone when you really need them and it makes me feel bad to inflict that feeling on others, absent cause.

Ergo, just another crappy day in paradise.

title: So, you want to call yourself an anarchist? #3
body:
Do you know who Leon Czolgosz was?

https://steemitimages.com/DQmRgN6D9RknytXPdqMRSuYTgcpLdYBQp13hHYCKPKettMT/leon%20czolgz.jpg


There is a reason for that, don't you think?

If I was running things secretly, from the background, so that I didn't have to expose the force that keeps me in power, as much, I sure wouldn't go out of my way to expose the ideology of anybody that was opposed to me.

Just like you don't get Howard Zinn until you take specialized classes at certain universities, you don't get anything on Leon in high school.

Here are three reports from contemporaries to the scene:

https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/robert-a-pinkerton-detective-surveillance-of-anarchists
