author: freebornangel
title: Report from the shallows. #12
body:
Today in reward pool history the top ten voters gave out ~30% of the reward pool.

There were 27,512 active accounts in the last 24 hours.

$24,106,497 have been distributed by the steem blockchain.

The top 50 authors have received $4,494,326.90.

Only 61,002 authors have received more than a dollar.

The number one author has received $234,603.59.

The 50th author received $56,329.56.

If we have 400k+ accounts, it is telling that only 140,378 have received more than $.01.

Who are all those accounts that have nothing?

Sources: 1, 2.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/12/well-sukkah-life.jpg22552.png



Have a perfectly peaceful day.
root_title: Report from the shallows. #12

author: freebornangel
title: Are you tired of being pushed around by fascists?
body:
Well, get your party hats, and signs, ready for the 18th of November.

Most of us don't agree with all of the various reasons that crowds people up in the streets.

For instance, I am not gay, I have no desire to rally for gay pride.

But, if the gay pride people show up at a Bash the Fascist rally, I am all for that.

We need all the help we can get to repudiate fascism, imo.

Perhaps it is some save whale folks, whatever your cause is feel free to join the crowd.

Only through demonstrating our numerical superiority to ourselves can we see hope at the end of the seeking freedom tunnel.

If we divide into groups and have an internecine war it only benefits those that rule us by force.

Which is the problem all of us face.

Comply or die is getting old to me and I am ready to start throwing rocks in the streets.

Are you?


https://refusefascism.org/


http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/10/no-one-rules

body:
http://www.steemimg.com/images/2016/11/24/solzhenitsynb8ecd.jpg


On trial are two medics, a journalist, and three ordinary citizens.

Cop #1 testifies to being at the open to the public logistics meeting where, among other things, medics were organized for the anticipated injuries inflicted by those that rule us by force.

Project Veritas was on the scene, and provided video evidence from, the planning meeting.

Cop #1 provided his recollections.

Couldn't provide testimony about the video being doctored.

The prosecutors admitted submitting a doctored video that hid the identity of the PV employee that provided the video.

"Entrapment journalism", anybody? Admitted tactic of the Project 'Veritas'.

The wealthy create nothing, why do we sell our labor to them for the lowest wages while buying it back at whatever the market will bear?

Maybe you want to free the world?

If me and my friends can't vote ourselves legitimate power over you, you and your friends can't vote yourselves legitimate power over us, neither can they do it to them, capisce?

This being the case, the only power that cops have over you is the power you give them.

When the cop comes to you with your infractions, asking for your papers because you live in a police state, do you ask him to prove his claim of power over you, or do you wuss out and say, 'yyye-ssssir' and 'can I help you get them cuffs on me', and knock people out of the way to get in the car?

Because if you do, you ain't helpin', stop doing that.

Before you know it we will all work the majority of our lives for the lowest wages possible to pay for them to live better than most historical kings.

author: freebornangel
title: Why I will have to give up my SteemVoter.
body:
I use SteemVoter to keep up to date on the folks that I follow.

I would use steemit's follow list, but I subscribe everybody that upvotes me, and as you can well imagine that list gets populated pretty quickly, despite my apparent lack of popularity.

So, I was really disappointed by the response I got in their discord that the price will remain 3sbd.

My steemvoter hasn't returned all that much in value to me by way of curation rewards, I follow less popular authors, in many months.

For a time after the hardfork I was doing ok, but since delegation has kicked in my curation rewards average less than 3steem a week.

Thanks for selling out my vote power to line your own pockets, whales.

You know who you are.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmdrLcxbZg6VaqfptgLzxPqbWjwoB57zFtJmBrRtKEKVFw/because-corporate-ownership.jpg


So, until the price for the few electrons it takes to run the servers comes down to a more reasonable level, it's sayonara, S

title: Happy winter solstice! #1
body:
From all of us at The FreeBorn Society we want to wish you and your's a happy winter solstice.

If you chose to observe our highest day, it peaks between 10 and 11 Central Daylight time, tomorrow.

From this point forward the days get longer, the sun arrives a little earlier.

This year we got a new moon to go with it.

If you got big choices to make, now is the time.

Enjoy your new year, we are winning.

title: Emma Goldman Speaks. #2
body:
https://steemitimages.com/DQmTUfWKcSW79mtNTsHP1VFzycH8LyavbTdB5iwr7CXb2PN/emmag.jpg


Emma Goldman emigrated from the Ukraine at the end of the 19th century.

She took jobs where she could get them.

She married a citizen and became one in her own right.

She took up the black flag of anarchism.

She spoke in the streets and in the auditoriums.

She talked her way right out of citizenship.

Her talking made them gov't types declare her dead husband not a citizen, so that they could deport her as not a citizen.

How do you like that?

Here is an article that she wrote about it,...

https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/alexander-berkman-and-emma-goldman-deportation-its-meaning-and-menace-last-message-to-the-peopl

author: freebornangel
title: What you should know about Steem's math.
body:
Steem is heavily weighted towards the top.

More stake, more money goes to you.

This is needed in the early life of the platform.

If it wasn't this way when the market cap was 17m somebody could have swooped in and bought enough to really matter in the math.

Were they to act against the platform's interest there would be little that anybody with less stake could do.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmSNEYBrvjsFJssG6fZ4ssXTCM6jKjR3aUSGcM3h6EjuTb/ive-created-a-5a54ef.jpg


Now, as part of that, when whales vote EVERYBODY ELSE'S influence on the reward pool is diminished.

Before the hardforks very few people mattered in the math.

After the hard forks the top still mattered most, and self voting was in their best interests.

As it was before, selfvoting had to take place in teams to really matter.

That way, one account couldn't rule the roost without some other accounts colluding to stop it.

Ergo,

When you beg a whale
root_title: What you should know about Steem's math.

title: Why do you support rule by force?
body:
Go ahead, you can come clean with me.

How many times have you declared that a certain class of people should have their heads off?

I may not disagree, heck I might even help.

However, we don't get to decide what is right or wrong for other people.

(It's ok to be judgmental when confronted with an actual use of force to control you.)

https://steemitimages.com/DQmWS2Hi7J8YVcHiitzWDnYLHwDWV9aG3GdNTrGu43iqUA6/its-criminal-if.jpg


Some folks are predestined to be serial killers.

Some folks are born to lose.

It is just a fact of life.

What is important is the context of the 'crime'.

Did the serial killer only kill folks that harm others?

Is that all bad?

Is that you?

The flashylight box culture has taught us that those that rule by force never get it wrong, always get their man, resistance is futile, and it can all be wrapped up in under an hour.

title: News from the Ukrainian frontlines.
body:

title: What we need is a rally point.
body:
If we are gonna exist as an ecosystem we need a central point that we can all attend.

While we are there we can share our ideas and hash out differences.

In order to qualify as a rally point, we all would have to know where it is, and attend it.


We got those in hashtags, but we have no way of disseminating information to everybody.

Not everybody knows that @skoolsux is open for all content about how much skool sucks and what we should do about it. 

Not everybody knows that #crapitalism is open to all comers that want to propose new ways to manage the world, or defend the one we got.


When we go to 'all tags' we find that, once again, stinc, et al, hasn't given us accurate information.


I can't imagine that making a short list of tags on our feedpage would be any harder than what is already there.

Just an input box and a place to keep the input.

author: freebornangel
title: Dicks Encyclopedia of Practical Receipts and Processes.
body:
If you have ever wondered how to make things at home, from soap to perfume to alcohol to one heck of a lot of other things, this is your book.

It has over 130 pages of what used to pass as common knowledge, useful in every household.

If you want to know how much you have been dumbed down, know that this book was a common reference book in 1872.

Sold on it's appeal to the average user.

If you find terms you are not familiar with, look in the front of Granddad's Wonderful Book of Chemistry by Kurt Saxon, he included a glossary that translate the old terms into the new.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmPR2uF2f8nE5HRxzgkSTxGHci2PTG4NqLhyeBxgEgbz5u/granddadschemistry.jpg

author: freebornangel
title: Two more cents on the sbd peg.
body:
I was listening to @aggroed and @timcliff talk about the peg.

<iframe width="640" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pNpR6Iz5ndg" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>

It occurred to me that on the internal market the peg is holding pretty well.

Sbd has been running about .9sbd to 1 steem.

That is within the window we call a peg.

Now, I'm sure, that nobody is going to claim to be able to maintain the peg on the wider open markets.

Clearly that is not happening.

However, what I propose is that sbd be allowed to float as long as the peg is held on the internal market.

I don't think it possible to claim to maintain the peg on any external markets, so clearly only the internal market should rule the peg.

As long as the internal market stays between .9 and 1.1sbd to steem then the peg is holding, imo.

It is impossible for this to be any other way, unless harsh actions are
root_title: Two more cents on the sbd peg.

title: FBA gives props to stinc, et al!
body:
It's not everyday that I find something to give kudos to stinc, et al, but when it happens I am happy to do it.

Today, in my rush to catch up, I hit control v to post a link in a comment, but didn't take the time to check that the link was what I was actually posting before hitting enter.

What I was in fact posting was my private posting key.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmciF2WD4Tg1ZFfj8yrTJbxyGvtbKuSSSbWcBhP3t274ZL/did-not-see-5a7b95.jpg

Luckily, some member of stinc, et al, had taken the time to code up a warning prompt when my private key was detected.

So, thank you to the folks that authorized that pull request.

I'm sure it has saved a lot of folks many headaches.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmRtSL9MsHrDCKxUzQ4VerRk5MaxvqorYUMML1Z2zY6B7z/now-can-we-5a7b96.jpg



Have a perfectly peaceful day.

author: freebornangel
title: On Any Given Tuesday #10
body:
On any given Tuesday the workers of the world can unite in solidarity and end this bankster dystopia.
The idea is not new.
[Here](https://peacerequiresanarchy.wordpress.com/2013/03/27/the-monkey-master-fable/) is the idea from 14th century China.
[Here](https://archive.org/details/lookingbackward01bellgoog) is the idea from 1887.
[Here](https://www.abelard.org/e-f-russell.php) is the idea from the '50s.

It's not like the idea is new.
What is new is the 'education' given to you that makes you reject the idea out of hand.
Anything that doesn't conform with what you were taught as a child is suspect, and mostly impossible.
I know, I used to think that, too.
But, I read my way out of the mindtrap that was my fakeducation.

You can do it, too.
I have faith in you, dear reader, after all, here you are reading.
Good Job!!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/RZ6zeeyK-image.png)
root_title: On Any Given Tuesday #10

body:

Luckily plenty abounds near the town of Canyon.

We got the Palo Duro canyon state park, I'd have pics but there were toooo many cops and they wanted me to pay to get in.

I was just site seeing, and wasn't interested in talking to cops, nor paying to drive around the loop.

So, I went to this landmark, instead.

It includes a few lines that he wrote.

Maybe you can read them,

author: freebornangel
title: Do you want to support FBA in my support of the little guys on steem?
body:
Then follow my trail on steemauto.com.

I vote mostly posts of less than 1sbd payout.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmZnXZ1n3qxf8Q1JZcfbxUDVXvF7pWmZCAaSqn7MTaCRsf/i-got-a-5a8503.jpg

Sometimes I will vote a payout of 2 or 3 sbd if they tickle my fancy.

You will not be curating for maximum roi if you choose to join my trail.

I vote on content, and authors, unlikely to trend or even make it onto the hot feed.

If that suits your tastes, search for me in curation trail on steemauto.com, and follow me. 

Be sure to choose 100% if you want to follow my voting percentage, rarely will any vote be over 25%.

I mostly keep my voting percentage above 70%, but you can set a higher value in settings.

If you want to minimize the vp that you donate to my trail choose a lower percentage to vote that fraction of what I vote.

If you choose 10%, and I vote at 25%, your vote will be made at 2.5%.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmeXsVC6ttx1ZE6o8Guai

I am going to be pretty intermittent for awhile, I won't have all day to browse my vote feeds.

Here are some pics from my ride south from the border.

For those of you that didn't know, I have jumped ship.

The smart jews got out of Germany when the Nazi's rigged the elections.

Any of you wanting to do the same are welcome to contact me here, or on Minds.com.

author: freebornangel
title: Day 2 on the road, and in the wind.
body:
The first day went really well until about dark.

Straight roads, no long stretches without a gas station, no cops, nice temps, and partly cloudy.

I was climbing the mountain headed to Saltillo when I found out that truck drivers in Mexico are one crazy bunch of fellas.

I wish I had more pics, but I was pretty preoccupied with trying not to get crushed between two semis.

The temperature was dropping and all I had on was a long sleeve shirt and a wind breaker.

Luckily the rain was more a sprinkle than full blown rain, and it didn't last long.

These shots are from just before I began to climb the hill.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmezCmvr4SCsWm49zChNdTDv3TBmL5vxrXSmScCv1WvV8a/DSC00036.JPG

https://steemitimages.com/DQmc5sSAK8F78itx316kXeRMpiDNRqmGfTQDQyi2D8PnLMU/DSC00034.JPG

I got to the toll road and the craziness began, tailgating, speeding, it was an exciting hour or so.

At the end of the toll road, the last of the light was gone,
root_title: Day 2 on the road, and in the wind.

author: freebornangel
title: FreeBorn Anarchism, defined.
body:
In an attempt to reach the masses in a way that the masses are likely to accept, we have to condense the ideas to short, concise bits that can easily fit onto protest signs and bumper stickers.

Anything more complex and the majority of folks will turn off and go back to Dancing with the Stars, or similar drivel designed to distract the easily distracted.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmd8YGZv6CvzZgahSiwp1LKigtHFc3FA3x6WFuJSNTAGS6/booklook.jpg

As a result, FreeBorn Anarchism can be summed up in two axioms.

The first we like to call:


World Peace in 20 Words or Less:

It is wrong to force a person to do anything that that person doesn't want to do.


That one is pretty straight forward and not many anarchists, or anybody else, are gonna disagree.

Conflict is impossible without coercive force being introduced as the participants will simply separate and go their r
root_title: FreeBorn Anarchism, defined.

This principle is applicable across the board.

The entire world is supplied by corporations where the workers do the work whether accounting accounts or falls into a lake.

title: From here to FreeBorn Anarchism on any given Tuesday.
body:
As I was saying, the transition from here to FreeBorn Anarchism is as simple as refusing to pay for things while continuing to do the work needed to have them in the first place.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmdNX56L24Ssfwqpfc21goh3KfQs6ShqkSQ263MwALpqU2/nobody-rules-where-5aad6b.jpg

I think it was Eric Frank Russell that first gave me the notion that things could continue just fine without bankster overlords living like gods on the backs of the workers.

His short story, And Then There Were None, was eye opening to say the least.

I'm sure you have never heard of it, but knowing that your education has been controlled by those that wish to keep you wage slaving away in the factories, it should come as no surprise to you, either.

With 50+ bots, whales, and gangs voting the minnows don't stand a chance in the math, it's just an unpleasant fact.

author: freebornangel
title: Are you spamming the blockchain and you don't even know it?
body:
Pending reward balances were put in place to reduce transactions on the blockchain.

Instead of a transaction being recorded for every .001sp curation reward, they were put into a pool to be claimed in batches.

By putting these micro transactions into batches, to be claimed in bulk, strain on the nodes was reduced.

However, services have appeared that allow you to bypass this feature.

Instead of claiming your rewards in batches, the service will do it automatically for you.

But by doing so, they put unnecessary strain on the blockchain, bloating the space needed to keep the ledger.

I noticed when looking into a certain curation cult's wallet that not only do they rape the reward pool to favor their sycophants and dupes, but they also spam the network with every little curation reward that they get.

They get alot, too.

Now I don't know if they are just greedy and need that SP bad enough that they think spamming the nodes is acceptable, or if the
root_title: Are you spamming the blockchain and you don't even know it?

author: freebornangel
title: A math (and life) lesson for the newbs.
body:
When a whale votes every other vote loses value.

It doesn't matter if that whale ninja mined his stake, paid USD for his stake, got stake delegated from a real whale to support his project, ganged up to add up to a whale, or rents stake from an actual whale, when a whale votes every other vote loses value.

No matter how much you grovel at their feet, the value that they bestow on their golden boys comes from your vote.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmUB4iB4tEhPdWeZp5qKfETtEVpyfpcRrN8oCpcPHMsE4U/download%20.jpeg

If all stake in excess of 100mv were idled your vote wouldn't round down anymore.

Currently we need about 150sp for our votes to have any value at all.

When the price drops, you will need more.

If all the stake in excess of 100mv were idled the community would stand a chance of growing organic dolphins.

Dolphins that would identify with the newbs and not the whales that created them.

Dolphins that would make votebots obsolete.

<
root_title: A math (and life) lesson for the newbs.

author: freebornangel
title: Georgia still celebrates hanging Cherokee man to start Trail of Tears
body:
It's not every day that a town gets outed for it's questionable actions.
I think this one speaks for itself.

![image009.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQCxCK7hJXkrLzzbvkWcWiCjC2tGNownmPRFA11qPmPZU/image009.jpg)

[From the story:](https://intercontinentalcry.org/hall-county-still-gathers-to-celebrate-an-illegal-hanging-that-sparked-the-trail-of-tears/)

>On Christmas Eve in 1830, the population of Hall County, Georgia doubled in size – a large crowd had turned out to witness the illegal hanging of Cherokee, George Corn Tassel.  
Just a few generations later, an annual festival which bore Corn Tassel’s name became the biggest festival in Hall County – and it remains so, today.
A few years prior to this grotesque public violation of Indigenous Rights – in 1827 – the state of Georgia had already begun a [systematic assault](https://nativeamericannetroots.net/diary/2033) on the Cherokee Republic and Cherokee Constitution. 
Georgia fought rabidly against, and willfully refused to uphold, the federal treatie
root_title: Georgia still celebrates hanging Cherokee man to start Trail of Tears

author: freebornangel
title: Our future lies in the past.
body:
It's been awhile since I've been able to do one of these.

It's just that I've been bullied my whole life.

I've always been chosen as the example to keep the others in line.

Although I consider myself very fortunate, the facts are that I ain't pretty enough that folks just hand life to me on a platter.

So, when I see bullies taking advantage of others and forcing their will onto them, or using their ignorance to deceive them, I am compelled to speak up.

But now that prettier, more socially acceptable folks have joined the struggle against the bullies it's time for me to do something else.

https://steemitimages.com/DQmQZpjNHnET7BjY7DgUFcidrA7WdySNeavPe7PEv8JU7qD/i-coined-the-5adffb.jpg

I didn't write the following, but I did visit Kurt's house a couple times, and count him as one of the biggest influences in creating FreeBornAngel.

Without Kurt's wisdom entering into my life I would still be the bitter, cynical liar that I was when I met him.
root_title: Our future lies in the past.

author: freebornangel
title: Why crapitalism is doomed to fail.
body:
The answer to that one is really simple.

Are you happy with the way things are going?

Would you like more leisure time?

Do you enjoy the value your labor created being used to bomb Yemeni children?

Would you like a higher standard of living?

Would you like to never pay rent, utilities, or taxes, ever again?

It really is as simple as continuing to do the work while refusing to play the crapitalust game by buying that labor back.

Of course this means that you won't get paid for your labor, but is ordering anything you want, for free, from the web worth working for 'free'?

I think so.

If you could order anything you desire to be delivered to your door, what would you get?

I like motorcycles and corvettes, but I only need a few.

I've already put in 35 years of labor and I live in a tin shed for my troubles.

All I have is some clothes and a few things I inherited.

And still when I walk into walmart I am amazed at
root_title: Why crapitalism is doomed to fail.

He does a weekly radio show, three hours of how to escape the programming:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ku6cLyYo_oY


If you haven't explored outside your box very much, this is very much the deep end.

With the knowledge Marc gives out for free you could never pay another traffic ticket!

But, like all good things, it takes effort to learn.

He sells a packet of documents that you can use by filling in your information, if you ask nice I bet he will take crypto for it.

The packet isn't absolutely necessary, but it has all the latest tactics you will want to be aware of before taking on a judge for the first time.

They really are just men and women forcing strangers to pay them.

title: If you are in Mexico, Bitso is your friend.
body:
So, I am having to fund a trading account so that I can trade to mexican pesos.
It looks like I dodged the carnival bullet, but now I have no employment prospects.
It looks like I have to hope the price doesn't tank between now and 2028 when my check kicks in.
I sure don't want to have to go back to the shed.
Although, with electricity for heat, it wasn't so bad.
![why-is-my-5aecde.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSdCWo4WVEpUA3rfXhFftMM7vj4ttjzuFt8TAa8PyPbTn/why-is-my-5aecde.jpg)
The bitcoin cash I sent the other day went through with no fees on the interface and just a few minutes waiting time.
Now I've sent ltc, eth, and btc.
Btc is by far the slowest and most expensive.
It's showing as pending now, I guess that is what 10 minute blocktimes looks like.
It sure won't take long for folks to figure out steem is much faster, cheaper, and that makes it better.

So, for the record, it appears that bitso is the place to send your coins if you need  to trade to pesos.
I will know more about sending it to a bank a

author: freebornangel
title: Are you well adjusted in this dysfunctional world?
body:
When i was a little kid my parents signed me up for all kinds of lessons.
One year was baseball.
I played for the team sponsored by the police.
We had black shirts with our numbers, 13 as i recall, and hats that said police on them.
Most of my childhood is a mystery to me.
I could no more tell you how my birthdays went, than i could tell you what i had for lunch last week.
But this has stuck with me like a theme.
We had the only perfect record in the league, 0 & 13.
The main thing i remember is getting a line drive to third that i caught and missed the tag on the runner behind me.
The rest of it is pretty much blank.
![download (66).jpeg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmVdaycecnpHsWdYyWMRGM22VrBV7Z8d3Qvxr3oWTd5jfe/download%20(66).jpeg)

title: 14 ways to improve your job.
body:
Direct action is the tool of change.
When you take your freedoms where you can, only then can you have them.
If you continue doing what you are told to do nothing will ever change, why would it?
Its why we saw all those 'i love buying votes' ads.
If they can get you to bend a little, they win.

Well, when you keep paying at the pump, its no wonder they find us without hope of change.
Now drink your flouride!

http://www.infoshop.org/direct-action-14-ways-to-improve-your-job/

1. Workers run the world. Everything would stop without our labour. Withdrawing our labour is our weapon, and the right to run things is our demand.

2. At the same time, most work is a bore. As it is organized in our society, most labour kills the spirit and body of the worker, not to mention the mind. But to simply call for a four-hour day at eight hours pay is not enough. Who will benefit from the automation that could realize such a demand? Who should control technology’s introduction and integration into the economy? Potentially, w
root_title: 14 ways to improve your job.

title: Walter Burien, OG Info warrior.
body:
The insiders have come to their powers through the ignorance of the rest of us.
If you dont know, you cant complain, things dont change.
If you hang out here, you are gonna know, and then your apathy will justify their behavior.
Everything below is Walter's.


** POSTED: 05/10/18 **
Let's start off with taking a look at the Big Picture of: "Government Wealth vs. Private Sector Wealth" held.
I have been actively looking for this "Collective" consolidated data for the last 20-years and found it two-days ago.
 
The following two documents are put out by the Data division of the Federal Reserve.

The 1st link is the category listings of wealth held for years 2011 through 2015. 
This covers total Federal Pension Funds; Local Government Pension Funds (L; 119. a, b, and c. L120 a, b, and c); Federal and Local total investment wealth held; same for the private sector (L.118.a, b, and c); financial institutions; insurance Companies, Brokerage; Banks, etc. 
Also included is Worldwide wealth held by all of the above.

author: freebornangel
title: It looks like its time to start discussing the sbd peg.
body:
Sbd is under 2usd.
Nobody wanted to crash the price when it was flying high at 15usd per.
Cant really blame anybody for that.
Pegging sbd to one usd will lower rewards for all of us, but it improves the use case.
The idea is that merchants can accept sbd and not worry about volatility taking the profits out of any sales.
They wont have to change prices hourly with the ups and downs of the market.

I'm uncertain about how the math will work if we allow steem to sbd conversions.
It would give a way to push down the price of sbd, but @dan has said that it opens the door to abuse.
We got enough abuse now.
Thanks to stinc choosing linear rewards and self voting over muzzling the whales.

For those of you that werent here when we had superlinear rewards, they allow much higher payouts on popular content.
Those 15k sbd posts are a thing of the past.
Which isnt all bad.
To give that kind of reward to a post requires that thousands of minnow posts get their rewards rounded down.
So, its harder for the newbs to earn a
root_title: It looks like its time to start discussing the sbd peg.

author: freebornangel
title: Why is vote buying/selling abuse?
body:
The rewards pool was intended to spread steem to folks that the community determined to be deserving.
We put out 'good' content, the community decides how much we got coming, and steem is distributed.
Large accounts get to make their roi by curating content.
A not perfect idea, but it is what it is.

Vote buyers/sellers short circuit this primary basic function of the pool by taking rewards by paying for/selling rewards from the pool.
They force the community into their scheme to scam the pool.
Their content isnt worthy of rewards, or they wouldnt have to buy them.
The sellers are too lazy to do the work of curating 'good' content, and prefer to plunder the pool by force instead.
They both would rather force the community into paying them than put in the work to get a following, or do the work necessary to get maximum roi by curating.
The vote buyers want to pass off their paid for reputations as just as good as anybody's that has earned their reputations by creating content the community wanted to vote.

Do
root_title: Why is vote buying/selling abuse?

Bear in mind, sp payouts go up as the price goes down!
Im not sure the exact ratios, but a 20sbd post pays out 10sbd and 10sp at a dollar.
At 2 dollars that same post pays 10 sbd and 5sp.
At 5usd steem that same post pays 10sbd and 2sp.
So, as the price goes down, sp payouts go up as a ratio in steem.
For most of you, dear readers, just move the decimals and add zeroes to get what your payouts will be.
Sorry, stinc prefers slobbing whale knob over making steem attractive to the masses, and whole numbers make prettier math equations.

We'll have to get one of those math whizzes to explain whether or not its a wash because as the price drops so too does the value of the rshares.

There are so many moving parts to this game that its not easily learned.

title: Man, it is hot, today!
body:
Last time i was here i left before summer really got going.
I didnt know how oppressive the humidity gets here.
It is hot af!
I just made the three mile walk to town and back, and those last two hills kicked my butt.
Last time i was in mexico i moved around the highlands with the carnival all summer long bitching about being cold at night.
This time im stuck in the lowlands wishing i had some klima.

I did get my bitpay card to work.
Now i can walk into town and get dr pepper whenever i want!
I still havent gotten cash off of it, but that may be just a matter of time.
If you want to contribute some bitcoin to it, here is the number:
15DEYVM6MYiuxab1r4gCXeQf2nwQ7bZ1nq

author: freebornangel
title: Why we have to end the use of money.
body:
The end of the market economy is a given, really.
We already see where it leads us.
Wars and forced poverty for the vast majority of humanity and opulence for the select few.
A permanent underclass doing the work, or serving as examples for those that do do the work.

You do realize that the unemployed serve a very important function under crapitalism, dont you?
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/NAIRU
Those unfortunate souls on the offramps of the highways keep the corporate drones in their cubicles and on the sales floors with those forced smiles on their faces.
But lest we commit heresay, 'crapitalism raises people out of poverty', right?
:winksknowingly:

If we hope to end most work through automation, what do we do with the starving workers?
We couldve already done it, but starving masses sack the castles.
The crapitalusts refuse to give food away unless they extract some tribute first.

We dont have to have money, we do have to have workers.
![2be0lx.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmaBAGT4KMUsBFa1LUs
root_title: Why we have to end the use of money.

author: freebornangel
title: Crap posts and why you should make some, too!
body:
Dissenting opinions are very important to coming to the truth of something.
Just accepting the opinions of a few people as definitive is a hit and miss tactic.

What if they all ascribe to the 'all positive, all the time' theory of existing.
They wouldnt tell you the truth if they knew different because that, gasp, would be negative.

If you surround yourself with that type of person your assesments are going to be off.
You are going to accept false data as true.

The worst of them, when they get alone, vent their frustrations at your stupid niavete.
They wont let that slip as long as they think they can get what they want from you, but you can bet, not all those wonderful smiles are telling you what they really think.

This fact of human nature is what makes us dissenters so important to the community.
Especially us grumpy ones.
I know i prefer to be honest with you.
Me, and Simon Cowell, eh?
I wont intentionally hurt your feelings, but dont ask me questions if you aren't prepared to hear a dissenting opini

title: Watch out, steemizens. There are bullies on the prowl!
body:
Dont let the ads fool you.
If you run afoul of what some very powerful people here think should be said you can not only get food taken out of your mouth they will do it with 3x overkill to boot.

I have been able to avoid going back to living in a tin shed because what i earn here has made it possible to have a room and a bed.
Today i found out that i need to watch what i say or powerful bullies will take away what the community has voted to me.

All i said was that taking rewards by paying a bot for its advantage in the math is abusing the pool.
That buying your rep from bullies that take from the rest of us to give to you is not in alignment with the goals of steem.
And for that i lost enough rewards to pay for a week's worth of food and more rep than I've earned in the last month.

Thanks alot, unnamed bully, I'm sure your sycophants are jerking you off now, and laughing with you about how powerful picking on folks with a tiny fraction of what you have makes you look.

His image in the broader community is a good one.

Maybe he got bullied as a child, and now sees being domineering as being powerful.

In this book Ed lays out how to manage the world without banksters.
He demonstrates that ruling elites are not needed to d
root_title: Looking Backwards, by Ed Bellamy

author: freebornangel
title: Bidbots, not all bad.
body:
They are not the antichrist here to ravish the reward pool.
They may do that, but its not the hammer's fault that it hit your thumb.

When you use bots to buy your friend some rewards that increase her visibility, no problem.
That is just leveraging your stake to help your friend.
The tool is made available to you, who cares if its provider puts profits over people, right?

For the moment let's ignore how stake based voting works in the math.
Let's say that large accounts voting have no impact on everybody else.
Let's pretend that vote bots dont get their rewards by taking rewards from the least powerful of us.
We can act like its ok to push hundreds of third world hungry people away from the few cents they would have gotten.
Nobody cares that those few cents mean the difference between eating or getting online tomorrow to earn enough to eat again, right?
In this environment why wouldn't you buy some rewards?

Now, let's come back to reality.
Steem's community is largely made up of folks that will bend over
root_title: Bidbots, not all bad.

title: Be careful using public computers for your btc transactions.
body:
Yesterday i sent 30sbd through blocktrades on a computer at a ciber in town.
Usually i use the one here in the neighborhood, but it was closed.
I guess the one in town changed the receive address and i didnt notice.
Blocktrades confirmed that it went to a different address.
So, look out, confirm your addresses before sending!
Here is the culprit: https://blockchain.info/address/13JF5274VuNthhwKkLrYyZW73smjSYAEen
![2bslxg.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmZ3K8tKVhsjmcjeiU8rPFt8SKicLTUyShB2QwSrApDBur/2bslxg.jpg)
root_title: Be careful using public computers for your btc transactions.

author: freebornangel
title: The 4 Winds Shotgun.
body:
If you ever find yourself in need of a cheap, throwaway 12 guage shotgun, boy are you in luck!
Kurt Saxon has come to your rescue!
![kurt.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmYA5fQku4qqWxyeMDmUW9XwnVUoL3BvuBaszTX1Qr2qoG/kurt.jpg)

In his book series, [The Poor Man's James Bond,]( https://archive.org/stream/KurtSaxonThePoorMansJamesBondVol5.pdf/Kurt%20Saxon%20-%20The%20Poor%20Mans%20James%20Bond%20-%20Vol%201#page/n0/mode/2up) he details many, many homemade items that can be used once and thrown away.
Most are made from scrap you may have laying around the house.
This is the 4 Winds Shotgun.

![4wshot.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmSFWkHWP4qsd7Q1Zf62dmZvhbnqnSN2Hv1SGaatoXUYjV/4wshot.jpg)

author: freebornangel
title: Why truth is important.
body:
When you operate with false information your decisions are based on flawed premises.

For instance, many people think the govt is here to help them.
They falsely believe their support of rule by force is making the world a better place.

One only has imagine a world where violence to control others is not tolerated to see the world without conflict.
If violence weren't used to remove people from their homes, all the conflict created by this practice ends.
If violence in the pursuit of one's goals were not tolerated we wouldn't have taxes.
We wouldn't have wars for oil, nor any other reason.

That people think they are peaceful, but support governance by force, clearly illustrates the need for truth and the importance of knowing it.
![2aq1q4.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmcDQTFYmBr522FSgLSi3ZHj37vTz2Jhp7r4zVd3Dw2Qid/2aq1q4.jpg)

author: freebornangel
title: Don't drink the proof of wallet kool aid!
body:
If you have joined steem after the linear rewards were forced on us so that abusers could abuse the pool, then you don't have any idea what proof of brain was all about.

![crapitaldoesntcreate.jpg.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/YZ5Xjien-crapital-doesnt-create.jpg.png)

Proof of brain rewarded 'good' authors and the curators that found them earliest.

Dan had worked out many of the bugs that were forced onto us with linear rewards.
He had worked to balance the needs of the investors and the authors.
The math was balanced.
The ninjamine blew that balance all to hell.
Greedy whales were making the game unplayable for all but their sycophants.
It was really bad.

The synthesis that was reached by working through the various interests had led us to a working model that did what it promised to do, reward good content.
But, because some of the whales were greedy as f**k, we had to let them abuse us until we rise up and put an end to it.
Time works in their favor, it is unlikely that
root_title: Don't drink the proof of wallet kool aid!

author: freebornangel
title: What anarchy means to me.
body:
Anarchy, to me, means the end of rule by force.
No longer will the wealthy be able to hire thugs to force their opinions on others.
World peace will be realized.
When nobody can force others to comply, conflict is at an end.
Maybe not totally eradicated, but certainly at a turning point in how we deal with differences of opinions.
No longer will might make right.
Histories will exist written by others than just the biggest bullies on the block.

It will also mean an age of abundance.
Instead of wealth going to the 1% it will be much more broadly distributed.
Instead of wage slaving 50 hours a week for 40 years to retire to a trailer park and cat food sandwiches, we will be looking at fewer work hours and cheaper goods allowing more leisure in more comfort.

Instead of the price of something including the ceo's golden parachute, the taxes associated with that, and the taxes of every worker involved in delivering the goods to market, we will simply pay what it costs to get it to the shelf.
As executives are re
root_title: What anarchy means to me.

What can gaming theory teach anarchists—and what can anarchists teach through games? To explore these and other questions, we conducted the following interview with TL, game designer and artist of Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game.

author: freebornangel
title: Why we dont make demands.
body:
As you may have noticed, dear reader, i am not much of a writer.
Sure i can generally get a coherent thought on paper, but you wont find any 10k word diatribes from me.
![taksim1370.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmTH9Ln3FA5iwea3NjVcT4a5HHhdt1r1oRtbP2SdmoirwW/taksim1370.jpg)
I have worked for decades to condense my ideas to fit on a protest sign.
This is how crowds are influenced, none of them read tomes, but if you can hit them with an idea that they can adopt as their own, you are going to get carried along in their enthusiasm.

So, not a writer, but an avid reader.
Not alot of what i put to the blockchain is my original creation.
Shocking, i know.
Most of what i keep repeating here came from tomes that i have taken time to read.
I bring to you ideas that you may not have encountered elsewhere.
I curate ideas to bring to you the best i have encountered so that you dont have to slog through 100 year old books to find the snippet that puts the world into perspective for you.

With that end in mind, toda
root_title: Why we dont make demands.

author: freebornangel
title: The nightly news must've missed MayDay in Paris.
body:
I'm sure they had many other stories to cover up, as well.
Maybe it was just me?
Did you see any coverage of the MayDay festivities in the anarchist stronghold of Paris?
![34.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmb5aLf18hDtk7r7FdTJz865hqdCx1ipJbC4DWXwc282jK/34.jpg)
Well, dear reader, you are in luck.
Taking the time to read my content has once again brought you information you are unlikely to get anywhere else.

I know most of you are not ready to abandon the old paradigm in favor of the new, but the Mayans have spoken.
December 21st, 2012 was the end of the world as we knew it.
On that day, the world was ruled by force.
The farther we move in time from that day, the less control the ruling class has over us.
Their days are at an end.
Rule by bully has had its time.

Take a few minutes to read a report from the frontlines of the struggle to free you from their oppressive force.
Brought to us by our fine friends at [The Crimethinc Ex-Workers Collective.](https://crimethinc.com)
![header.jpg](https://cdn.steem
root_title: The nightly news must've missed MayDay in Paris.

author: freebornangel
title: Terms and conditions bug
body:
I had my browser hijacked by a prompt to agree to the terms and conditions of stinc.
Im sure you have experienced this hijacking, too.
While trying to read the terms, i know, just me right, i had my window hijacked again.
Now, i just clicked the terms again because i read kinda slow, according to some, and went back to reading them, again.
When, can you imagine?, it happened again.
I was forced to accept the terms before i could even read them.
What kind of crap is that?
Is this the bleeding edge coding we get at the premier social media site of the 21st century?
Seriously, can we get that countdown clock extended to give us slow readers a chance?

author: freebornangel
title: Take a good look at your rewards, steemizen!
body:
Several forces are at work here.
The lower the price goes the more sp you get.
Im not sure but it maybe a wash, as the price being down drops the value of your payout, too.
Even if it is a wash, when the price goes back up, you have more sp because you kept posting.
![serveimage (10).jpeg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmY7VyLWPNUKgasPoeEJ1joWUedghfZWdEDASRwVvmkp95/serveimage%20(10).jpeg)
[Source](https://www.vectorstock.com/royalty-free-vector/hand-up-steem-coin-character-cartoon-vector-19218896)
The other factor at work is that as the price drops fewer people are voting and posting, increasing the value of both!
The reward pool is being divided up between fewer people.

So, keep posting, when the price spikes you'll be glad that you did!
![seal-1287426_960_720.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmS5SFR2Qu3QoRxYN3aZdS4ySJrzqfxtRgRmzMBvXVJWY1/seal-1287426_960_720.jpg)
[Source](https://pixabay.com/en/seal-show-zoo-trainer-antarctica-1287426/)
root_title: Take a good look at your rewards, steemizen!

author: freebornangel
title: Why we don't want our witness to be our developers!
body:
The eos bug gives a good example of why we need our witnesses and our developers to be separate groups of people.
Eos' 21 block producers came together, developed a patch, and deployed it all within a few hours.

Think about that for a minute.
21 groups of people came together, formulated some code, and made a change to the rules of eos that altered how eos functioned.
That is known as a hard fork, if the previous version finds supporters.

All without input from investors in the broader community.
They made an exclusive conference call, changed the code, and didnt bother to ask if anybody else liked it?
Its a club, and you aint in it!

If that happened on steem, why they could come together vote out super linear rewards, our best defense against selfvoting and crap content, increase vote weight by a factor of 4, making 10 votes a day instead of 40 is much easier to abuse, end the 4 posts per day rule that diminishes rewards for more than 4 posts, and allow abusive a**holes to begin to sell the reward pool t
root_title: Why we don't want our witness to be our developers!

* Last August, 11 days after a group had set up a blockade to protest Junex Oil Exploration’s activities in the Gaspé, Quebec, Freddy Stoneypoint from Sagamok Anishnawbek was the only person left at the blockade.

And i have to wonder, wtf?
Ned can't pull 4sbd on a post with 170+ votes?
Where are all the whale votes?
Are even the minnows delegating everything to bots?

It occured to me well over a year ago that stinc could shadow ban accounts and unless we had access to the blockchain to see them there, we would never see them on steemit, nor have evidence of their existence beyond rewards going to pot.
Well, here we are, rewards have dropped off a cliff, what gives?

Stinc certainly isnt fixing their mistakes, have they doubled down?

author: freebornangel
title: The sand in the hourglass tolls the death of crapitalism.
body:
It is inevitable that crapitalism slowly dies.
Not just because it concentrates wealth in the hands of the few.
Not just because it doles out poverty to the many.
But because it is unsustainable.

[The world is running out of sand.](https://www.lewrockwell.com/2018/06/no_author/world-running-out-of-sand-making-it-the-black-markets-hot-commodity/)

As more and more people move into cities, because not enough money can be made by working the land, the need for concrete expands.
Concrete requires sand.
Lots of sand.

The way we remedy this is somewhat counterintuitive, we simply keep working while refusing to pay for anything.
By continuing to do the work we guarantee the continued availability of shoes and iphones.
By refusing to buy into the bankster dystopia we enable lifestyles that are not centered on maximizing profit.
No longer do we need to worry about not meeting the bills and starving under a bridge.

I know, i know, 'But FBA, insert crapitalist economic dogma here.'
We cant solve our problems by repe
root_title: The sand in the hourglass tolls the death of crapitalism.

author: freebornangel
title: One more day without wifi!
body:
Well, it seems that there is little rush to restore my wifi.
It has been down for three days now.
They say they need a cable to fix it, that the cable is in the big town an hour away, but still no cable?
This is killing me.

So much happening and now i only get a couple hours to keep up with it all.
I have been getting to read more books, though.
If you like reading personal histories, this is a good one:
[The Road by Jack London](http://www.gutenberg.org/files/14658/14658-h/14658-h.htm)
It tells of his youth riding the rails.
The lifestyle has largely been killed by crapitalism, and romanticized by novels such as these.
Freezing  in those box cars surely must have been miserable.
But from these 'poor life choices' life takes on more flavor.
Surviving circumstances avoided by the more timid is what gives those of us that brave those choices a deeper appreciation of the variances in life that are available to us all.
You wont see anyone that has been kicked by poor life choices denigrate the poor choices made
root_title: One more day without wifi!

author: freebornangel
title: Nebraska farmers return land to Ponca tribe.
body:
In an effort to stop the Keystone XL pipeline, water defenders deed land back to the tribe.

From the story:

* In a move that could challenge the proposed path of TransCanada’s Keystone XL pipeline—and acknowledges the U.S. government’s long history of abusing Native Americans and forcing them off their lands—a Nebraska farm couple has returned a portion of ancestral land to the Ponca Tribe.

* At a deed-signing ceremony earlier this week, farmers Art and Helen Tanderup transferred to the tribe a 1.6-acre plot of land that falls on Ponca “Trail of Tears.”

author: freebornangel
title: Help end the fed $2 at a time.
body:
Here is the link to the federal reserves page that says how much it costs them to make the money.
https://www.federalreserve.gov/faqs/currency_12771.htm

Tldr:
Denomination	                    Cost of Production
$1 and $2	             ...               5.6 cents per note
$5	                         ...                   11.0 cents per note
$10	                                ...            11.7 cents per note
$20	                                ...            10.8 cents per note
$50	                                        ...    12.9 cents per note
$100	                        ...            13.2 cents per note

Now, if you take the time to look over the link you will see that coins are purchased from the mint at face value.
This means that the profits, or loss, on coin production accrues to the treasury.

For those of you old enough to remember, you will know that Reagan debased the penny in 1982.
Before Reagan the penny was 95% copper, and after, 2.5%.
[Trickle that down.](https://www.nytimes.com/1981/08/2
root_title: Help end the fed $2 at a time.

author: freebornangel
title: The Iron Heel by Jack London
body:
One good thing about my wifi being out is i got to do some reading of books.
I have been wanting to read [The Iron Heel by Jack London,](https://archive.org/details/ironhee00lond) again.

If you havent heard of this book, it may be because Jack does a much better job of explaining oligarchical socialism than George Orwell does with Goldstein's character in [1984.](http://www.mondopolitico.com/library/1984/1984.htm)

If you are seeking insight into the ruling elites and how they function you wont be wasting your time reading this one.

The story opens with Ernest Everhart attending a dinner of the well to do.
It progresses through characters close to Ernest learning first hand the truth of what Ernest has told them about how the oligarchy operates.
You will have to read it yourself to find out how it ends.
![serveimage (2).png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmYXR7wMHarJzSoFAiAPKLSsNqMPNx5VTj97gnQeVJVpW1/serveimage%20(2).png)
root_title: The Iron Heel by Jack London

author: freebornangel
title: Cops are satan!
body:
Yes, you read that right.
No, I'm not kidding.
Like most everything else I make up as I go along, I have logical reasoning to back it up.
If you havent noticed, i tend to follow my own path.
I live in a world all my own, but I'm well known here.

You've been to church, right?
Did you go of your own free will?

Maybe grandma liked to make you go, but god certainly didnt, yes?

When you got there, did god make you put money in the plate?
Did he force you to sing in the choir?

No, of course not.
God doesnt force people to do things.
He gives us free will to test our characters.

So, if you are being forced to do things, like contribute money you dont want to give, or follow a bunch of rules you dont agree with, and it isnt team god doing that, who could it be?

Hmmm,...???

Could it be,....satan!!??

Cops are satan.
They force you to do things you dont want to do.

Pick a side, eh?

![2664815697.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmSTPW2h8bQCgrWwK3G7ZrfdeNM3aBx8Lx2QHb1xYnkKvm/2664815697.jpg)
root_title: Cops are satan!

author: freebornangel
title: What is it to be aware?
body:
A #tribesteemup biweekly question.

This question has had me at a loss since it was proposed.

Were the question, what is it to be awake, that would have been simple.
I wouldve just pulled out the infowar and how not being aware that rule by force is a suboptimal management technique means that you are losing the battle for your mind.

But the question is to be aware.

I think being aware encompasses much more than being awake.
One can be awake that the fed is a fraud, or that satanists are ruling the planet, but still not be aware that others are just as much people as you, each with their own right to be free from your oppression.
Not being aware that you thinking you are right because reasons, based on the popularity of the idea, or the consensus of your peers, doesnt make you any more right than the person that disagrees with you.

Just because you think its wrong to video yourself in the bathroom nude while confessing cringeworthy truths about yourself doesnt make it wrong for the person doing it.
It is
root_title: What is it to be aware?

author: freebornangel
title: Stop being an f'n lemming, please.
body:
Why folks insist on putting on a mask to fit into group is beyond me.

If you have to pretend to be someone you are not to fit in, why would you want to be part of that group anyway?
Clearly you dont fit in, and you already know it.

Ive spent a lifetime being rejected by groups i didnt try to fit into, they seem to want me to feel bad about that.

Well, surprise!
I think there is something to be ashamed of if you fit into a group that doesnt accept you as you are.
Any group that rejects you if you dont toe the line is not worth being a part of anyways.
They are anti-freedom.

We all come into this world as individuals.
Grow up and be one, eh?
 ![2cy54c.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmX3fbn1iutALLHLrZM11z1mSUkxkP14XcNTunHB3DKEKr/2cy54c.jpg)


After making this post these came to me through the next reply in my feed.
Serendipitous, eh?
https://steemit.com/life/@petervroom/dealing-with-bullies-a-simple-but-genius-way-part-1
https://steemit.com/life/@petervroom/dealing-with-bullies-three-kinds-of-manipula

author: freebornangel
title: An open letter to Amnesty Intl.
body:
As many of you know, Nicaragua is having a civil war.
The people are tired of the current corrupt rulers and want new ones.
@larkenrose gave us a great illustration of what is about to happen in Nicaragua.
https://www.youtube.com/embed/z0HtWSlFCAQ

The following is a letter from one Nicaraguan to Amnesty Intl.
It can be read in full [here.](https://www.southfloridaprogressivebulletin.com/new-blog/2018/6/13/letter-to-amnesty-international-from-camilo-mejia)

>Open Letter to Amnesty International by a Former Amnesty International Prisoner of Conscience
 
>Hello everyone,

>My name is Camilo E. Mejia, and I am a former Amnesty International prisoner of conscience (June 2004), on account of my refusal to return to the Iraq war on conscientious objection grounds.

>I have written an open letter to Amnesty International in condemnation of the destabilizing role they have played in Nicaragua, my country of birth, in the current conflict.
 
>Please feel free to publish this letter in your respective networks and pub
root_title: An open letter to Amnesty Intl.

title: Are you hiring a bidbot to take your rewards for you?
body:
Well stop it!
If your content sucks so hard that it doesnt find support from the community, its an f'n clue, eh?
Do the work to build an audience, learn to make better content, but dont hire a thug that profits by forcing rewards away from others.

If your content is popular and getting support from the community wtf are you doing hiring a bully to take even more?
You already have love from the community, then you pay some of that love money to a bully to bitchslap some more out of us?
Classy.

Its no secret that when a whale votes every other vote on the platform goes down in value.
Those bidbot whale sized votes you are bitchslapping the rest of us with are killing the network effect we need to be adopted as a currency.
Everytime you pay a thug to take your rewards from the redfish that are testing the waters you slow steem's adoption.

How are we going to get the unbanked to use steem as their bank when you make it impossible for them to get a few cents for posting?
Why would they adopt steem when the min

title: Keep working, stop paying. #17
body:
![2d4b3j.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmSsoq1469ikwJH4U6dxLotB9QakGZM34Zmy8TvKd3znnH/2d4b3j.jpg)
[Source](https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2011/07/book-review-hobo-handbook/)
Each day you go to work you trade your labor for wages.
On the way home you trade your wages for the labor of another worker.
The crapitalust takes his cut on both transactions.

First he pays you the lowest wage he can find people to work for, then he charges the highest price the market will pay.
He makes his money by exploiting workers and consumers.
The net effect of this is that workers cant afford to buy back the things their labor creates.
Want food to eat? Be exploited by crapitalism, or starve.

The very people that do all the labor are excluded from enjoying the fruit of that labor.
How on earth have the crapitalusts convinced you that this is the greatest thing since sliced bread?
Ask [Ed Bernays,](http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/000271624725000116) he can tell you.

Now, dear reader, let me ask you, do you

author: freebornangel
title: Why steem is unlikely to trade above 5usd for any length of time.
body:
We all want to see steem go to the moon.
100usd steem is the dream of every stake holder.
But, lets be realistic for a minute.
Pie in the sky may be the stuff that brings in the bigger fools, but even they figure it out once they've had time to learn the ropes.
![2d86r2.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmY1VpuHKCVUsmTRoobFw3hmQhAZuv9TrYHWzHrYYxEjJM/2d86r2.jpg)
[Pic source](http://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-successfully-launched-falcon-heavy-rocket-2018-2)

Would you pay 1000usd for what 10sp gives you?
Would you pay 1000usd for 100 sp?

To pay even half that is not attractive to anybody that has had time to figure out how steem works.
I have all my limit trades set at under a dollar.
I was all under .5sbd, but that looks pretty unlikely at this point.

You've seen how hard it is to accumulate sp as the price rises.
At 100usd per steem accumulating sp will be a pipe dream.
A 100sbd post will pay 50sbd and .5sp.
How many 100sbd posts have you had?

A 5sbd post will pay 2.5sbd and .025sp.
Any hope for a
root_title: Why steem is unlikely to trade above 5usd for any length of time.

author: freebornangel
title: Another brilliant idea by FBA!
body:
As you may recall my last brilliant idea was that bidbots should require customers to decline rewards.
By doing this they end any impact on the rewards pool.
The price of the trending page then falls to what the bidbots profit now and the trending page comes into reach of more authors. A key selling point they have espoused to distract our attention from the truth.
They can set their prices to earn themselves even more money than they do now, because we all know that somebody assinine enough to take their rewards irregardless of that taking's impact on anybody else isnt going to do anything for free.
We are playing crapitalism with some of the best players on the planet, after all.

But now, another brilliant idea occured to me.
Many of us dont flag trending posts because taking a dime from a 600sbd post is pretty futile.
The dime is just going to go to another trending post anyways.
Flagging should burn the rewards.

Now stinc has decided to take the reverse auction rewards away from authors and give them t
root_title: Another brilliant idea by FBA!

author: freebornangel
title: Dimes, the trending page, and you!
body:
We all have dreams of being voted to the trending page.
Each of us wants the community to love our content enough to give us the honor of being voted the best content on steemit.
That's not how trending works at the moment, but its a nice thought, right?
Right now, if you want to go to trending you have to pay a whale.
That payment doesnt always have to be in sbd, but that is the surest way.

Right now if the community disapproves of the amount of rewards going to a post we can flag it.
Then the rewards we took from the number one post on trending goes to the number two post on trending.
We can flag that one, too!
Then the rewards likely go back to the number one post because it still has the most rshares.
This round robin makes flagging for rewards an excercise in futility.
Flag them from this crap post and watch them go to that crap post.
Yea! All hail the wisdom of stinc!

Well, stinc has promised us a hardfork to 'improve' things.
This new set of rules for the blockchain will change how the reverse aucti
root_title: Dimes, the trending page, and you!

author: freebornangel
title: fantasy violence
body:
Kurt Saxon gave us an unprecedented amount of work revolving around survival and home based business.
If you search his name at archive.org you will find most of his works that have entered the public domain.
This means you are free to disseminate them without compensation to Kurt's estate.
Lucky us.

The following excerpt from his works comes from his [Poor Man's James Bond](https://archive.org/stream/KurtSaxonThePoorMansJamesBondVol5.pdf/Kurt%20Saxon%20-%20The%20Poor%20Mans%20James%20Bond%20-%20Vol%203#page/n59/mode/2up) book series.
There are 5 volumes, each a treasure trove of late 19th and early 20th century folk knowledge.

The PMJB is aimed at self defense.
I will excerpt more of this series each Saturday.

author: freebornangel
title: Ex post facto laws, guns, and you.
body:
![Untitled-1-5.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmRHp66CBHsKkZSuoSvsXM19rEbvYoYJqKRqpU3TP5pJV4/Untitled-1-5.png)
[Source of meme and quote below.](http://politicalpistachio.blogspot.com/2016/08/gun-controls-constitutional-nemesis-ex.html)

Ok, raise your hands if you have heard of the [ex post facto](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ex_post_facto_law) clause in the federal constitution and all state constitutions.

Its like every lawyer in amerika has been told that they will not use this vital provision of the law to defend anybody against any new laws.

If you got chickens in your yard and the city passes a law that says nobody can have chickens anymore, that law doesnt apply to you.
Its often called the grandfathered clause, because you are grandfathered in.
I bet that term is familiar to you.
You get to keep your chickens because the new laws can't pass the ex post facto clause test.

You dont have a constitutional right to keep chickens, but posessing them cant be criminalized by new laws.
You do have
root_title: Ex post facto laws, guns, and you.

title: Your loving gov't keeps a double set of books.
body:
![walterburien.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/B1BzcMsu-walterburien.jpg)

If you haven't checked into what [Walter Burien](http://cafr1.com/) is pushing, and you are not ready to go full anarchist, you might want to give the following video a few minutes of your time.

He has been in the struggle for freedom since the 80's when he lucked onto the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report.

This is what the gov't calls the second set of books that the various gov't entities keep.
Water districts, skool districts, enterprise zones, you name it, if it has a budget, [it has a cafr.](http://cafr1.com/CAFR-Examples.html)

They put the expenses into the budget and demand that the taxpayers pay them.
Then they put the profits into the cafr so that none of the gov't flunkies can just steal the money.
The public never knows the money even exists.

The next time your state asks for more money rest assured that they have multiply years of tax revenues invested into the stock market.

I never c
root_title: Your loving gov't keeps a double set of books.

author: freebornangel
title: World Peace in 20 Words or Less!
body:
Its wrong to force a person to do anything that that person doesnt want to do.
![2dkomj.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmWM5VxmTWG4oFjei1aRQ8ofJiqr6jYKCCLQV9EnfWUtJT/2dkomj.jpg)

Why it is acceptable to think that thugs rounding people up and forcing them to comply is just par for the course is beyond me, but that is what the bullies want us to think, that the broader world thinks it is the only way to manage a world.

They tell me it is inevitable that bullies rule the world.
That people want rulers to rule over them.
'Its human nature', they say.

Well, i dont accept that.
Everybody i know denounces bullies.
It is doublethinc to say it is wrong for me to rob you at gun point, but ok for 'the govt'.

The govt is nothing more than a group of men and women that force perfect strangers to pay them.

Please stop advocating rule by force as inevitable, it is not.
root_title: World Peace in 20 Words or Less!

author: freebornangel
title: Yea me!
body:
I figure to celebrate this milestone because i wont likely do it again until approximately 2024!
If i got to get ten times as much vote power as i did up to here, that's 80 months!

I crossed over from 65 rep to 66.
I was really bummed watching it drag on and on, knowing that if i would get my attitude a shave and haircut those numbers would add up much faster.
But f' that, if the community rejects an honestly authentic me, why in the hell would i change to fit into it better?
Money?
Im an f'n communist, money is my satan, so definitely not money.
Popularity?
I despise most popular people for getting their hairs cut, putting on a tie, and playing the needed role to be accepted at the soul selling market's window.
Where is the honesty in that?
Oh yeah, there is none, its lying.

Friends? They only really count if you get to meet them in real life.
Fame? Infamy is just as good.
Especially, if you reject the criteria imposed by the status quo.
Nah, better i make me happy.

Many of you may be wondering why i am
root_title: Yea me!

author: freebornangel
title: Can we get hardfork 20?
body:
I still dont like the idea of the rewards going to the trending page, but from @paulag's [analysis,](https://steemit.com/analysis/@paulag/hf20-exploratory-data-analysis-on-proposed-payout-changes) it looks like the trending authors are going to take quite a hit.
Apparently selfvoting is a bigger deal than it would appear at a quick glance.
I guess this explains why the default option has been removed.
If you hadn't noticed, self voting your post has to be done manually, now.

Also included in this revision to the rules, .02sbd payouts will no longer round down.
https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/1764
That will benefit the little guys, for sure.
Their votes won't round down anymore.
Im betting this excites the little fellas as they will now see their accounts growing slowly, rather than not at all.

It excites me because those rewards will now be going to the accounts they were voted to, and not the trending page.

Now, if we could just [get the bullies to stop kicking folks in the shins,](https://steemi
root_title: Can we get hardfork 20?

author: freebornangel
title: What is coherence?
body:
A @tribesteemup biweekly question.

Coherence to me is when everything is working in unison.
When all the moving parts function together, coherence is the result.

We could all work together to make steem, and the wider world, a more coherent place, but that isnt at the top of everybody's list.

Too many of us put number 1 at the top of the pyramid.
Everybody else comes in second, or later.

This creates incoherence in the biosphere.
We are all in the same boat.
One big blue marble, yo!

As we go through the next week, dear reader, let's see how much coherence we can create.
Instead of pushing our negative judgements onto others, let's bite our tongues.
Instead of doing things 'because we can', let's let others take priority instead.

I know this will be a challenge for me.
I hope you have an easier time.

@tribesteemup is a group put together by @kennyskitchen to encourage values he finds conducive to creating a more harmonious world.
[Follow this link](https://steemit.com/tribesteemup/@kennyskitchen/the-8-
root_title: What is coherence?

author: freebornangel
title: Another brilliant idea by FBA!
body:
Ok, that last one may open the door to too much abuse.
Though, i still think it will be limited by vote power just as upvote abuse is limited.
I'd still like to see it tried, we can always revert the code.
For those of you that missed it, the idea was to burn flagged rewards.
There is no sense in flagging overvalued posts if the rewards just go to the next one down the line.

This new one is going to be an even harder one to sell.
Currently sbd's are riding above the peg.
They are basically speculative at this point.
For those of you that missed the white paper's explanation, sbd's were designed to be a dollar equivalent like tether.
The idea being to give merchants a stable coin that they could price goods in without worries of volatility losses.

How @dan thought that only 7m coins could trade on par with 500t usd is beyond me.
There are ~19m of them now, but that is still 5 orders of magnitude too few.
Unless we have a minimum of 1t sbd in circulation there is no way it trades at par.

Look at tether, the
root_title: Another brilliant idea by FBA!

author: freebornangel
title: Are you ready for the price of steem to go to the moon?
body:
This simple code change could light the fuze on the rocket in under a month.

The more i think about this latest idea, the more i like it.

For those of you that missed it, the idea is having the steem blockchain sell sbd's for 1usd of steem.

We open an account, you send in your steem, you get sbd's in return.
Yes, yes, we could just use the internal market.
But the internal market doesnt mint sbd.
You buy already existing sbd there.
You also pay market rate.
This idea restores the peg.

Buying on the internal market doesnt put recycled steem back into the reward pool, either. 
Now does it?
The steem paid into the blockchain account will be paid out just like any other inflation.
15% to sp holders, 10% to witnesses, and 75% to the rewards pool.
Inflation will be sucked out by demand, and not pushed out by high hopes.

This code change drives demand for steem because you have to buy steem to get sbd.
Well, once current supplies are sold for btc, or whatever coins.
That wont take long, there are only 18m of t
root_title: Are you ready for the price of steem to go to the moon?

Ok, maybe you didnt hear what i said.

This will peg sbd to one dollar.
Nobody buys sbd for more than a dollar when there is an open window selling it at one dollar, unless they dont want the hassle of buying steem and then trading it for sbd.
The exchanges can make that profit.

Instead of letting sbd float on the market the blockchain will sell them to anybody that wants them.
Rather than wait for our elite bloggers to spread our newfound wealth through content rewards, the blockchain sells sbd to match demand.

But, FBA, that makes the rewards we do get even less!
No.

The steem brought in by sales of sbd will go into the reward pool.
Can you imagine what adding millions of steem to the rewards pool will do to the dimes you are getting today?

If sbd is going to trade on par with the usd, there has to be enough sbd to replace all, or most, of the usd in circulation.

There is a little mad scientist in all of us.

Lately though, the nanny state has decided that we don't need this information and that we are better off not being able to understand chemical processes.

Well, you are in luck!
You have stumbled across my blog, and I like to spread knowledge far and wide.

Luckily, some years ago, I came across Kurt Saxon.
He likes to spread ability, too.

I hope you [enjoy his book!](https://ia600202.us.archive.org/BookReader/BookReaderImages.php?zip=/18/items/Granddads_Wonderful_Book_of_Chemistry_Kurt_Saxon/Granddads_Wonderful_Book_of_Chemistry_Kurt_Saxon_jp2.zip&file=Granddads_Wonderful_Book_of_Chemistry_Kurt_Saxon_jp2/Granddads_Wonderful_Book_of_Chemistry_Kurt_Saxon_0058.jp2&scale=2&rotate=0)

It doesnt matter if your ideas are much better than all the other ideas.
If you need force to make them happen, they suck, and so do you.

author: freebornangel
title: Keep working, stop paying! #18
body:
Every day the workers of the world perform their specialized dances.

They bag the groceries, they drive the taxis.
They flip the burgers, they stock the shelves.

Every day brings them one day closer to obsolescence.
Each day the robots taking their jobs gets closer to reality.

In return for performing this labor what do they get?

They get paid the lowest wages employers can get by with.
They get charged the highest prices retailers can charge.
[They get poisoned by their food.](https://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=useless%20eaters)
They are denigrated by the beneficiaries of their labors.
[They are openly mocked for their stupidity.](https://www.vox.com/2016/4/21/11451378/smug-american-liberalism)
[Secret groups plan their exploitation and demise.](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Georgia_Guidestones)

Why do they put up with such nonsense?

Because their skools taught them that it was right.

Ask any worker and they will tell you that crapitalism is the best thing since the wheel.
'Crapitalism

title: Report from the shallows. #10
body:
What is going on out there?
It seems the furor over bidbots being bad for everybody but their owners has died down.
Probably because hf20 could dent their business model.
If it ever shows up.
Maybe because the good folks got tired of banging their heads on the brick wall that is those folks' greed.
All they had to do was decline rewards, but,...you know,....greed.
Smdh.

The price being down has cut 2/3 of authors.
We have about 20k now, instead of 65k.
Damn fair weather bloggers,...
Even the bidbot business is off by 2/3, from ~15k to ~5.5k.
Couldn't have happened to a greedier group of folks.

So, what do we talk about now?

I know, let's put my idea back on the burner.
For those of you that missed it, the proposal is to open an account, we can call it @sbdopenwindow, this account will serve to allow the blockchain to sell sbd to anybody that wants some.

Instead of waiting for the normal inflation to occur and authors to sell their sbd, the open window allows anybody with steem to buy all the sbd they wan

author: freebornangel
title: An open letter to the people of Venezuela.
body:
You have managed to keep the dream of a better world alive through the worst manipulations the united snakes could throw at you to derail that dream.
I won't pretend know what the conditions are on the ground.
I have only reports allowed out by the press.
Your president claims to be a revolutionary, but a revolutionary president is an oxymoron.
You can't be both.

It is up to you, the people of Venezuela, to take the next step.
To be a shining beacon for the rest of the world.
Throw off your crapitalust overlords.
Denounce them for profiteering on the misery of the people.
Even today, when they have all the money, the people suffer so that they can profit even more.
You allow it to continue, they can't control you all at once.

This final step can be rapidly accomplished by continuing to do the work while refusing to pay.
The workers already do all the work, but they have nothing to pay with.
It is their work, no?
Why do they pay to get it back from the crapitalust?

If they refuse crapitalism by refusing to
root_title: An open letter to the people of Venezuela.

author: freebornangel
title: Can you unite the world?
body:
A tribe steemup bi-weekly question.

I dont think we need to unite the world so much as remind the world that we are already fundamentally the same.

We all want to live our lives in peace and prosperity.
We want all children to grow up well adjusted and productive.
We want the elderly to pass into what is next with dignity and grace.

We are all, mostly, united in these fundamental goals.
Where the problem lies is in how we go about achieving them.

Nobody liked it when we got bullied at skool.
Even the bullies were unhappy, but willing to do something about it.
That they sought their utopia in making others miserable is a function of the world they grow up in.
Those willing to dominate others get fed first, the weak get what is left over once the bullies take theirs.
This is naturally accepted, even encouraged, by crapitalism.
Go getters are celebrated and rewarded, peacemakers willing to share are denigrated as weak, and stupid.

The very basis of our society divides us into haves and have nots.
Those wil
root_title: Can you unite the world?

I bet you didn't know that every crap post bidbotted to the trending page costs you money.
It does.
Every time somebody with alot of stake votes on a post it takes rewards from every other vote with less stake.
When a whale votes, everybody else loses.
Its just how the math works.

If everybody with more than 1000mv stopped voting everybody else's votes would more than double.
The votes you get from your 6 friends would have value rather than round down.

Exactly how much remains to be seen, because stinc hurried up and hardforked before we could know the truth.
We had some responsible whales step up and stop the bullies' abuse of the reward pool.

But you should know stinc chose the bullies over mass adoption, and continue to do so today.

Every time you pay one to vote y

author: freebornangel
title: The whirling wheel of death!
body:
Whenever i transfer steem from this account to that account the whirling wheel of death hijacks my browser tab.
I have to reload it to escape the transfer popup window.
The transfer completes, but i get locked looking at the wheel go round and round.
What is even stranger is it didnt hang up when i sent the steem back from that account to this account, nor sending sbd to that account.
It only hangs up sending steem from here to there.

Im on an android tablet, using chrome.
Thanks.

![Screenshot_2018-07-22-16-46-56.png](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmaKu7yU3H3xvqN5EC4uPyHuGX9z73pwcEj5FL7ZhUUWS6/Screenshot_2018-07-22-16-46-56.png)
