author: freebornangel
title: We cant got to the moon until we fuel up the rocket.
body:
As it is now we have enough sbd to pay a semipro hockey team for a year.
Thats it.
No way we replace a large chunk of the usd.
There just isnt enough sbd to do it.
There never will be at the current rate of inflation.
We will all be dead before there is enough sbd to manage Venezuela's gdp, let alone Brazil's.

There is a way to turbocharge sbd production.
We sell them to anybody with a dollars worth of steam.

An account can be set up to do the deals.
Lets call it, @sbdopenwindow.
A bot can be programmed to return sbd for steam at the average rate of the last few days to prevent market manipulation.
We can let the witnesses monitor this rate to insure no manipulations are occuring.

The steem received by this account is recycled into the inflation pool that is divided between sp holders, witnesses and authors.
This way selling sbd works just like regular inflation.

If we sell enough to excede the normal inflation rate, payouts rise.
If not, then the normal rate will be the floor.

This account lets us meet
root_title: We cant got to the moon until we fuel up the rocket.

title: Instead of a post. #2
body:
Losing my post to @steempeak's scheduling bug really messed me up.
Im very much a stream of consciouness author, im always disappointed when i spend several hours on a post and then it dissapears.
No way i can do it justice from memory, too many edits.

Whoever devised the draft feature for the posting code was a genius.
I cant count the times i've been left with nothing for several hours of work.
I guess if i want to schedule posts to post while i'm sleeping i will have to copy and paste them somewhere that doesnt have bugs.
 I was really looking forward to stacking up posts ahead of time, but if they are just going to disappear, what would be the point?
Smdh.

After[ fedbook booted me,](http://facebook.com/proclaimation) in 2012, for not issuing myself some form of govt id, i was relegated to posting on forums for years.
Those things are pretty dismal.
Usually there are two or three hardcore regulars that have been there for years that treat it like their personal fiefdom.

At most their are 10 regulars th

If there were gaping holes in the math, I hope they would've spoken up.
Until they do, I'm not going to drop the idea.
I hope you will run with the idea as if it was your own.

Let's call it, @steemopenwindow.
What this account will do is accept steem from anybody that has some.

It will determine the exchange rate at the average value over the last few days.

title: Introducing Steempeak.com, your steemit alternative.
body:
If you haven't heard of steempeak.com yet, you are in luck.
Be sure that you read that right, it is not steem Speak, it is steem peak, like the mountain peak.
I wouldn't send you the lunatic pit that couldn't tolerate differing opinions.
They are better left to themselves to attract similar minds so we know who they are.

No, this is an alternative to steemit, and busy.
It has many, many features.
The one that caught my attention was scheduling posts.

If you recall, i was bemoaning the loss of my post.
I tagged @steempeak and their main developer answered.
@asgard walked me through the recovery of my post.

I had used a capital letter in a tag.
That is fixed in the next update by making all entries lowercase.

Once I sent him a screenshot he saw the problem right away.
Night mode had obscured the error link where my post had been saved.
He tells me that will be fixed in the next update, too.

I'm really knocked out by the number of features available.
There are account metrics.
It's not as much data as stee
root_title: Introducing Steempeak.com, your steemit alternative.

They mostly cover ufo/paranormal topics with some cryptozoology tossed in to break up the routine.
On a few nights a year, they cover real topics about the deep state and those that rule us by force.
It was on coast to coast that I first heard Alex Jones.

The first hour often has a different guest than the rest of the show.
When George Noory is there he puts out news that isnt getting love from the msm.

If you haven't heard of them, just turn on an AM radio and they can be found anywhere in the country.

[1200 WOAI](https://woai.iheart.com) can be heard in 38 states.
CtoC is on more than 550 radio stations, so if you haven't heard of them, you are definitely under a rock, or go to bed at a respectable hour.

author: freebornangel
title: Prison Memoirs of an Anarchist
body:
If you fancy yourself an anarchist, perhaps you should look into what exactly that has been historically.
It may not be something that you want to be associated with.

Maybe your idea of not being told what to do sounded like a good idea, but there is a much longer history to what it takes to be an anarchist than what you might first expect.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/KWqIjX3D-image.png)
[Source](https://ca.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Berkman)

How did you first hear the term?
How much have you looked into what others are doing with the term?

Maybe, it takes more than just painting a circled (A) on your nearest trashcan?

If you cannot name [the man in the picture,](https://libcom.org/history/berkman-alexander-1870-1936) maybe you should find a new term.
## Voluntaryist is a good one.

Libertarian is ok, in the united snakes.
In Europe though, anarchist is what the libertarians began to call themselves when using the term libertarian got your head liberated from
root_title: Prison Memoirs of an Anarchist

author: freebornangel
title: Further Thoughts on Revolution in Practice
body:
I've come here to spread the message that anarcho-communism is not just the solution to our problems as a society, but the inevitable destination of a voluntaryist mindset.
If you believe that it is wrong to use force to control others, and you carry that idea through to its end game, you will ultimately arrive at anarcho-communism.

I make that affirmation because it is what happened to me.
I was as devoted to Ayn Rand as any young, impressionable reader could be.
My first forays off the beaten path 25 years ago started with [Kurt Saxon.](https://archive.org/search.php?query=Kurt%20saxon)
He recommended her as a first rate explainer of how to manage an economy.

Being a reader, I went to the used book store and bought a copy of Atlas Shrugged.
She laid out a pretty good outline.
It served as my rock until 15 years later when I found Ed Bellamy's book in a small, private library.

[Looking Backwards](https://archive.org/details/lookingbackward01bellgoog) left me conflicted, until I got the other data I had i

body:
For many of us in flyover farm country the idea of strikes and union busting only circulate among a tiny minority of folks.
We don't get much of that on the farm or oil derrick.
Mostly we don't think about it much.
Maybe you city folks know more about it than what we do.

>Last July, as she has for the past 10 years, Dianne Jones spent 45 minutes on a city bus heading to the local WalMart. There, under fluorescent lights, she scanned rows of brightly colored birthday cards to pick out the perfect greeting for her son—let’s call him Tim—who is imprisoned more than 100 miles from his mother’s home just outside New Orleans. The card she settled on was dark brown with trees and a birthday message that read, “For the best son in the world.”

title: Abolish prisons, now!
body:
For those of you that have never have experienced the criminal justice system from the inside, you should bear in mind that the opinions you have formed are all formed with only one side of the story.
You have no idea what it is to go through what the victims of 'just us' go through.

First they have foisted upon them a system of management that doesn't work for them.
For whatever reason the system has failed them.
Then the system punishes them for failing to conform.
For the rest of their lives the system will continue to fail to serve them.

From an an-com perspective this is unforgivable.
How can we fail so many people, and yet be proudly proclaiming it as the best?

Have we sunk so far into the dumbing down that we can't see how miserably we are failing?

If your plan is to buy a million dollars of steem and self vote yourself some nice interest, I hope you consider who you are taking that money from.
See, steem rewards are a commons.
When you vote yourself hundreds of steem each week, or let a bidbot vote it for you, each steem comes out of the mouths of the people in places that a dollar a day makes a real difference in their lives.
That 8usd grande frappe crapichino that you think nothing of buying each morning could've bought a kid lunch for a week in Venezuela.
Now you've got coffee and she has another day without enough food.
Yeah! Crapitalism!

There is no avoiding the drawbacks of enriching yourself by taking food directly from little kids.
It's like taking candy from babies.
Literally.

I've been here two years now, I've got a pretty good feel for the math.
There is enough steem created and distributed by the blockchain each day to feed the greed of a couple

body:
Police, in the united snakes, have killed 646 people so far in 2018.
2/3 of them unarmed and not suspected of a violent crime.

Police killed 1,147 people in 2017. Black people were 25% of those killed despite being only 13% of the population.

[View the data map here.](https://mappingpoliceviolence.org)

This is what you get when you support rule by force, dear reader.
If you think it isn't your concern because you are pretty square, remember that when they get to you, there won't be anybody left to speak up for you.

author: freebornangel
title: What tribe steemup means to me.
body:
I didn't know much about tsu when they showed up to take me along on the ride.
I do know that when rides come along, I generally jump in the car.
It's hard to travel and stay safely at home, if you hadn't tried.

The tribe showed up right on time.
If it were not for their adoption my life would have crashed around me, much sooner.
As it was their kindness kept me in paradise another three months.
Long enough for things to come together back home.

Now, their kindness will let me save up for the next opportunity to travel arises.

Thanks, ya'll!!
You mean the whole world to me.

author: freebornangel
title: The Frog Pond
body:
There once was a frog pond.
The frogs  prayed to the great frog.
'Give us a king!'
The great frog said, 'I am your king.'
The frogs cried, 'but we want a king that does something, something we can touch, you are too aloof!'
The great frog sent them a log.
At first the frogs were  all emotional, they jumped  on, and from, the log.
They basked in the warm sun.
Soon they tired of the log just sitting there, and renewed their cries.
The great frog sent them a stork.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/SzfyZ7QS-image.png)
[source](https://www.tripadvisor.ca/LocationPhotoDirectLink-g155013-d1057034-i31947149-Squirrel_House_Niagara-St_Catharines_Ontario.html)
root_title: The Frog Pond

author: freebornangel
title: SBD Open Window!
body:
It's  time to take a look at setting up the SBD  Open Window.

## What is an open window?
* It is an account that has a bot running.
* One that you send Steem and receive SBD in an equal amount.
* 1 usd of Steem gets you one SBD. *
*4 day average used to prevent manipulation by all but the biggest whales.

This could be compared with converting, except that rather than burn the steem the way a conversion does, the Steem is put into the rewards pool.

I would propose that the variables be witness controled.
If market conditions exhibit the need to burn the proceeds rather than return them to stakeholders  then the switch should be in the hands of 17 of the 21st witnesses.

## What does this do for us?
*  It gets us some of that sweet, sweet tether action.
*  SBD is pegged to the dollar by anyone with a dollar's worth of steem, or that wants one and has SBD.
*  Demand for Steem rises if there is demand for a tether substitute.

Instead of simply burning the proceeds from converting Steem, we add the option to
root_title: SBD Open Window!

author: freebornangel
title: So, you want to call yourself an anarchist? #3
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/87iObUvw-image.png)

Many of you wonder why I am so picky about those that choose to term themselves anarchists.
Many of us when we come into contact with the struggle to live free from oppressive rule think that we can just make it up as we go and everything will be just fine.
That may well be, but it hardly qualifies you as knowledgeable on the topic.
There is a long, mostly untold, HIStory to anarchism.
Many lives have been given for you to have your sip of 8usd crappe frapachino, and claim to have been among them.
It's no different than putting on a uniform when you have never been in battle.
The lessons learned through this sacrifice are lost when you do no more than propound your excellent oratatorical skillz.
Get into the streets, or be a voluntaryist.
It's a free world, you decide.
I have.

[From the story:](https://anarchistnews.org/content/anarchist-movement-greece-documentary-films
)
>## Anarchist movement in Greece - Documentar
root_title: So, you want to call yourself an anarchist? #3

author: freebornangel
title: For Anarchy, not Anarchism.
body:
All anarchist journalism is free and open source.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Bzq34Kv7-image.png)

[From the Story:](https://anarchistnews.org/content/anarchy-not-anarchism)

>## For anarchy, not anarchism ##
Posted on: 17 August 2018 By: thecollective

>via ediciones ineditos

>Why for anarchy and not for anarchism? This may seem like a small point to split hairs over but it is a point which is important to us. It is important because we are interested in a vital anarchist (anti-state communist) milieu. For us anarchism points to the notion that there could be a special set of practices (forms) which can be found out to be complentary for a free life for all. We feel this is foolish and assumes human life could ever take on a singular form. Life should take on the form necessary for its free reproduction, unlike its current state which only serves those who rule/control us.


>Classical anarchism (i.e. European anarchism) was in many ways a pursuit of the best prac
root_title: For Anarchy, not Anarchism.

body:

Drones are nearly ubiquitous.
Soon, the eye in the sky will put big bro to shame.
[The panopticon has arrived.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TlO2gcs1YvM)
Whatchya gonna do, they've come for YOU!

August 23, 2018 

>Las Vegas, NV – This years DEFCON hacking conference featured a new village called “DroneWarz”, which focused on the research and development of offensive and defensive drone technologies. The Drone Hacking Village (DroneWarz) offered multiple hacking challenges, including more than twelve skill-based drone hacking challenges to explore unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) technology and improve “drone safety and operational responsibility in our occupied skyz.”

author: freebornangel
title: Work
body:
[The Crimethinc ex-Worker's Collective](https://crimethinc.com) prides it's self on putting out some quality books.
They have been in the anarchist information space for a long time.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/sqe4oS2D-image.png)

[From the story:](https://crimethinc.com/books/work)

## Work

>After so much technological progress, why do we have to work more than ever before? 
How is it that the harder we work, the poorer we end up compared to our bosses? 
When the economy crashes, why do people focus on protecting their jobs when no one likes working in the first place? 
Can capitalism survive another century of crises?

>Our newest book, entitled Work, addresses these questions and a great many more. 
To answer them, we had to revisit our previous analysis of employment and develop a more nuanced understanding of the economy. 
We spent months studying obscure history and comparing notes about how we experience exploitation in our daily lives, slowly hammering out
root_title: Work

author: freebornangel
title: Anarchy and Democracy Reading Groups.
body:
It's not easy finding reputable things on the web.
We are in an information war, after all.
So, even when it looks reliable, is it, really?
You got to decide for you.
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/HuC5IJLn-image.png)

[From the story:](https://crimethinc.com/2016/04/19/anarchy-and-democracy-reading-groups)

>This month, we are publishing [a series exploring an anarchist analysis of democracy,](https://crimethinc.com/2016/03/16/series-the-anarchist-critique-of-democracy) including case studies from anarchist participants in directly democratic movements around the world. 
As an offline counterpart to the series, we invite you to organize discussion groups about the relation between democracy and anarchy. We’re not finished thinking through this topic, and we want your help engaging with these questions. 
Our hope is that together we can produce new ideas and tactics that can be put to use in the next wave of unrest.
To facilitate all this, we’ve prepared print-ready PDF
root_title: Anarchy and Democracy Reading Groups.

body:

Sure, sure, you can say that nobody should get hurt there, that prisoners should be treated with respect.
But if you want to know what you are talking about when you say 'lock 'em up', or 'off with their heads', you should probably get some for yourself.
Until crapitalism stops farming our kids for beds in the cages, we shouldn't blame the kids for being in impossible situations.

Rule by force is the disease, who and how are symptoms.

author: freebornangel
title: How do you handle dissent in a group?
body:
A Tribe Steem up bi-weekly question.
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/g7IA6mGL-image.png)


While maintaining my own groups I've always considered it best to designate a conflict free zone where anything can be discussed without fear of violence.
Open discussion, by those involved, is the direct route to resolving the issue, if it can be resolved.
If members of the group wish to disengage that is their perogative.
If they wish to politic others out, that is also their perogative.
I've seen the backlash against the catty get pretty toxic in it's own right.
We separated the combatants and they agreed to a detente, but it wasn't long before the catty one was frozen out due to her continuous push on the group against the other.

The question becomes, who is more valuable to the group?
The person who becomes toxic when confronted with dissent, or someone that agrees to avoid conflict with the aggressors?

I don't typically hang out with large groups because there is always som
root_title: How do you handle dissent in a group?

title: Is Shocking People Revolutionary?
body:
It's not every day that some of us get to freak out the squares.
You, dear reader, are probably not the type at all.
I do it just to see the look on their faces.
It's not hard to freak out a square.
Just get a little out of line and they will shake their heads in amazement that somebody would ignore a rule.
Well, dear reader, nobody is coming to give you freedom.
If you have any at all, it is because you took it.
Please stop recognizing any authority but your own.

>Recently I attended two music concerts in one of our local parks that were billed as a combination of soul, rhythm and blues and blues. 
The musicians were all white.
I am not going to argue that white people playing this kind of music is “cultural appropriation” and that they should not play it. There are wonderful white musicians historically and contemporari

Despite the complexity we find in human affairs, spycraft is an occupation with a rather narrow range of causality, aptly summed up by the pros in the mnemonic “MICE”.

Unless you are among a select few, your day will come.
IF you wait until the day they come for you before you pushback, there may not be anybody left to care.
For those of you that know somebody who's day has come, give them @marcstevens' name.

This is a get out of jail free card, that has to be learned to play.

author: freebornangel
title: Report from the shallows, #7!
body:
Well, dear reader, if you hadn't noticed, I've been phoning it in for a couple weeks now.
I moved across an international border and used steempeak.com to schedule posts during that time.
My Internet connection isn't as secure as it was before.
I have to hurry.
My work will be forced.
![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmZFNNiLBWjd5tN2E7DabbM52QJTAKBkwBuFhEY3jdQAUz/image.png)
I came back because I couldn't face selling steem that cheap and I was running out of sbd.

Maybe I can return when the hardfork moons the coin?
It should be a straight up, never coming down, moon shot, but somehow I doubt that will be what we get.

Too bad the class war continues.
After the fork, redfish votes will not round down automatically, but they will still not count unless they total .02stu.

That is a real bummer for the little guys.
Many of whom pick up the pennies in the streets.
Just one more slap in the face from our class enemies that control the code.
They can say anything they want, but you can know the truth by their a
root_title: Report from the shallows, #7!

author: freebornangel
title: Social Media and the Anti-social.
body:
If steem is supposed to be the salvation of the world through social media and sound money, what about all the anti-social people?

Where do all the folks go that don't like the normies, that only want to get away from what passes for normal?

Those that shun ganging up to gain advantage over others?

Where do they go?

Are they just gonna be left behind like the folks too poor to take the technical mods?

Will the transhumans be free to make us obsolete based on their willingness to accept a master?

Smdh, if that is what happens, I hope I am not here to see it.

If you, like a chicken flock, exclude those that think different than you, you will end up like a chicken flock, all one flavor, and on somebody's dinner table.
Which, if you happen to like that flavor, is a good thing, but for everybody else it a bummer.

Maybe you don't see the cage around your free range area.
Maybe you don't understand that your world view has been intentionally shrunk.
Your work and home philosophy serves to compartmentalize y
root_title: Social Media and the Anti-social.

author: freebornangel
title: Far Left Militia Leader Arrested for Simple Assualt.
body:
It's not every day you get to watch how the police force plays out in civil insurrections.
It's even less often when news of the facts make it to the papers.

Make no doubt, dear reader, Dec21st, 2012 was the end of the world as we knew it.
The world, as we knew it, was ruled by force.

I don't know if you've ever had a bully on top of you, but telling that emotional timebomb that you love him and forgive him is very unlikely to help in the near term.
If you are not lucky it will make him recognize the weakness within him self and cause him to kill you.
It's just how violent domination of others plays out.
\
If you have never tried physically dominating others, I recommend against that, too.  
It's very addictive.

I, in no way, advocate for you to get up off your duff and join in the violence, in fact, I hope you don't have to do that.
Leave it to the professionals,...


For those of us that have been physically attacked by the bullies, please don't stab us in the back while we do what we has to be done.
IF

author: freebornangel
title: Keep working, stop paying! #11
body:
The workers of the world do all the work.
At any given point, the workers can stop playing crapitalism and free themselves from wage slavery.
They won't, of course, but they could.

That is where you come in, dear reader.
Remind your friends that if the workers rise up in solidarity, instead of ceo's getting hundreds of millions for showing up each day, they can find a more equitable way to spread the wealth that is created by their labors.

I mean, good luck getting past the indoctrination, but a journey of 1000 miles begins with the possibility of the journey happening at all.

Currently, the workers will deny that what I propose is even possible.
I'm sure you, dear reader, are skeptical, too.
But, the fact remains, we can manage the world in a different way and everything will be even better than it is today.

By beginning to remind the workers that they hold the power to set the world right, we can begin to set the world right ourselves.
Instead of taking the easy way out and bowing to our oppressors, we
root_title: Keep working, stop paying! #11

author: freebornangel
title: Petr Kropotkin
body:
Don't know who that is?

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/lF0TmvBn-image.png)

Petr Kropotkin was an author from Russia.
He grew up in a home that benefited from crapitalust privilege.

He hung out with the help, though.
They gave him a world view that wasn't compatible with crapitalust privilege.
He died in poverty in Russia after the united snakes [closed the door to free thinkers.](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/anonymous-a-nest-of-vipers-in-this-country)

[Read more here](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/category/author/petr-kropotkin)

author: freebornangel
title: What does it mean to be a light worker?
body:
A tribe steemup bi-weekly question.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/yV3Mmgsk-image.png)
Founded by @kennyskitchen.

Some years ago, dear reader, you probably wouldn't have liked me very much.
My whole life revolved around how angry I was at the time.
I had been raised by a dad that threatened violence at the drop of a hat.
His only problem solving skill, when it came to me, was to threaten to hit me with a belt, again.
Now don't get me wrong, my dad didn't really abuse me like some I have seen, but the threat was certainly there.
Combine that with boot camp, and suddenly anger looks like a completely normal means to my ends.
Carrot, or stick?

This was a very difficult philosophical hole to climb out of.
How could I have been sooo misled?
I just followed my examples.

I did figure it out one day, after life had left me all alone to think about it.
On that day, I discovered the 'all positive, all the time' radio station and adjusted my dial.
From that day forward I would
root_title: What does it mean to be a light worker?

author: freebornangel
title: Are you willing to admit that you are a Scientologist?
body:
If you are, dear reader, please contact me in minds messenger, discord, or on riot.im, if you don't want to be on the b/c in the comments.

If you are not familiar with the material I can only speak to my own experience with the technology.
From what I have gathered by reading the books, it is a 'how to' for your mind.

The basics are that we have an analytical mind, and a reactive mind.
Optimal function is to be 100% analytical.
Reactive comes from stress.

We can form a gradient scale to measure our distance from optimal to worst case scenario.
With study we can predict human behavior by their score on the scale.

If you haven't read the material, they recommend starting with Dianetics.
I recommend you start with Science of Survival because what are the odds of you reading two technical manuals in what is left of your life time?

Dianetics is very much a technical manual.
Science of Survival leaves out details while introducing new material, and is more an owner's manual for how the human mind works.

They

author: freebornangel
title: Stoking the flames of a prison strike
body:
If you haven't been adjudicated, dear reader, you don't know what it is you say when you call for them to be locked up and the key thrown away.

It's easy to declare off with somebody's head, but closer introspection often finds that your immediate impulse is not the optimal choice.

If prison, judges, and punishments were to solve the ailments of society, they would have done it when prison was the holding cell outside the arena.

Clearly what we have is not helping.
To repeat what we are doing over and over for centuries is mass insanity.

Crapitalism creates criminals to give cops something to do.
Smdh.

Alright, here is my big post for this Tuesday.

I have proposed a moneyless economic model that requires less work and gives more stuff to the average person than the status quo.

[Looking Backwards by Ed Bellamy 1887](
http://pinkmonkey.com/dl/library1/digi381.pdf)

http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/petr-kropotkin-the-conquest-of-bread.pdf)

http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/pierre-joseph-proudhon-what-is-property-an-inquiry-into-the-principle-of-right-and-of-governmen)

If you take the time to read these books, the first two are no more than a few hours in length, you will see that an economic system of worker unity can indeed reduce the labor required to live at a higher standard of l

author: freebornangel
title: HardFork 20, A crap post salute!
body:
Yes, dear reader, you get a crap post until the new resource credits sort themselves out.
The informative post you would have gotten today has been preempted by this one.
All hail, Stinc!

So, unless something has changed you probably don't have enough resource credits to even vote for this post.
I understand a patch is being made as I make this post, so that may change.
I case it doesn't, know that resource credits resupply on a 5 day schedule.
20% a day.
If you don't use any.

IF you use them all, you will not recharge.
You will not be able to move your money, either.
Hence the patch.

I'd imagine you will get a crap post tomorrow, too!
Yeah!

Enjoy your days off waiting to recharge so you can post!
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/qJtIew3E-image.png)

title: HardFork20, a requiem.
body:
Well, here it is in our rearview mirror.
No longer do we have to worry about will the hardfork shut down everybody, we know it will.

No longer do we have to wonder if resource credits is going to work, they will, so far.

Finding myself being less than totally critical of stinc, et al's side on this one finds me at a loss for words.

Not short on criticism, mind you, just words to express their success at not messing up harder.

Now, if we could have some reward curve other than linear that brings back the tendency to send actually favored content to the trending page, that would be nice.

If we could get you rich folks to remember that those pennies you drop on the ground as if they were nothing are picked up by a double digit percentage of the population as having value.

IF you rich bastards could take the ten seconds it might take to change the rounding down value from .019stu to .005stu, that would be nice,...

author: freebornangel
title: The Secret Doctrine Revealed!
body:
For those of you that don't know Madame Blatvatsky's name, you haven't really missed much.
Unless you are raised in an environment that lets you get all those names straight from the beginning you are going to be swimming in a sea of confusion.

I read the book, but only because it was the only thing I had to do.
It was read the book or twiddle my thumbs, I read the book.

Luckily for you, dear reader, I can tell you to not sweat not understanding a lot of what is being said, unless you are becoming an acolyte it probably isn't important for you.
Not to say that you won't learn anything by reading the book, you will, if only that you just wasted weeks of your time, as I did.

[The Secret Doctine](https://www.theosociety.org/pasadena/sd/sd-hp.htm)
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/UOvRuyTD-image.png)
[Source](https://www.amazon.com/Secret-Doctrine-Synthesis-Religion-Philosophy/dp/1557000026)

I'm glad those folks up there in the northwest are willing to push back,

body:
A tribe steem up biweekly question.

This question is going to be an easy one, for me, I've been plotting this for decades.

If I could speak to every ear on the planet I would remind them that nobody likes a bully.
Rule by force is *not* a necessary evil.
We can each be masters of our own destinies without men in suits telling us what to do.

That the authoritarians think they can prevail over the rest of us is our own fault for not nipping them in the bud.

What would I do for society?
End rule by force.

But that is just the first thing.

Next I would end wage slavery.
It's really easily done.

author: freebornangel
title: Hello? Hello? Is this thing on?
body:
Can you hear me now?
Just nod if you can hear me!
Anyone? Anyone at all?
Bueller?

It's a whole lot harder to hear when you got the mute button pushed.

I'll admit, I am conflicted.
Muting spammers sounds like a good idea.
Even better to mute those annoying trolls that make you face your reality in ways that you would rather not.
![2jl6v7.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmPyNjpP6MQ5DuTWvUW2qdhjHMNXDvf9qcQR752iJ9os3b/2jl6v7.jpg)

Me? I flag the spammers and get paid for it by calling @steemflagrewards and listing a category.
Spam, comment spam, bid bot abuse, join the discord for more,.... https://discord.gg/yfd95Sy

For the trolls i usually analyze what they have said and begin addressing issues they should resolve to be a better person.
Havent had to mute one, yet.

However, I do see the utility of reducing friction for others, so here is @emrebeyler's new tool for muting.
https://mutingproxy.steeminator.com
It allows creating and following lists.

Be sure you don't run yourself dry of resource credits
root_title: Hello? Hello? Is this thing on?

I have proposed a moneyless economic model that requires less work per worker and gives more stuff to the average person than the status quo.
By adopting this suggestion the lives of every human on the planet can be improved.

This goal may be attained by simply continuing to do the required work while refusing to pay for the goods produced by that work.

Keep working, stop paying.

This keeps the shelves full while cutting the heads off of the pyramid.

title: Abuse Fighting on Steem Today #1
body:
It is the responsibility of all Steemizens to fight abuse when they see it.
One or two flags is not too much to ask to keep the price up, imo.

I give two or three flags as often as my vp and time allow.
I also make posts similar to this one to keep the concept fresh in your mind, dear reader.
I know it is working, I see you over there,...

Just because your vote doesn't remove much in the way of rewards doesn't matter, your chastising abuse helps reduce it.
Pointing out abuse, and flagging it, is how we keep the Steem price from tanking due to scammers immediately selling on the open market.
You are the eyes and ears of abuse fighters engaged elsewhere.
Do speak up.

You can, and should, report abuse here:
http://steemcleaners.com/reports/new

Their definitions of abuse are [here.](http://steemcleaners.com/reports/new)

author: freebornangel
title: Greenbacks for the win.
body:
# How money could work without the federal reserve.

The treasury creates money from nothing, just like the fed.

This money is loaned from the treasury at 5% to anybody with a good use for it.
If you need money to get a business started the treasury issues a loan.
If you want to buy a house, the treasury issues a loan.

The treasury then spends an amount equal to 5% of the loan into the economy, through infrastructure, social work programs, social security, whatever.
This creates money to repay the interest without forcing some loans into bankruptcy like today.

Today the fed doesn't create the money for interest, the only way to repay a loan is by forcing other loans into default.
This is what the bubbles are about.
The banksters buy at the fire sale and your kids go into the meat market.

To illustrate this concept let's imagine that GM loaned out 1000 cars to 10 people at 10%.
Those ten people have to pay back 1100 cars collectively.

Where do the cars come from if GM doesn't make them?
From the bankrupt
root_title: Greenbacks for the win.

title: Report from the Shallows. #14
body:
It's been awhile since I've done one of these, mostly because my data sources got cut off.

@statsmonkey kept us abreast of how much the top ten voters were taking from the pool each day.
I figure that hasn't changed much.
If you know of a place that tracks this info please drop me a link in the commets, eh?

@bitgeek used to put out [a report](https://steemit.com/steemit/@bitgeek/payout-stats-report-for-25th-march-2018--part-i) that tracked how inflation was diluting whale power.
It appeared to me that any whales not keeping up with inflation would be pretty diluted after just 2 years.

Watching these numbers lets us track the distribution.
We can know which whales are likely to be here for awhile.
If any of those go rogue, these reports are our coal mine canary.

Knowing that the top ten voters take ~30% of the pool, a furthur ~30% goes to bid bots, leads to the question, how much is left after the top 100 voters take their part?
If we are outside these favored few, how long will the inflation allow that t

title: Anarchy at the south pole: Santiago Sierra plants the black flag to destroy all borders.
body:
If only, dear reader, we could just plant a black flag in our front yards and be left alone, but that isn't how crapitalism works.
Any that can live outside of it must be destroyed, by all means.

Welcome to the bankster dystopia our ancestors have let them build.
This man is not taking it anymore.

Let's join in solidarity with him.


![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmWEmtrUzwdwNCy5YeRe3CnQ4zGth57FDPD4rvnxKdaGcP/image.png)


>"I travel a lot,” says Santiago Sierra. “But entering a country is like going to jail. Borders disgust me – as an idea and as a personal experience. 
This work denies all of that.”
It’s a typically forthright remark from the Spanish artist, who once caused uproar by pumping carbon monoxide into a former synagogue in Germany, then inviting visitors to don gas masks to enter this simulated death chamber.
Sierra is talking about his latest installation, which has just opened at Dundee Contemporary Arts. 
Called Black Flag, it documents his attempts to have the symbol of anarchism plant
root_title: Anarchy at the south pole: Santiago Sierra plants the black flag to destroy all borders.

If you don't like what democracy looks like, then maybe you will like a republic better?

body:

>On September 30, communities across Canada will be commemorating ‘Orange Shirt Day’, an annual event that is helping Canadians remember the thousands of Indigenous children who died in Residential Schools, and to reflect on the intergenerational trauma that was caused by the Residential school system. 
Similar school systems were also run in the US, New Zealand and Australia with terrible consequences for Indigenous children and communities.
Stswecem’c Xgat’tem First Nation elder Phyllis Jack Webstad founded Orange Shirt Day in 2013, after she shared her childhood experience at the St. Joseph’s Mission residential school in William’s lake, British Columbia.

title: The lie is different at every level
body:
The cultural lies you have to believe to be a judge are different then the lies you need to believe to be a teacher, or a plumber.

If you want to be a career fbi agent you have to believe a series of lies in order to do your job.
If you don't buy into those delusions, you wouldn't be able to show up everyday.

So, dear reader, when confronting someone that thinks they have power over you, it is not necessarily their fault, they may be duped by the paradigm.
Or, they are just straight evil, know what they are doing, and need to be chastised.
![emmathought.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/nHWQ0aMY-emmathought.jpg)

One of those lies, dear reader, is that this group of people can vote themselves power that no individual of that group has.

In other words, if me and my friends can't write down our rules and force them onto other people, neither can you and your friends write down your rules and force them onto other people.

body:

A few people dedicated to changing the world absolutely can.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with that single step.

We are winning, dear reader, far more anarchists in the conversation than when I signed up in '85.


![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmS8ZiSbX6FJQRExiGW5p239jCAfun7CRQhLytXSqTqnnF/image.png)

>Burning Down the Haus, a [new book](http://burningdownthehausbook.com/) by journalist Tim Mohr, details how a small group of East German teens kick-started a movement that contributed to the fall of the Berlin Wall. 
The 1970s were oppressive years in the German Democratic Republic; there was no space, literal or philosophical, to live outside the system, let alone criticize it.

author: freebornangel
title: On Any Given Tuesday #7
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/9FEl1k3q-image.png)

Think about it, dear reader, on any given Tuesday the workers of the world can short circuit this bankster dystopia by simply continuing to do all the work, but refusing to sell that work to the banksters, and their minions, for wages.

Instead of getting paid in devalued fiat currencies, you get paid in being able to order whatever you want from the internet.

You don't have to use Amazon, but as long as the workers there continue to deliver the goods, I don't see why you wouldn't.
Ebay will likely go away, though.
No money to support the concept.

Instead of giving 90k hours of your life to support crapitalism, you can live in freedom for just ~20k hours.

Instead of paying rent, you just do your social service.
A norm will be established by the math geeks.

Instead of paying an electric bill, it is paid by your continued service.
The electricians keep the lights on because you continue to play your part in machine.
root_title: On Any Given Tuesday #7

author: freebornangel
title: It's a sad day for Steem.
body:
Well, it looks like one of the whales has decided to take his thumb off the scales.

Unfortunately, for me, it happened to be the one good whale supporting more than their own personal interests.

Uh-hum, @misterdelegation, we get that you helped put the place in motion, but if you turn something out into the wild, then try to sell it as not domesticated while continuing to try to control who gets anything from it, what do you expect?

You can't sell steem as free, when the folks with outsized advantage use it to keep certain 'undesirable' people from earning.

Until the early adopters take their thumbs off the scales steem will continue to be sycophantic boys' club that doesn't interest anybody but said sycophants.
Not a good path to take to mass adoption, imo.

I still haven't had anybody explain to me why I would buy an SMT.
I get that other front ends are gonna give them out as candy to get subscribers, but why would I buy one?

Thanks for your kindness, @jamesc, but I can't help but thinking that you no

We, your humble Journalistas, have been hard at work on the Mabon/fall issue of the Earth First! Journal, and we're aaaaalmost done.

To make up for us being a little off schedule (we did uproot ourselves and move all the way across the country, remember?), we're hoping to have a pretty quick turnaround on the next issue. 
With that in mind, it's time to get those biocentric gears and creative writing muscles turning and flexing, y'all.

We're looking for articles, essays, biocentric think pieces, artwork, poetry, reviews,

>###### MEXICO CITY (AP) 

>Mexico’s Supreme Court issued two more rulings Wednesday ordering that complainants in individual cases be allowed to use marijuana for recreational purposes, establishing a precedent that a blanket prohibition on pot is unconstitutional.

>'The effects provoked by marijuana do not justify an absolute prohibition of its consumption,' the court ruled.
The court found that adults have a fundamental right to personal development which lets them decide their recreational activities without interference from the state.
“That right is not absolute, and the consumption of certain substances may be regulated, but the effects provoked by marijuana do not justify an absolute prohibition of its consum

body:
You know you cheered with the rest of the dupes when Ned gives out delegations.
Now you know how much your vote goes down when Ned delegates to his favored select few.
Everybody is happy that AppX got support from the top, yes?

# NO.
## Not everybody.
![](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmRxGijBQtqAHvQTSvC1nbmNj7UNTfyehABkSLib2i3U7g/image.png)

Those of us that understand the math have tried to explain to you who don't know the math that when the biggest accounts delegate, or vote, everybody else loses money.
Whether the whale votes that stake, or delegates it for somebody else to vote, the value that those votes bestow on the select favored few come from the votes of the least amongst us.

@nieuscarin gets less clothes for skool.
@jesusjacr puts less money aside to feed his new baby.
@petrarodriguez gets a few less pennies to simplify her life.

I get that we have to build the infrastructure to attract the masses, but the masses would already be here if the top 70 accounts would have simply not taken as big
root_title: How do you like those big Ned delegations now?

# Britain's Homelessness Shame.

[From the story:](https://unherd.com/2018/11/britains-homelessness-shame/)


>When the American novelist Jack London ventured among the beggars and tramps of the east end of London a hundred years ago, he set out to record the lives of men and women he described as the “refuse of a human sty”. 
The characters who featured in The People of the Abyss, his masterpiece of reportage, were considered not quite human, at least not by Victorian high society.
As London wrote, they were “a different race of people, short of stature, and of wretched or beer-sodden appearance”. 
In other words they were the ‘undeserving poor’, a se
root_title: Crapitalism at it's finest.

The few accounts, less than 70, that vetoed the whale experiment so they could rape the pool by earning without working, seem to have crashed the price and damaged our reputation in the market.
Our ranking is dropping against less capable coins.
You must be proud.

Those Mr. Delegation handouts have come out of the pockets of everybody else.
Yes, some of the more perceptive of us noticed that our vote value dropped during the stagnancy of the price.
A more select few of us knew that it was the top bestowing gifts on their favorites.
And how did that affect the price and engagement?

Look around, stinc, your machinations havent

author: freebornangel
title: An open letter to our illustrious leader and current users.
body:
That video was so painful that i checked out when the words 'millions and millions' of users will one day use steem.
I tried to go back and watch some more of it in case there was something worth hearing coming from the mouth of our hero playing his guitar, but just couldnt do it.

If you take the time to look, i have a 5 digit account number.
When i got here there were 1200 daily authors.
I have a pretty good idea of how the math works.
My seat of the pants estimates generally land in the ballpark.

At the time linear rewards were forced upon us by fiat, the community had made its response to the abuse of the n2 by the greedy whales.
Abit and smooth had put the kibosh on their sucking up all the rewards.
Those two downvoted any votes using more than 800mv.
The result of this whale experiment was great excitement among the minnows at their votes actually registering on the ui.
Those were ~10 good days.

The affected whales werent too happy, but they got with the program, for the most part.
Steem doesnt make
root_title: An open letter to our illustrious leader and current users.

author: freebornangel
title: So, steemizens, what do we do now?
body:
Our illustrious leader has fired the help that were the greatest help that could be had in the entire world.
The crew that led us here.

Does our highly esteemed leader turn back the mistakes created by the bad advice of those losers that just got fired, or do we continue to follow the lead of the losers?

It is a crossroads.
No more, 'Just wait until SMT's get here, they will kick your ass.'
It's clear that we are closer to a price below a dime than we are more coins that nobody wants.

I say we go back to the math that brought most of the excitement.
Math that was working until the bad advice forced a fork of it.

But nobody wants to listen to me, or we wouldn't have these problems.

You gotta decide for you, dear reader.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Z6JWqQnG-image.png)
root_title: So, steemizens, what do we do now?

title: Gene Sharp, revolutionary icon.
body:
Gene left us a few months ago.
If you haven't encountered his work, here is your chance.

https://www.aeinstein.org/

![gene.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmTiFCPoqNY12R8Lg1XKNKzfFuwzqDU2F7NLyxgymECnck/gene.jpg)

Gene spent his time studying revolutions.

![genesharp1.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmYA4NbtmZhbDdFv69Lt8d6KEeXKaVV7pJ3GKqt93QCJTj/genesharp1.jpg)

His book, [From Dictatorship to Democracy](http://www.aeinstein.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/FDTD.pdf) is a handbook on how to disrupt those that want to rule by force.

![genesharp.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmddpzsba3MK8dYq51eJxmT81Sh1rPKz6NfSP1SqzL2i9H/genesharp.jpg)

If you want to be somebody, his outline of how to lead nonviolent change is a must read.

title: And here we are,....
body:

Well, Steemizen, what now?

It's becoming pretty clear that our ceo's idea of a good time is to syphon off as much value as can be had, while gleefully playing his guitar over the ashes.

I don't know that is his plan, but it sure looks likely.

Any of you here before the memory hole swallowed a working platform will recall the prominent voices calling for the reversal of our brilliant ceo's command decisions to line his friend's pockets at the expense of the newbs.
Now we got no newbs, and the price reflects his friend's cashing out.

It is an opportunity for a coup.
The coders will win, or fork to a chain that gives us what we came here for, a working social media site that pays it's users.
Not some bs pie in the sky that clearly is on hold now.

How 'bout it, @ned, can we have back the platform with a working rewards model?

Can you put the reins on the ~70 accounts that

author: freebornangel
title: Did you watch Ned's Live Stream?
body:
He was real clear to me that he doesn't want to fix what he has messed up, he just wants to abandon steem as a working social media platform that pays it's users.
He keeps repeating proof of brain when it was his very actions that changed steem from proof of brain to proof of wallet.
Nice deflections, Einstein.

Is it to be believed that steem's days are numbered as a social media platform?
Is the ego of the ceo sooo big that admitting a mistake and reverting to the math that was drawing in users impossible, or will he just string us along only to slink away a scoundrel?

If we take him at his word, we can kiss rewards good bye.
If we take him from his actions we can know that he is still creating bag holders.
I can't wait for his toxic attitude to go play with other toys.

[Listen for yourself.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Shufa7eHBes&feature=player_embedded)

Well, it's his to do with what he pleases.
Put me down for jumping to which ever developer gets a working social media model going based on steem

author: freebornangel
title: Are you happy with stinc's leadership up to this point?
body:
Ok, dear reader, we are at a cross roads on steem.
The original design has been hijacked.
To deflect from that the ceo pointed out that rewards for blogging were not the first idea.
Distribution of the coin was the first idea.
Therefore, the original idea has been hijacked by dan creating a paid blogging site.

If we take ned at his word, that silly stuff is going away because we dont need rewards when we can just give steem to our friends and sycophants and be over run with salivating investors wanting more.
![2o45xr.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/JvFceVc0-2o45xr.jpg)

In this instance i think its time for the community to look at protecting itself from those that would destroy the potential of  what we have here.
We can let ned go his own way, build his utopia, while not allowing him to wreck steem further.

We only need 21 witnesses and one dev to fork us into community control rather than stinc control.

Why do you figure stinc has demolished steem's success?
I dont know, b
root_title: Are you happy with stinc's leadership up to this point?

author: freebornangel
title: Keep working, stop paying. 17
body:
Ok, dear reader, here we are again where I try to convince you that money is not the necessary evil that you have been indoctrinated to believe that it is.

On any given Tuesday the workers of the world can throw off the yoke of the banksters.
All they have to do is keep working, but stop paying.

Picture a world where you can have anything you want.
It would be like you were a billionaire.

Want to get on an airplane to Tahiti?
Schedule it, that's kind of a small place and reservations would be required.
Unless you sail there, then there you are.

How is this utopia to be had?

Well, you got to leave your love of money behind.
You got to leave behind the indoctrination given to you by people with money.

You've noticed that when somebody is invested in something they stretch the truth to justify their continued support and belief in the thing.
They will never admit that they are wrong, and if you force them into a corner and they do, they forget about it in a couple days and go back to their belief bubble.
root_title: Keep working, stop paying. 17

author: freebornangel
title: Nose to the grindstone, wage slave!
body:
Here I am with access to a keyboard and typing times in the teens of words per minute and I got nothing much to say.

It's getting old  harping about the reward curve being kneecapped.
It's clear that we were right, and stinc is not interested in admitting that, nor correcting it.

But, who knows, maybe the rpc nodes would be soooo expensive by now that steem would be unusable.

It would have been a good problem to have.
Maybe @blocktrades would have stepped up even bigger.

Personally, I think we should fork stinc, et al control away, but I don't know how to get us listed on the exchanges.
There are more witnesses outside the top 20 than in it.

Add in that huge Steemit account to use for development and abuse fighting, and most of the negatives stinc, et al, brings to the table are suddenly not holding us back any more.

Once steemd runs on homebrew servers there is no taking us down.

All it takes is somebody to step up and drop the code somewhere we can all see it.
(I'm anticipating github to blow up.)
root_title: Nose to the grindstone, wage slave!

body:

As long as the workers do the work, the accounting department can fall in a lake. Dollars don't load the trucks, nor build the houses. Social reputation is a much better judge of who deserves what. author: freebornangel
title: How do you like steem now?
body:
Ok, dear reader, we are at a cross roads on steem.
The original design has been hijacked.
To deflect from that the ceo pointed out that rewards for blogging were not the first idea, when he still bothered to show up.

Distribution of the coin was the first idea.
Therefore, the original idea has been hijacked by dan creating a paid blogging site.

If 'distribution' had been true, they wouldn't have forked the code to reward the already have-a-lots.

If we take ned at his word, all that silly stuff is going away because we dont need rewards when we can just give steem to our friends and sycophants and be over run with salivating investors wanting more!
![2o45xr.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/JvFceVc0-2o45xr.jpg)

In this instance i think its time for the community to look at protecting itself from those that would destroy the potential of  what we have here.
We can let ned go his own way, build his utopia, while not allowing him to wreck steem further.

We only need 21 witnesses
root_title: How do you like steem now?

author: freebornangel
title: Keep working, stop paying. #18
body:
Think about it for a minute, dear reader, the workers did all the work that was required to make today perfectly crapitalistic.
They mined the minerals, made the goods, and distributed them.
Not very many of them received the full value of their labor, they got wages, instead.
The profits, ie unpaid wages, went, ultimately, to the banksters.

Now, if those workers could be convinced to continue to provide the labor, on any given Tuesday we could tell the banksters that we are done.
No more will we buy into their scheme to live above the law in opulence while workers that are far more deserving live in poverty, eating cat food sandwiches in rundown trailer parks around the world.
Ahem, Tesla,...

[Here is the idea from 600 years ago.](https://peacerequiresanarchy.wordpress.com/2013/03/27/the-monkey-master-fable/)

If you contemplate the proposal, you know I am right.
All we have to do is continue to meet demand.
As long as everything goes along like it was crapitalistic, nobody notices that the banksters no l

title: Do you support Free Speech?
body:
I know you may like to think you do, but the only way to support free speech is to seek out speech that makes you emotionally irrational and accepting that it is ok for those ideas to exist.

Want to bet that I can find some form of speech that you don't support?
In fact, you would likely advocate for the use of force to cause those speaking it to be forced to stop.

If you don't agree, you haven't thought about it long enough.

What things is it ok for you to use violence on those that disagree?

author: freebornangel
title: Should we allow the memory hole to prevail?
body:
#### Should we allow the memory hole to prevail?
***
We had a working platform when stinc, et al, hijacked us to reward their co-conspirators in taking steem down.
Should those of us that remember the difference just shut our pieholes and move on?
***
 - Yep.
***
 - Nope.
***
 - Fagetaboudit.
***
 - Yada yada.
***
 - And in other news, some crank did none of the above.
***

author: freebornangel
title: On any given Tuesday #15
body:
On any given Tuesday the workers of the world can [rise up in unison and drop their chains.](https://thesocietypages.org/monte/2013/12/21/the-monkey-master-fable/)
It is simply a matter of keeping the production going while refusing to pay for anything.

Of course this means that you no longer get paid wages, but when EVERYTHING is free, who cares about a few measly bucks that fell from the gaping maw of the bankster oligarchy that currently control this dystopia of their own design, when you can have a Lambo for the asking?

Think about that, dear reader.
No cell phone bill, provided the cell phone techs keep teching.
No mortgage.
No rent.
No homelessness once the house builders get a handle on demand.
No bills in the restaurants.
No internet bills.
No car payment.
Access to any car in the world, that you can get delivered to you,...
We can run them on alcohol rather than poison the air.

How fast do you think orbiting old folks homes could be built?
Moon bases?
Asteroid mining as a profession?

We will not
root_title: On any given Tuesday #15

title: You can't trust a patriot!
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/1GTtxPSF-image.png)

There are a lot of lessons in life that if you are of the fortunate few you can learn from the examples of others.
Hopefully, that is you, dear reader.

Me?
I'm born to lose.
I learn the hard way, and sometimes folks just don't let you come back from that.
But, it gives me a unique perspective that most conformist morons can never [grok,](https://archive.org/details/StrangerInAStrangeLandRobertAHeinlein) if they grok, at all.

Well, today's lesson comes from our hero, [Kurt Saxon.](https://archive.org/search.php?query=kurt%20saxon)
He was doing what we are doing, but 40 years ago.
The fortunate amongst us will learn from his lesson.

body:
This year's ball was in Buenas Aires, Argentina.

That it is obscured in other issues demonstrates the depth of the resistant culture in Argentina.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/1iCqjq7G-image.png)

# The G20 in Buenos Aires: Logbook November 23-25 
### Student Protests and a Football Riot 

>On November 30 and December 1, the rulers of the 20 most powerful nations will meet in Buenos Aires, Argentina. In the fourth installment of our coverage of the 2018 G20 summit, our correspondents recount clashes over neoliberal assaults on the Argentine education system, the counter-summit of left politicians, and the football riots that forced Senator for Justice and Security of Buenos Aires to resign immediately ahead of the G20 meetings.
Friday, November 23

body:

Remember Kurdistan?
This is them.
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Uq88itpM-image.png)
[From the story:](https://itsgoingdown.org/stand-together-outside-the-state/)

>The Rojavan Revolution has inspired us over the years; from the fierce resistance to ISIS and Turkish fascism, to its rejection of patriarchy and statism. 
But with the US saying that it will soon be pulling out of the region, many are left wondering what the future holds for the autonomous territories. 
Wanting to know more, we spoke with someone from Internationalist Commune, the authors of the Resistance is Life column here on IGD, to learn more.

>IGD: What are your thoughts on the US withdrawing from Syria? 
IC: When the news of Trump’s decision broke, many of us internationalists in Rojava were frantically checking the news, scrambling to prepare new work, cal

author: freebornangel
title: Decolonize the Frontiers!
body:
The Mississippi River Delta is a veritable bread basket for much of the civilization outside the crapitalust consumer economy.
Until the crapitalusts came and screwed things up, this river was doing just fine.
Let's re-wild the area.

[From the story:](https://itsgoingdown.org/decolonize-the-frontiers-the-mississippi-delta/)
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/LknP4bHt-image.png)

>Coastal Louisiana is home to 41% of the United States coastal wetlands and is the world’s seventh largest delta ecosystem. The region is covered with natural levees, barrier islands, forested wetlands, and marshes formed by Mississippi River deposits. Historically the state’s wetlands provided protective barriers for diverse coastal communities against hurricanes and extreme storms, while also serving as important ecological deterrents to climate breakdown through carbon sequestration. 
Currently, Louisiana has one of the fastest rates of coastal land loss and relative sea-level rise on the planet
root_title: Decolonize the Frontiers!

What is happening in the world is rarely important enough to make the nightly news cycle, not based on the importance in the world of the news, but they only print the news that fits (their narrative).

This is why, dear reader, I like to point you to alternative sources to the corporate media.

[Crimethinc.com](https://crimethinc.com) is a veteran source for news of all things anarchist.

[View their story on anarchistagency.com](https://www.anarchistagency.com/critical-voices/crimethinc-the-threat-to-rojava-an-anarchist-in-syria-speaks-on-the-real-meaning-of-trumps-withdrawal/)

author: freebornangel
title: To fork or not to fork, a Steemizen's delimma.
body:
Interesting times we are living in, dear reader.
The biggest proponent of proof of wallet at odds with the folks that gave it to him.

A fork that removes the ninjamined stake has not stolen anything.
A fork that excises the malignant actors that intentionally hijacked the original design steals nothing from them.
A fork that closes your account and moves forward absent your participation has not taken anything from you.

The old fork continues on like nothing has changed.
Your coins are still there.
Your account is safe.

Just as quick as the witnesses are in place the disruption ends.
Each fork moves forward under the new reality.

One like nothing changed, and another looking much better to its adherents.

The community does not belong to the chain, we are free to choose which chain to follow.
Maybe we will get the chance.

![2rlg28.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmQPG52AG7pb4Qif2HgytpVnkotVFS4cA7QzXew5haSgBQ/2rlg28.jpg)

author: freebornangel
title: To fork, or not to fork, my proposal.
body:
If you weren't here during the ~8 great days of the whale experiment, then i hope you take the time to talk to some who were.
@dan had knocked most of the rough edges off his design.
He had started removing the chock blocks that had insured that control was maintained during steem's launch.
That blocked bad actors using sock puppets from dominating who gets rewards.

The n2 reward curve is proof of brain.
Without it we get proof of wallet on the blockchain.
Don't you  get enough of that in your workaday lives?

Proof of wallet insures that steem will not live up to its designed purpose, to usher in abundance.
Thanks, @ned, thanks a lot.

For those of you that wonder why ned broke proof of brain in favor of his own wallet, you must ask the ~70 stakeholders that have enough stake to make the n2 not work.
In order for proof of brain to build value for steem, those with more than 500mv have to limit their take from the pool.
Otherwise, only the accounts favored by whales trend.

The whales, mostly, may have gott
root_title: To fork, or not to fork, my proposal.

author: freebornangel
title: On Any Given Tuesday #11
body:
The workers of the world do all the work, but yet we agree to do that work from within an economic system that keeps those doing the worst work at the economic bottom.

Why workers agree to trade their lives for pieces of paper that have their value determined by others is a real testament to how well mind control works.

'Here, you do this $1000 worth of work, I will give you $300, and assume all the risk'.
'Thank me.'

Really?
Have you taken a minute to think about this?
The crapitalusts tell us if we will do all the work, they will take all the profits, and we should kiss their ass for making this an option?
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/iNEe9V5P-image.png)

They tell us that they are taking 'the risk', but what risk is there in a going business?
Generational rot causing the kids to buy coke instead of inventory?
The boss getting divorced because he copped a feel on his secretary?
(I lost a really good job for just that reason.)

![image.png](https://files.steempeak

author: freebornangel
title: Socialism and communism, two different things.
body:

author: freebornangel
title: Neither Victims nor Executioners
body:
If you don't know who [Albert Camus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Camus) was, then you are in for a real treat.
His only entry into [TheAnarchistLibrary.org](http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/albert-camus-neither-victims-nor-executioneers) is reproduced below.



>#### November 30, 1946 Toward Dialogue 
>Yes, we must raise our voices. 
Up to this point, I have refrained from appealing to emotion. 
We are being torn apart by a logic of history which we have elaborated in every detail — a net which threatens to strangle us. 
It is not emotion which can cut through the web of a logic which has gone to irrational lengths, but only reason which can meet logic on its own ground. 
But I should not want to leave the impression... that any program for the future can get along without our powers of love and indignation. 
I am well aware that it takes a powerful prime mover to get men into motion and that it is hard to throw one’s self into a struggle whose objectives are so modest and where hope has only
root_title: Neither Victims nor Executioners

So in all seriousness, if you appreciate the content that our collective produces, and want to see more anarchist, anti-capitalist and anti-colonial analysis, please make a donation at https://sub.media/donate

title: Bloomberg News Says a Fugitive Venezuelan Colonel has Confessed to Coup Attempt
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/23VuyA7G-image.png)

>## Fugitive Venezuelan Colonel Is Shown Confessing to Coup Attempt
By Andrew Rosati


>7 February 2019, 14:40 GMT-5

>*  Garcia Palomo was captured as he slipped into country
>* He said he was in contact with CIA, Colombian officials


[From the story:](https://www.greanvillepost.com/2019/02/09/bloomberg-says-a-fugitive-venezuelan-colonel-has-confessed-to-coup-attempt/)

>A fugitive Venezuelan colonel captured last month after slipping back into the country was shown on video Thursday confessing to ties with the Central Intelligence Agency and Colombian officials.  
Colonel Oswaldo Garcia Palomo, 54, who’d publicly professed plans for rebellion and whose welfare was the focus of international attention, is shown looking reasonably fit in a dress shirt standing against a neutral background. 
He described logistical support and freedom to enter and exit Colombia as he worked last year to overthrow President Nicolas Madu
root_title: Bloomberg News Says a Fugitive Venezuelan Colonel has Confessed to Coup Attempt

title: 5 Flavors of Anarchy
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/gF2mc6I6-image.png)

[From the story:](https://www.anarchistagency.com/in-the-news/big-think-5-flavors-of-anarchy/)

>It may come as a surprise to some to find that anarchism comes in as many flavors as Ben 'n Jerry's. 
 
Matt Davis
01 February, 2019


>Anarchists are often typecast in popular opinion as black-clothed bomb-throwers.
However, many would be surprised by the number and identities of different anarchists.
What's more, anarchist beliefs aren't simply that the state should be overthrown; there are many different variations and interpretations.
It takes an independent mind to declare oneself an anarchist, but even so, the stories and characters of people who identify as anarchists can be surprising. 
Here's five snapshots of different anarchists, each with a different take on the controversial political philosophy and different experiences. 
As a quick note, this list is in no way meant to be exhaustive; there are many more influ
root_title: 5 Flavors of Anarchy

body:

You can see from the cover that this book is where Orwell got his 'boot heel stamping on the face of the people'.
It succinctly sums up life where socialism is the fad.

Ever wonder why you would know Orwell, but never be informed of this book existing?
It's a clue.

Read, dear reader, nobody is coming to give you freedom.
They are actively shrinking the ideas in our minds.
Why has skool always been more about control than education?
Because sit still and shut up are how you get along with the Iron Heel on your fa

author: freebornangel
title: How to spot controlled opposition
body:
Whether or not a person is controlled opposition, just a true belieber, or ignorant of the truth, is irrelevant if the destination is the same.
Knowing how to spot the differences will improve your survivability.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/7BEsTeXY-image.png)

[From the story:](https://www.lewrockwell.com/2019/02/no_author/how-to-tell-if-someone-is-controlled-opposition/)

>How To Tell If Someone Is Controlled Opposition
By Caitlin Johnstone 
[CaitlinJohnstone.com](https://caitlinjohnstone.com/)
February 12, 2019

>Every day in my article comments and social media I get people warning me that this or that journalist, activist or politician is “controlled opposition”, meaning someone who pretends to oppose the establishment while covertly serving it. 
These warnings usually come after I’ve shared or written about something a dissident figure has said or done, and are usually accompanied by an admonishment not to ever do so again lest I spread their malign influence.
root_title: How to spot controlled opposition

body:
Ok, dear reader, here we are again where I try to convince you that money is not the necessary evil that you have been indoctrinated to believe that it is.

On any given Tuesday the workers of the world can throw off the yoke of the banksters.
All they have to do is keep working, but stop paying.

I know you think that we would overconsume to the point of crashing the system, but that isn't possible unless production comes to a halt, and hopefully, we have enough adult empaths amongst us to rein in the children.
Provided the production continues, the stuff in wallyworld will pale quickly.
The stuff on amazon soon after that.

If you could walk into a store and have anything you wanted for free, how much stuff would you cram into your house?
At what point would your consumption overload your carrying capacity?

As a worker, doing the work so others can consume, when do you get mouthy with your neighbor over his pile of crap?
What do you teach your children about the importance of working to repay what they ha

title: Will the Patriots save us?
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/1GTtxPSF-image.png)

It's not every day that we get exposed to truth.
The flashylight boxes show a perspective of reality, but displays more illusion than reality.
A snapshot of time in an infinity of time.
It is impossible for perspectives to be the whole truth.

You have to decide for you what your truth is going to be.
It may not be the truth of others.
For it to be accepted as truth by others exposing it to other's critique is important.

Today's truth comes from our hero, [Kurt Saxon.](https://archive.org/search.php?query=kurt%20saxon)
His truth may not be everybody's, but it was his.

The fortunate amongst us will learn from his lesson, the improvident will suffer their fates.

Into the abyss created by imbalances in the steem distribution?

Seriously?
Smdh.

author: freebornangel
title: Cops are Satan!
body:
I know, dear reader, you have been indoctrinated to reject such an idea.
By both skool, and cops.
But the fact remains, good doesn't need force to be the right choice.

You've been to church, yes?
You went of your own free will?
When you got to church, nobody forced  you to sing?
Nobody forced you to follow rules or pay to the plate?
The preacher didn't shake you down for drinking on Saturday night?
Didn't demand your respect while raiding your house because you forgot your tithes?

# Of course not, god doesn't force people to love him/her.

## So, if somebody is forcing you to follow rules and pay their wages, it isn't team god, eh?

### Cops are satan!

Don't like it?
Tough.
Facts are facts.

If your utopia requires force to be adopted, it sucks.
Likely you suck, too.

Stop using force to bat for team satan, eh?


![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/213hev8K-image.png)

author: freebornangel
title: Just another lazy day in paradise
body:
Well, dear reader, lucky for us I got to a keyboard long enough to get a post out of the abyss.
It won't go out until 9am tomorrow, but you won't notice the difference.

If you are wondering why I am posting less, blame it on the [Drugwars.](https://drugwars.io/i/freebornsociety)
Or maybe a drop in willingness to second hand smoke cigarettes, whatever.

But don't fear for me, until I get my [moonsteem](https://www.moonsteem.com/?ref=freebornsociety) rocket flying I got plenty to keep me busy in the real life.

I don't miss the ability to find good content so much, anymore.
Most of you don't have whole bunch to say, anyway.

We steemizens are becoming less content creating and more time sucking.
I'm not sure what my opinion of that is, it's still too new.

I do know that until proof of wallet is banished, along with it's proponents properly publicly shamed, what is the point?
I don't have enough money to play in that game, and if I did, they wouldn't like me, they would like my money.

I would act like they l

author: freebornangel
title: Cowards run in packs.
body:
Do you feel the need to gang up on folks to get your way?
Do you go around sniping folks behind their backs?
Do you, and your cowardly friends, plot actions secretly?
Making nefarious plots to control the world?

The sheep are being separated from the goats.
Which side will you choose, dear reader?

Make your choice carefully, you will deal with the consequences for the rest of your life.
It will go on your permanent record.

Welcome to the panopticon.

title: Just another riduculously lazy day in paradise,...
body:
What day is today where you are?
I'm not sure what day it is where I am because I gave up on that crap when I got beat.

I mean, I am really tired.
I'm tired of giving 40 hours a week for 40 years to retire to catfood sandwiches in the trailer park.
Who thought that was a good idea?
I mean, other than our parents?

It's time to wake up, worker!

You do all the labor to supply the corporate toilets with gold toilet paper and slaves to do the wiping.
Willingly.
You embrace your slavery because you have no clue that you are enslaved.

[Read an f'n book, eh?](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/alexander-berkman-what-is-communist-anarchism)
That is an easy one, written just for folks that didn't make it as far as you in skool.

We don't have to take the current state of affairs as natural.
[They are anything but, and have been for over a century.](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/000271624725000116)

Your parents were just as mis-educated as everybody else's parents.
Some more than others, but th

Never in the 35 years I've been an anarchist have I seen the conditions so ripe for peace to finally triumph over the violent.

Will we do it, this time?

It is up to you, dear reader.
The revolution is won or lost in the few cubic inches behind your eyes and the few cubic feet your body occupies.

You can't change others except by setting an example.

If this one doesn't scare the crap out of you, I don't know what will.

title: News from Kurdistan
body:
Many people want to know what is happening in Kurdistan.
This film is what was happening 3 years ago.
Wanna bet it isn't much different today?

From the story as posted on:
[![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Ld92rZLw-image.png)](https://www.anarchistagency.com)

https://vimeo.com/314259429

From the description:

>Voices of Bakur looks at the Kurdish movement in Bakur, Northern Kurdistan. 

>It focuses on the period of 2015-2016, when more than a dozen Kurdish towns within the southeastern borders of Turkey declared autonomy from the Turkish state.

>In the summer of 2015, the Turkish state launched a brutal war against the Kurds who were organizing an assembly based social system founded on the principles of women’s liberation and autonomy. 

>According to the Diyarbakir Human Rights Association, 1,552 people, 320 of them civilians, and 75 of them children, were killed in Turkey between July 2015 and July 2016. 

>The film features interviews shot on the ground with vario
