author: freebornangel
title: Proof of Brain Vs Proof of Wallet
body:
Those of you that weren't here to know the difference are smothering those of us that were.
You are pulling us down the memory hole.
Please stop letting the Kool-Aid of post rewards deceive you.

### Proof of wallet sucks so hard @dan is making a clone to kill it.

Well, maybe not so much a clone as a carnival mirror of the synthesis that is steem.
We will have to wait to see.

When @abit and @smooth took control of the reward pool away from the 'Greedy Whales' that were making steem unplayable to all but their sycophants, proof of brain was restored over proof of wallet.
The community enforced soft cap was set at 800mv.
Today a cap of 500mv impacts ~70 accounts, but makes all of our votes worth more under the n2.

Stinc hurried up and forked the chain to cement proof of wallet for the win before the numbers could sink into the general crowd.
I caught what the whale experiment did, though!

My vote went from infinitesimal to .04sbd with a .10 usd price of steem!
I had a tiny fraction of the sp I have now.

T
root_title: Proof of Brain Vs Proof of Wallet

title: On Any Given Tuesday #15
body:
Here we are again.
Time to take our pill.

We have to have workers, we don't have to have dollars.


### [With thanks to this guy,...](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/category/author/alexander-berkman)
I'm going to take a minute to explain your monetary system to you, don't be surprised if you want to throw rocks at banksters when I am through. 
Please hang in with me if you already know.

The Federal Reserve is a privately owned bank that creates money from nothing and loans it into our economy. 
http://www.federalreserve.gov/faqs/currency_12771.htm 
They say that they print $100 at a cost of 14.3 cents. 
So, they profit $99.857 for each $100 bill circulation. 
Think about that, if you could mark up your wares that much wouldn't you get visions of grandeur, too?
Be willing to kill to keep your market?

Then they charge interest on top of that, because,....FU.
You are the slave of the haves that create money from nothing and trade it to you for the better parts of your life.

Every have, that doesn't create
root_title: On Any Given Tuesday #15

title: Steem Alliance, Free Fair Elections, and Me
body:
It came to my attention, very late in the process, that @steemalliance was not going to include an option to express dissent in their election.
The option to express a no vote on all of the proposals is being denied to the community.

I simply asked that the dpoll include none of the above as an option to select.

We can safely know that most Steemizens are not aware of what is happening with the steem alliance foundation.

Those that bothered to register are a minority of the 50k daily active accounts. (I'm guessing.)
That reflects more on the apathy of our community than it does on the efforts of the steem alliance.
They are doing the best they can to get the word out.

If  you have not registered, you are in luck, this election is about selecting one of the proposals that have been presented.
I'm sure the best one will prevail.
No thanks to you.

My issue with all this, aside from the general apathy of the average Steemizen, is that half of the choices are being omitted.
Only yes is being presented as an

author: freebornangel
title: BioHack the Planet 2019 Las Vegas Labor Day Weekend
body:
## Biohack The Planet Science Conference 2019

The one and only science and biohacking conference. 
Last year we sold over 240 tickets selling out the location. 

So this year we decided to move where the conference can grow and still remain affordable so we will be at the Renaissance Hotel in Las Vegas, NV on Saturday August 31st and Sunday Sept. 1st. 

We wanted to get everyone to stay in the same hotel so that scientific discussion can happen all night (there is a link on the [Eventbrite ticket sales](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/biohack-the-planet-2019-las-vegas-tickets-58604122508?aff=odeimcmailchimp&utm_source=ODIN&utm_campaign=89145d6c25-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_04_01_10_14&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_fac116480b-89145d6c25-107792137&mc_cid=89145d6c25&mc_eid=d7769357ac) for $99 hotel rooms, split it with a friend if you need to)

 Speakers will be announced soon but know that crowd favorite [Hamilton Morris](https://the-odin.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=cc0fafea28551627b92bbc168&id=d96135d9f1&e=d776

I know you must be wondering what the hell a Gand is.

Well, I've got you covered.

I'm leading you to the knowledge, but you got to assimilate it on your own, and in your own way.

Reading is why bears don't rule the planet.
If grandpa bear could pass knowledge to great grandson bear their lack of thumbs would be less a handicap.

title: Cafr1.com, Walter Burien, Tax Retirement, and You.
body:
![walterburien.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/oefA04DB-walterburien.jpg)

IF you don't know who [Walter Burien](http://cafr1.com/BIO.html) is, then you just haven't gotten out much.
He has likely been in the struggle for your freedom since before you were born. 

His web page is pretty basic, but it contains all the information you need to find out how many years of tax revenue your state, county, city, development/enterprise zone, skools, water districts, and any other gov't subdivision have hidden on the second set of books.
### [This link](http://cafr1.com/CAFR-Examples.html) will take you to links of the various state's cafrs.
Every gov't body has one, and they all have tax money invested in the stock market, or state fund that does.
 
##  [Here is his proposal](http://trfa.us/) of how to retire the need for any taxes at all.
It uses today's revenue to finance a fund to fund tomorrow's revenue.
You know, like how we have to do it at home.

 It will appeal to a wider audienc

author: freebornangel
title: Do you pay attention to your vote value?
body:
As the price goes up, and down, so too does our vote's value.
The price is up, but my vote value seems to be lagging a little.

There are a few different reasons this could be.
My go to reason is that the whales are sucking more up than normal.
I don't know that to be true, but I got plenty of reasons to suspect.
By timing their vacuuming just right they can suck up a lot while most folks, those not on the very end of the long tail, won't notice.

Now, it may just be my suspicious nature, but at this point the benefit of the doubt just isn't falling on the whales.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/BboyzC9F-image.png)

Steemworld shows some numbers, but they don't line up, for me.

If you can point me to where I can track how much goes to the top accounts each day, that would be great.
[This used to do that,](https://steemit.com/steemit/@statsmonkey/biggest-upvoters-3132018---part-ii) but he has stopped.
I don't imagine things have changed much.




http://www.steemimg.com
root_title: Do you pay attention to your vote value?

We simply *must* follow the rules set by those that control us with 'money'.

Why we all agree to play by these rules is beyond me, but I have probably read things that you don't know exist.
It's like the secret library below the Vatican.
Those that control us know what is in it, and they keep that knowledge from us to control us.
But, give us bread, and circuses, and we care not who sits on the throne.
Smdh.

body:

You guys have all the good stuff to steal from work!

>It is surely no big deal to steal a ballpoint pen from the office stationery cupboard, or some paper. 
But what about a mug, some furniture, a laptop? 
Many Americans apparently think it is fine to steal almost anything you can from work, a new report has found.

>The study, by the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners (ACFE), found that “non cash” property theft – which spans everything from notebooks to Nespresso machines to personal data – by employees has almost doubled in the US in recent years from 11% of occupational fraud cases in 2002 to 21% in

author: freebornangel
title: You can't trust a patriot!
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/1GTtxPSF-image.png)

It's not every day that we get exposed to truth.
The flashylight boxes show a perspective of truth, but displays more illusion than reality.
A snapshot of time in an infinity of snapshots.
It is impossible for perspectives to be the whole truth.

You have to decide for you what your truth is going to be.
It may not be the truth of others.
For it to be accepted generally as truth by others exposing it to the critique of others is vital.

Today's truth comes from our hero, [Kurt Saxon.](https://archive.org/search.php?query=kurt%20saxon)
His truth may not be everybody's, but it was his.
I met him twice at his house in Arkansas.
I don't think he was impressed by me, but he liked the wife just fine.  0.o
I wouldn't hold it against him, I don't like the me of then much, either.

The fortunate amongst us will learn from his lesson.
The provident will grow a garden.

![YouCantTrustAPatriot1.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/fil
root_title: You can't trust a patriot!

We will work together to make sure that we all end the day better off than when we started.

Each day we will get up and contribute to our own pile of crap rather than allowing some to pile up crap without working.

Local communities will again be our cultural heritage.
Not KUWTK.
Not the locally powerful politicians, cops, and judges setting what is acceptable while doing whatever they want in their secret clubhouses and resorts.
Grinding those they don't like into leaving town, or prison.

author: freebornangel
title: Lucy Parsons, Anarchist
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/8xIy6nf8-image.png)

## More dangerous than a 1000 rioters,....

https://www.youtube.com/embed/m1AOZlUflgo

[Lucy Eldine Gonzalez Parsons (c. 1853 – March 7, 1942)](https://www.zinnedproject.org/materials/lucy-gonzales-parsons/) was an American labor organizer, radical socialist and anarchist communist. 
She is remembered as a powerful orator.

Parsons entered the radical movement following her marriage to newspaper editor Albert Parsons and moved with him from Texas to Chicago, where she contributed to the newspaper he famously edited – [The Alarm.](https://www.loc.gov/item/sn94095384/)

Following [her husband’s 1887 execution](https://famous-trials.com/haymarket/1170-parsonsautobiography) in conjunction with the Haymarket Affair, Parsons remained a leading American radical activist as a founder of the Industrial Workers of the World and member of other political organizations.

Thanks for learning about history that has been denied to yo
root_title: Lucy Parsons, Anarchist

title: May Day in Paris, 2019
body:
If you weren't lucky enough to experience the paradigm shift first hand, here is a report from folks that did get to experience it play out in the streets.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/eidMiZED-image.png)

># May Day 2019 in Paris: “We Are Not Giving Up” 
>## Countering the New Repression—A Full Analysis from the Streets 

>This year in France, the traditional day for celebrating the struggles of the late 19th century and the introduction of the eight-hour day was part of a much larger sequence of struggle. 
As [May Day](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/peter-linebaugh-the-incomplete-true-authentic-and-wonderful-history-of-may-day) approached, the French government remained caught in a political crisis created by the still untamed [yellow vests movement.](https://crimethinc.com/2018/11/27/the-yellow-vest-movement-in-france-between-ecological-neoliberalism-and-apolitical-movements) Because we have documented May Day [2017](https://crimethinc.com/2017/05/04/may-

author: freebornangel
title: Do you want to do yourself a favor?
body:
You know, in that self help kinda way?

Well, the thing that separates us from the gorillas and bears is that we can pass knowledge across our generations.

If it weren't for books, and maybe thumbs, we wouldn't have risen above subsistence so quickly.

We would still be having to pass knowledge through oral histories, and when you start talking about jsons, apis, metallurgy, chemistry, botany, etc, I think you can see how that would quickly break down.

You would have to be in the same room long enough to assimilate the knowledge with somebody that can lay it out to you in terms that you can understand.

Could you imagine trying to build a social ecosystem if everybody had to be in the loop to hear it audibly?
It would be impossibly complex, a logistical nightmare.

So, that being said I have two books to link you to that were instrumental in my self improvement.

I used to be a real jerk,...now, not so much,...believe it, or not,...0.o
The first book is pretty controversial, I'm betting most of you have

author: freebornangel
title: Welcome to the Great Debate!
body:
It is being debated how rewards should be modified in order to pull steem out of the doldrums.

IF you just got here, this has been an ongoing debate among those that know the math, from the very beginning.

I came in at the tail end of the 100+% interest.
Let me tell you, that was easy money!

It left folks confused, though.
They couldn't wrap their heads around taking a zero off their totals every 6, or something, years.

I agree that changing to what we have has been a benefit to steem.
Most folks just aren't ready to see the elegance of the math, until somebody holds their hand and explains it to them, multiple times, that even though they don't understand, it's going to be ok.

#### 'It is also easier to fool people than to convince them that they have been fooled.'  
###### All Hail, Mark Twain!

### Better to simplify to a more broadly understood function.

Inflation serves to keep the active accounts active, without activity, of some sort, your investment is losing money.

Which brings us to the rewa
root_title: Welcome to the Great Debate!

author: freebornangel
title: Anarchist, Voluntaryist, Libertarian, and you?
body:
At some point the folks calling themselves anarchists, but that are really minarchists, libertarians, or just fools, will figure out that what they have been telling anybody that would listen about themselves was wrong, confirming the listener's belief that they were full of crap.

They like the idea of being totally [free of the spectacle,](https://youtu.be/IoUIHBSiVAY) but in reality they just want a safe space more than anything else.
Somewhere that they can feel in control of their surroundings.
Every man a king.

Principles that sound good when presented to them as a supposition, but when actually confronted with real life, you can watch the changes in their eyes when they figure out that that [karate move](https://youtu.be/MX5LixYtcVE) they saw in that classic kung fu movie won't really work for them.

#### Amusing, to say the least.
Far be it for them to find a friend and [actually practice,](https://archive.org/stream/KurtSaxonThePoorMansJamesBondVol5.pdf/Kurt%20Saxon%20-%20The%20Poor%20Mans%20James%
root_title: Anarchist, Voluntaryist, Libertarian, and you?

author: freebornangel
title: I am not innocent.
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/NKP1QCkU-image.png)

## Writings from a greek prison.

>### After spending five years behind bars as a political prisoner, Greek anarchist communist Tasos Theofilou reflects on life in prison and prison’s role in society.

>Anarchist-communist Tasos Theofilou was arrested by the Greek Anti-Terrorist Unit on August 19, 2012. 
At the Court of First Instance (2013-14), Theofilou was sentenced to twenty-five years of imprisonment for the charges of common complicity to homicide and the armed robbery of an Alpha Bank branch in Paros on August 10, 2012. 
He was acquitted of direct perpetration of homicide, joint constitution of and participation in the Conspiracy Cells of Fire (CCoF), and possession of explosives and “war material.” 
>#### At the Court of Appeal (2016-17), Theofilou was acquitted of all charges.
>In 2018, Theofilou faced the danger of going back to prison due to an appeal lodged before the Supreme Civil and Penal Court of Greece
root_title: I am not innocent.

### One year after the Insurection.

>A year has passed since the uprising that threatened the government of Daniel Ortega in Nicaragua—a largely left uprising against a nominally socialist government. 
Today, as the US government seeks to promote a civil war in Venezuela in order to expand its sphere of political and economic interests, the questions raised by the Nicaraguan insurrection are more pressing than ever. 
What should people do who oppose both Maduro’s authoritarian version of socialism and Guaidó’s authoritarian version of democracy? 
Does “anti-imperialism” just mean supporting governments connected to rival empires like Russia and China? 
What about the Sandinistas, feminists, indigenous peoples, environmentalists, students, and campesino movements who oppose Ortega? 
What about the Venezuelan socialists and anarchists who oppose Maduro?

[The story goes on at length.](https://crimethinc.com/2019/05/16/u

author: freebornangel
title: Storming the Gates!
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/sfteO1Q7-image.png)

## The New Wave of Frontal Attacks on Prisons, Jails, and Detention Centers 

>In response to a viral video prisoners released detailing moldy conditions inside of the Dekalb County Jail, fifty people flooded the jail in Atlanta, Georgia, on April 12, 2019, clashing with correctional officers and setting off smoke bombs inside the jail and fireworks outside it. 
The following month, a group twice as large marched to the jail, facing down over 100 police officers. 
Prisoners smashed the windows in their cells in order to communicate directly with the protesters outside. 
Smaller actions at the jail and outreach to the families and friends of inmates are ongoing, exerting pressure on the administrators, who have stopped commenting to the news, and contributing to a growing tide of anger against the facility. 
This is just the latest flare-up in a nationwide wave of struggles against jails, prisons, and other detention
root_title: Storming the Gates!

title: Resisting the Border Wall
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/r4flgjmN-image.png)

[Get the full story:](https://intercontinentalcry.org/resisting-the-border-wall-in-defense-of-indigenous-history-and-an-underground-railroad-outpost/)

>The Carrizo/Comecrudo Tribe of Texas, or Esto’k Gna in their own language, are indigenous to both sides of the Rio Grande river and throughout present-day South Texas, northern Mexico, eastern New Mexico; lands known as Somi Se’k. 
Today, the 1,600-member nation, based south of San Antonio, is fighting for a future that resembles their past, one devoid of borders. 
The original caretakers of South Texas, but lacking state or federal recognition as a nation, the Esto’k Gna people are fighting for their ancestors buried along the banks of the Rio Grande and in the Eli Jackson and Jackson Chanch Chapel cemeteries to spare them from desecration or exhumation by border wall construction.

>Lying right next to the Jackson Ranch Methodist chapel and cemetery, the Eli Jackson
root_title: Resisting the Border Wall

Crapitalism has made wage slaves of us all.

They refuse to allow ideas into your head that might decrease their control over the very thoughts of your mind.

I know to think this a few years ago would get you a one way trip to the rubber room in the jacket with the too long arms, but facts are facts.
You are intentionally denied information that could free you from the clutches of those that profit from your ignorance.

I've found my way out this trap by reading books written more than 100 years ago.
Back then the control grid was still pipe dream to those that now control it.

You are the victim of a concerted effort to insure that no pesky ideas about freedom, or even that freedom is a thing other than what you already have, have been intentionally denied to you.

author: freebornangel
title: Mutual Aid: Our way to freedom from the corporatacracy
body:
Many times we get caught up in the everyday turmoil of politics and news.
We often lose sight of the real revolution.

Until we end our dependence on the old way of doing things and embrace the new, we simply get a continuation of the past.

Sorry, fellow palnetters, new forms of money may help, but it won't end the problem.
We have to find ways of doing things because they are the right thing to do, and not just the most profitable.

To that end, I have brought this resource to you.
I hope it gets you to thinking of ways you can help your neighbors build a more cooperative neighborhood.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/ldiiw8wi-image.png)

>### What is Mutual Aid?

>Mutual aid is the basic principle of anarchism and the fundamental way that anarchists differentiate their vision from capitalism and the state.

>Simply put, we believe that humanity can fulfill its needs and desires better through cooperation than through competition. 
In fact, anarchists have been arguing
root_title: Mutual Aid: Our way to freedom from the corporatacracy

title: Remember MOVE?  I do.
body:
Most of history goes by in a flash and it isn't until years later that the full ramifications of what happened on the those fateful days really comes to the light.
If you rely on the msm to bring your those HIStorical moments don't be surprised that your news comes with a view.

Here is the history of what trying to live free of the thugs gets you in 'murica.

>## The History of the Black Radical Group MOVE and Its Infamous Bombing by Police

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/3U6aT0Bo-image.png)

by Kim Kelly
In 1985, an armed standoff between Philadelphia police and members of [a radical black liberation group,](http://www.philly.com/philly/news/special_packages/dailynews/20100506_An_inauspicious_beginning.html) resulted in the deaths of eleven people.

root_title: Remember MOVE?  I do.

title: Tomato Canning as Protest: How a Community Resisted Corporate Farming
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/lAaN3gJz-image.png)

By [Infoshop Staff](http://news.infoshop.org/author/infoshopstaff/) - 
August 10, 2018
[Original Story]((http://news.infoshop.org/farm-report/tomato-canning-as-protest-how-a-community-resisted-corporate-farming/))



>via YES!
by Margot Ford McMillen

>It’s mid-August, about 7:30 in the morning, and it’s going to be a hot one, probably in the mid-90s. 
It’s a good day to spend in a basement. 
A church basement, for example, where our rural neighborhood is gathering.
This is tomato-canning day, and about 20 of us will pass in and out of the basement kitchen, “working up,” as we say in Missouri, tomatoes for the winter.

>Everything comes at once in the tomato business. 
Our neighbor Lee woke up one day last week to acres and acres of tomatoes, all coming on at the same time. 
Lee sells her tomatoes at three farmers’ markets in mid-Missouri, but she knew she’d never be able to sell all these. 
She didn’t have time to pu
root_title: Tomato Canning as Protest: How a Community Resisted Corporate Farming

author: freebornangel
title: Survival Saturday #4: Our Future Lies in the Past
body:
When we simplify our lives we move from the old into the new.


http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/18/father-of-modern99639.jpg


http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/17/futureinthepastd1afe.jpg


http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/17/futureinthepast20382c.jpg


http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/17/futureinthepast31058e.jpg

I met Kurt during a stressful period in my life. Things were in a full state of flux. Finding his address in a library reference book led to me shaking his hand in his living room. He wasn't too impressed with me, but he liked the girl with me. I was saddened to go back too many years later to discover that he had met an uncelebrated end. I have decided to pick up his flag and advance it as far as I can into the 21st century. The truths he spoke in the 70's and 80's resonate today just as loud as they did then. If only more were listening. Thanks for taking time to read his works. http://
root_title: Survival Saturday #4: Our Future Lies in the Past

body:

by Nathan Revercomb
[Original Story](http://news.infoshop.org/anarchist-news/the-anarchist-urban-ecosystem-a-rethinking-of-the-urban-environment/)

http://news.infoshop.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/0522_mz_farming2.jpg

>#### In this second installment of my series on the anarchist urban ecosystem, I will be taking a look at food production in a sustainable anarchist urban environment.



>##  AGRICULTURE IN THE CITY

>Food systems are integral to the support of cities and indeed are vital to living things including people. 
Modern food production in the form of industrial agriculture is incredibly destructive and inefficient. 
There is a great waste of resources in the form of fuel, time, and other inputs with relation to the rural based corporate farming model. 
However, those are not the only problems with monocultural food production.

>Carbon emissions from mechanized farming and the subseq
root_title: The anarchist urban ecosystem: A rethinking of the urban environment

author: freebornangel
title: Don't miss the half price sale at The Emporium!
body:
My non-profit has been in mothballs ever since Big Bro decided to put his hammer down on us.
One day I went out to rent a movie and didn't come back for 61 months.
Because our financing arrangements included knowing my grower, I had to take an advanced course in civics.

Luckily, I still had friends on the scene to mothball most of it until I could get back.

Well, new friends, today is your day to benefit from the half price sale at The Emporium.
## Don't you feel lucky?

Nothing is ready to ship.
The pics do not reflect current inventory.

![fbs4.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Eir7lKQv-fbs4.jpg)

What you are buying is akin to a lottery ticket.
You are betting that I make it into production.

I will be making it into production, the question is a matter of when.
Do I have to wait for my social security check, or do my investments pay off enough to let me do it ahead of time?

![fbskiln.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/sjgSBv2h-fbskiln.jpg)

By buy
root_title: Don't miss the half price sale at The Emporium!

They had enough sense to not mess with things that they had no clue what they were doing.

Freedom requires that you be offered the chance,....
Experience can be a bitch.

I have tested the efficacy of the receipe's claim, it does in fact make laughing gas.
My experience was that I needed to evaporate more water from the brine.
Were I to do it again, I would super saturate the brine to reduce steam production while making the gas.

If you have never experienced laughin

title: On Any Given Tuesday,....
body:
Here we are again, dear reader.
I know that you know that on any given Tuesday we can simply continue doing all the work the world needs to maintain the levels of goods that we consume, but stop paying to get that work back from the crapitalusts, who live merely to leach off the workers, and viola!

# Freedom!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/ZdwdXvQM-image.png)

We do all the work, sell that work product to the crapitalusts for wages, then buy that work product back at a discount that they call 'profits'.
Then, we get all worked up over how lucky we are to support this leaching class!

### Why without them we would be doing all this work for nothing!

We are very lucky that they deign to employ us at all, or we would all be living under bridges.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/8hIeF4Nh-image.png)

I don't know who thought crapitalism was the greatest thing since sliced bread, but clearly they are mistaken.
It's great for the 1%, bu

author: freebornangel
title: HardFork21, smdh.
body:
Now, IF the responsible whales take control of the pool.
IF the bad whales stop maximizing roi at the expense of everything else, including the price.
IF those responsible for the debacle that is steem 3 years later have lost control.

## HF21 might not be so bad.

Steem started at 50/50 curation.
It changed to 75/25 before I got here.

I got here at just the tail end of the 100% inflation.
That was some good stuff.
F5 and your balance went up.
Unsustainable, but nice to watch going up.

I was here when delegation wasn't a thing.
The golden boys and girlz were getting all the gold.
They used Ned's posting key to vote their crap posts to trending.

Delegation became a thing and Ned just delegated to them and they voted their own comments after that.
IF you bothered to check, you would see exactly how much of that steem was dumped on exchanges.
I'm gonna take my napkin out, write down >87%, and dare anybody to prove me wrong.

#### Mrdelegation sure needed to make my influence worth less to the authors I suppo
root_title: HardFork21, smdh.

author: freebornangel
title: Open your eyes, slave! Rise up, if you can!
body:
I've been all in on anarchism ever since I was introduced to the idea as a young private in Frankfurt.

Since that time, I have watched the ebb and flow of the heads willing to butt heads in the streets.
We are seeing a resurgence in Europe and an awakening in the united snakes.
Seeing an insider hack of Ronnie Reagan's administration come out as anti-crapitalust must certainly have plenty of neocons spinning in their graves.

## Thank goodness, I was getting light headed holding my breath.

author: freebornangel
title: Report from the streets of Hong Kong
body:
Every day anarchists go in to the streets to pay with their lives for your freedom.
The least you can do is support those around you that are willing to pay this sacrifice so that you can have the few freedoms you have left.

## Let me tell you, dear reader, there are no freedoms if you don't take them.

If you don't drive your car without insurance, or a seatbelt, at least once in a while, you might as well get some free donuts and a plaque of appreciation for being their best cop.

If you consciously decide to do what you are told, rather than what you will, you are their perfect slave.
They expend no resources keeping you on the plantation and buying at the company store.

Shame on you, freedom lover.
You are a black mark on your ancestor's bloodline that stood up when they were needed to make sure you gonna grow up with the little freedoms you still have.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/kXIrSrq6-image.png)


### >Hong Kong: Anarchists in the Resistance to the Extrad
root_title: Report from the streets of Hong Kong

author: freebornangel
title: Sudan: Behind the Massacre in Khartoum
body:
If you are relying on the msm to bring you what is happening in the world, do yourself a favor.

By controlling what is allowed to exist in your mind they have enslaved you in such a way that you don't even recongnize the bars as controlling you, but protecting you from the dangers of being free.

title: Keep Working, Stop Paying!
body:
Escaping the crapitalust dystopia is as easy as that.
In fact, if we don't do something along those lines we will never escape the crapitalust paradigm.
It is impossible.

As long as labor is traded for money, and money traded for goods, crapitalism is taking place whether we do that on the left and call it socialism, or on the right and don't call it fascism.
Money is the root cause of this issue.

It's great if you have it, but if you don't, life just keeps getting harder.
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/WKbTp1kr-image.png)

If you have money, the world is your oyster.
No doors are closed to you.
Healthcare is a matter of paying the money.
Clean toilets are a given.
People take care of those things for folks that have money.

If you don't have money, none of that applies to you.
Whether you actually work a job keeping those other folks in their luxury, or if you run a business of your own.

People doing jobs are not wealthy.
They work to enrich the wealthy.

Some work

author: freebornangel
title: Why French Farmers are Plotting Revolution.
body:
Why French Farmers are plotting revolution.

By  [John Litchfield](https://unherd.com/author/john-lichfield/)

>Combray is a fictitious French village in the novels of Marcel Proust. 
It is also a genuine village, or constellation of hamlets and farms, in the Norman hills 30 kilometres south of Caen.

>Daniel Courval’s farm is as satisfying a picture of times past as any conjured by the words of Proust — a stone house and a necklace of out-buildings in a hidden valley on the edge of the ‘real’ Combray. Snowy-white Charolais cattle graze on sloping fields, climbing to a rocky, wooded plateau.

>“Yes, it’s beautiful here but look — look at these fields with all their slopes and dips,” M. Courval said. 
“Most of this ground is full of boulders and pebbles. 
I can raise beef animals here but I can’t do much else. 
That’s the problem. 
You’re looking at the problem right there. 
They, the people in Paris, in Brussels, say that they want the countryside to survive. 
They say we are the custodians of this beauty
root_title: Why French Farmers are Plotting Revolution.

author: freebornangel
title: Remembering Tatiana Bakunin
body:
Don't know who that is?
Well, you are not alone.

>## Remembering Tatiana Bakunin 
>And All the Other Invisible Figures in History 

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/jAWfhaqh-image.png)
 
>To observe the 204th anniversary of her birth, we remember Tatiana Bakunin, sister of the revolutionary anarchist Mikhail Bakunin. 
On the basis of all the available information, Tatiana and her sisters were as courageous and creative as Mikhail. 
Tatiana repeatedly played a pivotal role behind the scenes in her brother’s life and in the intellectual development of several other important thinkers. 
The fact that her name and ideas are not widely known today attests to the barriers she faced and the deficiencies of the “great man” model of history.

>Nearly all of what we know about Tatiana appears in the margins of stories written about men. 
She is one of the countless people who remain invisible through the lens of patriarchal memory, which conceals both her contributions and the thi
root_title: Remembering Tatiana Bakunin

>## Report: From Democracy to Freedom Brazil Tour 
>### Including a Review of Anarchist Projects and Struggles throughout Brazil 

>Throughout June and July 2019, CrimethInc. operatives from South and North America visited fifteen cities in seven different Brazilian states to present the print edition of Da Democracia à Liberdade, the Portuguese version of our book From Democracy to Freedom. 
The tour also served as an opportunity to compare notes about resistance to the Trump regime and the far-right populist government of Jair Bolsonaro in Brazil. 
This report from our trip also offers an overview of the some of the social centers and organizing going on in Brazil today. 
We have been

title: Clarence the Martian Killer
body:
By Kurt Saxon.

http://www.steemimg.com/images/2017/01/20/pmjb4062d.jpg


http://www.survivalplus.com/defense/page0002.htm

Chapter One:


THE DAY MARS INVADED WASHINGTON


Clarence hated Martians. He had hated them since he'd watched a science fiction story on Martian invaders a few weeks before on the ward's TV. This hatred and then fear was reinforced by a rerun of the old Kevin McCarthy version of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers". He was the only person in the State Hospital who realized the Martians were getting in just like plant pods, growing bodies occupied by the souls of Martians.

To Clarence, movies were true and on purpose. They were made and shown to alert him to the dangers to those he loved, which was everybody. He retained them and called up incidents from them in flashbacks whenever he was uncertain. His guides saw to that.

So Clarence knew all about the Martians. But his doctor would not believe him. Not

[Redeemers Irredeemables](https://github.com/steemit/redeemer-irredeemables) But that is outright abuse mitigation. Not all bad. This, however, seems to be malicious. ![Screenshot 27.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/4B6czVwr-Screenshot2027.png) Here is the link: https://steemit.com/steemit/@freebornangel/why-you-shouldn-t-support-the-whalevoters-and-gangs Here is the body and title of the post: ># Why you shouldn't support the whalevoters and gangs. >

When a whale votes, everybody else's vote loses power.

If a whale votes with enough sp to take up 10% of the votes cast on any given day, that 10% comes at the cost of everybody else that voted.

The only way to spread the math out is if the very largest whales don't vote.

If you join one of the gangs to be better rewarded what eventually happens is only gang members get rewar
root_title: Is shadow banning a thing on steemit?

author: freebornangel
title: Listen up, steemizens!
body:
Today is the last day that our posts and votes payout under the hf20 rules.

From this point forward we are voting and posting with rules that are gonna change next week.

When the hardfork hits, all the math on old posts will change to the new math.

That means that if authors are really gonna take a hit then those that profit from our loss will get a full week's pay before the flagging starts to even things out.

### Thank you, witnesses!
## Couldn't we start with a proactive change to the math, all posts and votes changing as they occur after the fork?

#### What is gonna happen now is that a full week of bogus data is going to enrich the already rich.

#### How convenient.

# All hail, stinc!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/IQSXSzIH-image.png)

It won't look like you are helping, but every sp counts when it takes away from abusive spammers dumping

author: freebornangel
title: Justin Teigen: Ten years later
body:
Don't know who that is, dear reader?
Don't feel bad, it is unlikely that you would.

Justing was a young man just trying to get by in St. Paul, Minnesota.
He was living life in his own unique way.
Then, he comes into contact with the local organized uniformed crime gang in the area, and he doesn't get to play this game anymore.
#### Like [thousands of others.](https://thefreethoughtproject.com/americans-killed-cops-outnumber-americans-killed-iraq-war/)
He left behind a young wife and son.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/gqQI85at-image.png)

># Justin Teigen Matters: Ten Years Later 

>By Georgia Fort, Unicorn Riot 
August 18, 2019 
St. Paul, MN  

>At the age of 24, Justin Teigen took his last breath following an encounter with Saint Paul Police Officers. 
Multiple narratives have tried to explain the chain of events that resulted in Teigen’s body being found at a recycling center in Inver Grove Heights.
Teigen was engaged at the time of his death to Toshira Garraway.
root_title: Justin Teigen: Ten years later

body:
# Sky doesn't fall!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/bmp9f6dO-image.png)

This documentary is from Thessaloniki, Greece.
The owners abandoned the business after not paying the workers for two years.

This is not the only example of folks doing their own thing in the absence of a ruling class.
It happens across the world, even if those of us in the west have been led to think otherwise.

If you haven't been outside the borders of the united snakes, I highly recommend it.
Travel will rid you of biases much faster than many other means.

Once you see that those folks in china are only minorly different than the folks in the west, you will rest easy to know that their mom's think their son's wives aren't worthy, either.

Just watch any crowd scene, you will see people acting like people, just using different syllables to discuss the goings on.

I've been to 3 continents and 7 countries, when I got there, they were playing the same games we do, j

title: International Volunteers of the Rojava Revolution
body:
For my dear readers that don't know, the Kurds in Northern Iraq got ahold of [Murray Bookchin's books,](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/category/author/murray-bookchin) and were anarchists after that.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/E100vS5c-image.png)

I gave Bookchin a chance, but he was just a rehash of the orginals, [Kropotkin](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/category/author/alexander-berkman) and [Berkman.](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/category/author/alexander-berkman)

If you call yourself an anarchist, and you haven't read those books, stop calling yourself an anarchist.
You are making us replow ground that people gave their lives for.

>## Interntional Volunteers of the Rojava Revolution

>In 2019, Unicorn Riot interviewed three New Yorkers who volunteered to fight alongside the Peoples’ Protection Units (YPG) and Syrian Democratic Forces against ISIS and Turkey. 
The documentary features their oral accounts overlaid with contributed footage from anonymous s

author: freebornangel
title: You know what would have been great about HF21?
body:
If instead of making small votes smaller, we had made big votes smaller.

It's not the small votes giving ~30% of the reward pool to 10 posts, every day, day after day, for the last two plus years that is the problem.

Seriously, we need an influence cap.
I suggest 500mv.
I do that because the folks causing the trouble have more than that.
Absent their influence steem makes sense to the everyman.

They just do their work, go home, and try to escape the fact that they have been enslaved by a system that keeps them serving masters that think, by virtue of their privilege, they are better than them.

That think that the working class is there to be tolerated, at best.
Sure, some escape the trap, becoming the 'shining beacons on the hill', 'you can grow up to be president some day', 'why don't you be more like that Thompson boy, he's successful?' etc,...

But what if your dad was a drunk?
What if you mom was codependent on someone to provide her dope, th

title: Do you need a lawyer?
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/SYGRCibj-image.png)

Let me tell you right up front that your lawyer's first loyalty is to the bar association that lets him/her practice.
The Bar Association doesn't care about you, you don't pay dues.

This is one of the things that you probably never consider in your evaluation of your how the system is serving you.

Likely you just go through your day and never consider if the 'just us' system is serving your needs valiantly, or corruptly.

You don't come into contact with them, what do you care?
Lock 'em up, throw away the key, right?

Look around, is that system lowering crime, or do we have more crime than ever?

You know what stops crime, an armed citizenry stops crimes.
Vigilante neighbors stop crime.

And people that learn to proceed without lawyers in court stop crime.

You do not need a lawyer, you need legal knowledge.

Everyday workers fill the shelves.

author: freebornangel
title: The Paris Commune, Anarchism, and You
body:
I try to bring relevant data from our past to you so that you can expand on the education you got at the hands of those that will kill you to control you.

This week I have been fortunate to have more keyboard time than has been normal for the last few months.
I hope you can tell the difference, dear reader.

The Paris Commune lived from March 18th, 1871 until the 'Bloody Week' following the 21st of May, 1871.
These few short weeks were the last the world would see of self governance until the [Unknown Revolution](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/voline-the-unknown-revolution-1917-1921-book-one-birth-growth-and-triumph-of-the-revolution) of 1917 to 1921 in the Ukraine.

Those that rule by force then had until 1936 and the [Spanish Civil War.](https://archive.org/details/al_Edward_Conlon_The_Spanish_Civil_War_Anarchism_in_Action_a4)

As you can see, those 'ruling elites' have had plenty of time to not tell you the full history of anarchism in the world.
They have led you to believe that anarchists are
root_title: The Paris Commune, Anarchism, and You

author: freebornangel
title: Mikhail Bakunin, the working man's friend
body:
[Mikhail Bakunin](https://www.britannica.com/biography/Mikhail-Bakunin) was born in Premukhino, Russia on the 30th of May, 1814.
He died July 1st, 1886.
In Bern, Switzerland.

You may be wondering why I think that is important to you, dear reader.
Well, it's really not all that important.
Who cares about men and their lives when it is their ideas that are with us even after their departure.

### The ideas of Mikhail are very important to you.
(If you love freedom.)

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/whiQFGtB-image.png)
[source](http://robertgraham.wordpress.com/2014/08/02/from-anarchy-to-anarchism)

[The work](http://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/michail-bakunin-on-the-international-workingmen-s-association-and-karl-marx), that I will excerpt below for you to get a taste of why this man's ideas have been left out of your 'finest education in the world', intentionally, will show to you that in 1872 the world was much as it is today.
The same problems, the same ruling clas
root_title: Mikhail Bakunin, the working man's friend

author: freebornangel
title: Learn to live without rules.
body:
Every day when we get up we start to follow an unspoken set of rules.
We brush our hair, we brush our teeth.
We rush out the door to fit our cog into the larger machine keeping everything well greased.
### We do this not because we think it is the best thing to do with our time, but because these are 'the rules.'

# Well, dear reader, I am here to blast into your subconscious the absolute imperative that you begin to think for yourself.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/inVq38Cl-image.png)

If you only think the thoughts that you have been fed to you by those that came before you, how do you expect to be free?

Do you like being a slave?
Always doing what you are told?

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/uLrH1pZU-image.png)

If you don't free your mind, you will never realize that working 50-60 hours a week, 50 weeks a year, 40 years of your life making somebody else richer is just not a good idea, for most of us.

It works fine if you h
root_title: Learn to live without rules.

It's no big secret that the drumpster may be better than the other choices, but he is not here to save us from being ruled by elites.
He may be freeing us from the satanic arm of the powers that be, but he is not here to give us freedom.
He doesn't have time for that.

But, I am also sure that you share the concern that being hit with a stick is no better when an eagle sits on it, or it is wrapped in red, white, and blue bunting.

As long as we are gonna be ruled involuntarily we might as well voice our opinions to the current rulers in concert with others that don't like the status quo, either.

Whatever that is, make a sign, go to the park, and find your affinity group, eh?

There may even be other steemizens there?

author: freebornangel
title: Freedom Tuesday #28
body:
Yep, it's here again, dear reader.
Today we could have kept doing the work necessary to fill the shelves, but instead of paying to get them back from our overlords, and being trapped by a monetary system in a cycle of poverty, we could have just taken what we needed from the shelves.

### It is really just as simple as that.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/79DEVWdW-image.png)

Now, getting a Maserati might entail a waiting list, but put your order in and when supply catches up with demand, viola!, a Maserati in your driveway.

Maybe you want a Tesla.
Maybe you want roller blades.
Whatever you want, under the new paradigm, you just place your order, or go to the warehouse, and get your stuff.

Now, i am sure some of you have been indoctrinated into modern economics and human nature and are saying this will never work.

What i need you to ask yourself is where you got the data that you base that learned opinion on?

Did you get it from a flunky of the current system?
Mayb
root_title: Freedom Tuesday #28

author: freebornangel
title: Guns and ammo for everybody!
body:
### The very freedoms we so lovingly cherish flow from the barrel of a gun.

Like it, or not, if you don't defend  your rights, you won't have any.
Men with guns will come take them.

Look at the left wing of the two party bird.
Vowing to send men with guns to take your guns.
How doublespeak,....

Don't think the right wants to safeguard your rights.
They stop defending them if you posses a plant.
Or get out of line in any way.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/lKC1HfNr-image.png)

Why you would think that once I got elected to office I was there to defend your rights is just silly on your part, and lucky on mine.
I can commit any crime, brazenly, and you will cheer me on because I might be a crooked politician, but I'm your crooked politician.

Politics have been this way since the first two men picked up sticks and [started farming their neighbors](https://thesocietypages.org/monte/2013/12/21/the-monkey-master-fable/) rather than the land.
They soon learned that it is b
root_title: Guns and ammo for everybody!

author: freebornangel
title: The Anti-Fascist Nuclear Bunker Under Amsterdam You Didn’t Know Existed
body:
Now, isn't that a grabber of a title?

For those of you new to anarchism, you must know that squatting empty buildings has long been the thing to do.

Why pay with wages from a slave job when you can squat an unused building?

It's a no brainer, to me.


![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/bj13jF6F-image.png)

>By Andrew Neef, [Unicorn Riot](https://unicornriot.ninja)
September 13, 2019
Amsterdam, Netherlands  

>An old nuclear bunker, hidden underneath Vondelpark in the city center of Amsterdam, has been transformed into a shelter for independent culture.

>In 2019, a collective of volunteers maintain the [Vondelbunker](https://vondelbunker.nl/) as a meeting space to sustain and explore counter-culture activities. 
The bunker hosts a variety of events within its walls, from yoga, art shows and [concerts,](https://archive.org/details/BlackBox_Red_Live_at_Vondelbunker-11811/BlackBox_Red_-_01_-_BlackBox_Red_at_Vondelbunker.mp3) to [film screenings,](https://vondelbunker.nl/thi
root_title: The Anti-Fascist Nuclear Bunker Under Amsterdam You Didn’t Know Existed

author: freebornangel
title: How to fix steem over the next 7 days.
body:
Right this minute the largest problems of steem could be resolved with some simple behavior changes of us all.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/RT7C5Oh0-image.png)

I use steemauto.com to keep a list of must read authors.
They get content neutral votes, every time they post.
I read nearly every one of them, too.
They are on my must read list.

However, the highest they can get is 20%.
My autovoter only votes a very select, 3 or 4 low volume authors, few above my 2stu cut off.

### If you are autovoting someone that routinely tops the charts, lower your percentage, eh?

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/HGk6e45D-image.png)

But that isn't the only behavior we need to establish as norms in the culture we call steemizens.

Which, if you hadn't noticed is what we are doing here.
We are establishing the norms of behavior that we tolerate and/or are accepting of.

No drunken rants about chat sexting with fame whores to be one yourself.
### N
root_title: How to fix steem over the next 7 days.

author: freebornangel
title: Freedom Tuesday #29
body:
Here we are again, dear reader.
We could have put in our order for a Maserati today, but you didn't tell your friends the secret to getting one.

# Keep working, stop paying.

Freedom is just this one simple step from happening.

Workers already do all the work.
Bosses keep all the profits.
We get 'wages' that cannot add up to the value of the labor that we do.
If the workers could buy back 100% of the value of their labor, there would be no profits.
Profits are unpaid wages.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/7JzjcVmU-image.png)

If all the workers simply stop paying for things, they can escape this bankster dystopia in one day.

No wars.
No iron fisted revolutions.
No blood in the streets.
No new boss, same as the old boss.

Just a simple switch over, on a Tuesday.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/2HDDGCbI-image.png)
 



Instead of hoping to grow up to be president, and wealthy, one day, we simply take what we need from the pile tha
root_title: Freedom Tuesday #29

title: Are you against guns and ammo for everybody?
body:
Well, what you got to ask yourself is how the war on drugs worked out.

I mean, alcohol prohibition didn't work out.
Drugs won the war on drugs.
Poverty is still putting poor people on the frontlines of the war on poverty.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/5LddmieR-image.png)

Do you really expect that a war on guns will turn out any different?

How do you propose that gun owners be compelled to turn in their guns?
You gonna send men with guns to take them?
How [doublethink](http://mondopolitico.com/library/1984/1984.htm) of you.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/glMWo6om-image.png)

In fact, are you really 'murican if you don't love guns?
Can you, with a straight face, sit there and tell me that guns solely in the hands of the 'legitimate' gov't would have led us to throw off King George?

Seriously?

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/EA9wqDCD-image.png)

The only freedom that exists in the world is
root_title: Are you against guns and ammo for everybody?

author: freebornangel
title: Wish me luck, steemizens!
body:
Tomorrow I go into the lion's den.
Well, not actually tomorrow because today is Monday and this post won't post until Thursday, but you won't know that, unless I tell you.

I have to go to traffic court to get my license back.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/Rqzin5hN-image.png)

4 years ago I got pulled over for speeding.
83 in a 60.
The damn carbs on that bike weren't synched right and that was all she would give me.
If I could've hit 110, I never would have gotten the ticket.

As it was, the cop didn't bother to put a copy of the ticket in my property, so when I got out of jail, there was no ticket as far as I knew.

Fast forward 3 years, I go to get a new physical license because the cop failed to put that in my property either, and I find out that my license has been suspended all along.
I didn't show up to the hearing because I didn't know there was a hearing.

Well, on Friday I have to go to the new hearing.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak
root_title: Wish me luck, steemizens!

author: freebornangel
title: Happy Friday, NewSteem!
body:
I will be in the bowels of satan soon, wish me luck!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/hfriouMP-image.png)

I have until 2:30 pm to be a free man, then I take my freedom, and likely my life, in my own hands.
If you have not prepared to defend yourself in court you would likely be looking for support from your lawyer at this point.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/n9ECmpLF-image.png)

Me, on the other hand, I have had practice at this.
I fought them to a draw last time.
They charged me with crimes that were felonies, but are now straight legal.
How f'd up is that?

They wanted to give a minimum of 10 years in the pen!
For a plant!
Less than one gram.
Smdh.
You people pay taxes to support this crap.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/aQ670age-image.png)

So, the first thing I did was point out that the law didn't support the charges.
They had to admit I was right, because I was right.
They didn't like

title: Uh oh, don't look now!
body:
It looks like our selling moratorium is at an end.
Not that that is all bad, imo.
I need the price to stay low for a few more weeks.

https://steemit.com/steemit/@penguinpablo/weekly-steem-stats-report-monday-september-30-2019

Look in section 8.
Alpha, I'm told, is stinc's selling account.
Blocktrades doesn't receive and send the same coin.
Any steem sent to blocktrades is converted to other coins.

All hail, @blocktrades!
He has supported steem from very early on.

So, stinc's selling account sending to blocktrades equals stinc selling, imo.
## So much for the moratorium.


In other news, there is a sale on steem!

body:

We could've called Ralph's Limos to cart us around, for free.

We could've gone to the car warehouse and checked out a Maserati, Lambo, or Fiat 500(!!??), for the day, or indefinitely.
All we have to do is get the other workers to agree to continue making the products and distributing them.

We workers already do all the work in the world.
It's not like the few hundred corporate ceo's did any work.
They should find something productive to do.

Every day, workers go into the mines, mills, and highways of the world to make, and distribute, the goods.

We all have shoes because a worker made them and a driver drove them to us.

It's not like it was particle physics.

All we have to do is have everybody in

author: freebornangel
title: Belly of the Beast, pt1.
body:
Well dang it.
### Where I hang out, if your word is no good, you are no good.
Friday, in court, the judge told me that I was good to go, so I turned and walked out.
However, my ugly legacy has reared it's ugly head, once again.

I walked out without getting a copy of his order.
He handed it to the clerk, said I could go, so I did.
Once the order is signed and given to the clerk it is set in stone.
It's just how courts are designed to work.

I was half a mile away before I realized that that dude might be a snake.
I mean, he did get to be judge during the most corrupt administrations this, and every other, united snake has ever had.

Don't believe me?
Hide and watch.
The time is coming.
Pathfinders find it first.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/vOqBk3Oh-image.png)

Now I am all discombobulated because I am going to have to ride 4 miles downtown, into the high plains winds both ways, just to hold a corrupt piece of s**t to his word.

Wish me luck as I use the tactics he w
root_title: Belly of the Beast, pt1.

author: freebornangel
title: You would be so proud of me, dear reader.
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/B0fsXNar-image.png)

I got down to the courthouse just in time for lunch.
This is par for my course, I like evenings better than mornings.

Anyway, once I got through scaring the young ladies in the belly of the beast they call 'Records', I ran into the judge!

I can't imagine why those young ladies would be scared of me, but it does seem par for my course.
I would bet they don't run into many like me.
I was all sweaty from a 4 mile bike ride, too.

### That tends to freak 'em out.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/MAqcJcrq-image.png)

They think I'm all coked up.
Add in the crazy eyes of a man that has [looked behind the veils,](https://archive.org/details/MoralsAndDogmaOfTheMasonic) and I guess it becomes easy to see why they would be scared.
I'd be scared of me, too.

Anyway, I have decided to put the documents in another post.

This one will tell the tale.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/f
root_title: You would be so proud of me, dear reader.

author: freebornangel
title: Where are the curation rewards going?
body:
Is it just me, or are curation rewards down a lot?

One of the great things about steem is it shows us the world as it is.
If you pull a string here, something over there moves, too.

When the maximizer whales were taking nearly all the rewards under the n2, there was no doubt about it.
When a whale votes, everybody else gets less.
Steem is a commons.

In [this link](https://steemworld.org/@freebornsociety) you can see that my 30 day curation rewards are ~6x my 7 day rewards.
You can also see that 4x my 7 day rewards won't come close to hitting that 30 day number.

It looks, to me, that the maximizers have struck, again.

[carlgnash](https://steempeak.com/abusive/@carlgnash/re-freebornangel-pyxyfv) tried to say that I had some beneficiary rewards that was doing it, but that doesn't explain what I see.
The curation rewards themselves are down, not just the total.

If you can explain this dramatic reduction in rewards, please do so.

![3HaJVw3AYyXBBQkN3tCkhE2EjPPNPEEY7rZsT4k8E4aPBLjjU4T3hN4b4jQMDrkJW4bFBpk6VQN
root_title: Where are the curation rewards going?

author: freebornangel
title: Belly of the Beast! pt#3
body:
Ok, today we will be looking at the discovery motion, and Brady request.
This is a separate motion to the motion to dismiss, but [part of the package.](http://marcstevens.net/store/motion-to-strike-dismiss.html)

Each one of these will have a variation on this theme.
Each case has a different set of facts, so some editing will be necessary.

I'm glad to help with that, just ask.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/RKaY7zha-image.png)

IN THE DISCTRICT COURT OF THE __number__ JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF ___your state here___ SITTING IN AND FOR __whatever___ COUNTY


State of whatever

          Vs

your name here
	case number


Request for Discovery and Brady Request


     Comes now ____________ who hereby requests counsel for the alleged plaintiff to provide discovery.
     All my interactions with government employees are under threat, duress and coercion, only to avoid further aggression against me and are not a waiver of jurisdiction.
This is also a Brady request.
root_title: Belly of the Beast! pt#3

author: freebornangel
title: Belly of the Beast #4
body:
The formatting of these documents is leaving something to be desired.
I'll try to leave the [attentat](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/serafinski-blessed-is-the-flame) porn out, too.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/l5d0E0BX-image.png)

Up to this point we have covered the discovery and Brady request and Motion to Dismiss for failure to present a cause, nor victim.

If these two haven't won already, and you won't find out most likely until your trial date, in a traffic ticket, or preliminary hearing in a real court(never waive those, and fire any lawyer that tells you to) then you need to be prepared to present these two to the court.

Remember to bring copies for the DA, clerk, judge, and yourself.
Everything you present to the court needs to be in those hands, it is your responsibility as your own lawyer to get that done.
Be sure to do it, or you will lose, on a technicality, but a loss, none the less.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/fr
root_title: Belly of the Beast #4

author: freebornangel
title: Belly of the Beast #5
body:
In today's class will discuss what it takes to get into the court of appeals, in my state.
Your state is likely to follow a very similar procedure, but little details will sink your case.
## [Read the local rules!](http://www.okcca.net/online/rules/rulesrvr.jsp)

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/rKBJZXvC-image.png)

Motion to Stay Execution

Now Comes ____________, by special appearance, participating under threat, duress and coercion, not submitting to the court’s jurisdiction, who hereby moves this court to stay execution of judgement pending appeal in the Court of Criminal Appeals.

Verified Motion to Stay Execution
1.	Title 22, Chapter 18, Appendix Section X, Rule 10 states that upon a verified motion this court can stay execution pending appeal of adverse judgement.
2.	The record before this court holds no facts asserted to prove that being physically in a designated geographic area causes the laws alleged to be applicable to alleged defendant.
3.	Being presumed inno
root_title: Belly of the Beast #5

author: freebornangel
title: It's Sunday, but on a Wednesday!
body:
I'm out to the library to get on a desktop and a proper keyboard.
I do most of this from a tablet.

It's Wednesday, but a front moves through tonight, and Friday is supposed to have wind chills in the 20's.

That isn't all that bad, but I got enough desert dweller dna in me to get the work done now, and hide under the blankets then.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/uAvrC3ic-image.png)

So, here is a post that comes out of my head, from the top.
Lucky you!

I hope you take part of your Sunday to look back over all the great content I brought you this week.
Just today has the court minute shown up online.

It is now official, dismissed without costs.

>### Hey, Pa, I ain't born to lose them all!
> ##### Just a bunch of 'em before I learn how to fight back for myself.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/DxwmXuBE-image.png)

At some point I might file for post conviction relief on that weed charge, now that it's legal, and all!
You'd think

author: freebornangel
title: Freedom Tuesday #31
body:
Yes, dear reader, we wasted one more Tuesday because we didn't get our neighbors notified that robots can do work more efficiently than human workers and all  we have to do is keep working, but stop paying, bring on the robots, and EVERYTHING is FREE!

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/aLBeff03-image.png)

Yes, you heard that right, newb.
All the workers of the world have to do is to continue to do the work we do today, stop paying for stuff in stores, and tomorrow life goes on like it was crapitalistically craptastic.

The workers did the work, the stuff is on the shelf, all you got to do is go get it, or     call the delivery guy to pick it up on his way.

I know that your [cognitive dissonance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cognitive_dissonance) is telling your [confirmation bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confirmation_bias) that this is all gobbledy gook, but the facts are the facts.

[The Conquest of Bread](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/petr-kropotkin-th

author: freebornangel
title: Wednesday, first post of the day!
body:
This daily content is weighing on me, dear reader.
I just love to bring 'good' content to the conversation, but irl I don't talk all that much.
Here you get my inside voice, which is far less filtered than what my body language may betray.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/8AzC8o0D-image.png)

Were you to see me irl, I would be right past you like I didn't know you, not so much because I don't know you, but because that has been my habit through much of my life.
### I still haven't figured out where the fire is, but I am in big hurry to get there, sometimes.

It didn't take but a couple 'hey you!'s' in the big city to figure out that I wasn't in the army anymore, and that we were not all in this together.

Sad, really, they know not what they do, but they do it like they were infallible.

Maybe they are right, but somehow I doubt it.

It was wrong, for me, when I was like that.
When necessity rushes me, I am often wrong when I do it now.
[Early childhood training](https:/
root_title: Wednesday, first post of the day!

author: freebornangel
title: EarthFirst! Newswire back in business!
body:
If you aren't aware of the [EarthFirst! Collective](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth_First!) you must be new to environmental defense.

The EarthFirst! Collective has been around since 1979.
It was founded by radicals that loved the earth.
Their [newswire]((https://earthfirstjournal.org/newswire/2019/10/07/were-back/)) has been offline while they moved back to Oregon from Florida.

That they can be considered radical, for loving the earth, is a sure measure of the times that we live in.

How does pushing back against destructive corporations reaping mother earth become radical?
Shouldn't the polluters be the radicals?
Or is that just me?


![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/ueIjFEjk-image.png)

I came to know them through their magazine, [The EarthFirst! Journal.](https://earthfirstjournal.org/about-the-earth-first-journal/)

I don't know why you wouldn't support them with a subscription to their magazine, likely you spend more on coffee in a month.

### The EF! Journal,
root_title: EarthFirst! Newswire back in business!

author: freebornangel
title: Every dollar in your pocket comes from someone else's bankruptcy.
body:
![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/JyubZkYD-image.png)

Picture this:

GM loans 100 cars to 10 people on the promise that the people pay back 11 cars each.
GM creates no extra cars to pay this 'interest'.
The only way cars circulate is by one or more dealers defaulting on their loans.
Then the survivors can buy at the auction and pay back their interest.

Now, the federal reserve works much the same way,
They create only principal for the loans, never any interest.
In order for a loan to be paid back, with interest, somebody has to go broke.

Every dollar in your pocket is principal on somebody's loan.
If you haven't taken it out in a loan, then somebody else needs it to pay the interest on their loan.

This house of cards is going to fall down.
It's not the first time.
The banksters have played this game for centuries.
Starting when they figured out they only needed 10% of deposits on hand to ride out daily withdrawals.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steemp
root_title: Every dollar in your pocket comes from someone else's bankruptcy.

author: freebornangel
title: Belly of the Beast pt#6
body:
And still the saga continues!

The next step in this story picks up at the court clerk's office.



I got to go there to get a 'Title 22 letter'.

I knew that title 22 was criminal procedure, but had no idea what kind of letter I might need.
It was just what the lady said when I called and asked what I needed to get my license back.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/sXzwcvoL-image.png)

Armed with my little bit of information, I went to the clerk and asked for a title 22 letter just like the dmv told me.
I had asked the dmv lady if the court clerk was gonna know what that is, and she assured me that they would.

Wouldn't you know it, they played dumb.
The second lady probably knew what I was needing, but not the first one.
I don't think she knew much, at all.

I got tired of the run around and started lighting them up with why were they the only county in the state that doesn't give out a paper copy of the court minute when it is signed, how it took 10 days to get it reco
root_title: Belly of the Beast pt#6

author: freebornangel
title: Survival Saturday #20:  The Super Still
body:
Have you ever needed to distill down your ammonia so that you could make some ammonium nitrogen trioidide?
No?
Well good.
This still is not made for that.
You shouldn't use copper with ammonia, it isn't a pleasant experience and ruins your condenser!

But, if you need to run off a batch of mash  to power your hot rod, this still couldn't be more for you!

You can vary your materials, experience is the best teacher.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/kBHyO9Em-image.png)

[Get the full article.](https://archive.org/details/THESURVIVOR1/page/n95)

Too many of us are afraid to experiment, imo.
If more of us got off the beaten paths we would leave smaller a smaller footprint.

Stop being their best cop.
You do

author: freebornangel
title: MemeMonday #47
body:
I need a theme, dear reader, and you are not helping.

It is not your fault, I'm not doing this in real time.

title: Central planning doesn't work.
body:
We all know that from our economic lessons.

Nobody can know how many shoes are gonna be needed next year, right?

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/ccHxlDcf-image.png)

Well, it is time to open your eyes, dear reader.
We got computers now.
We can know, nearly to the pair, how many shoes will be needed next year.

This is the main argument I get from the economically educated.

How will we balance supply and demand?
Money does this by raising and lowering prices.
How are you gonna do that without money?

I think we can use the orders for shoes as a reliable indicator of how many shoes need to be produced.

Not getting orders for your shoes?
Make something else.

Can't give your product or service away?
It's a clue.

body:

Please tell your friends that we can be free on any given day, if they choose to go along with [the plan.](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/petr-kropotkin-the-conquest-of-bread)

What is the plan, you might ask?

## Keep working, stop paying!

It really is as easy as all that.

On the day that the workers realize that the boss needs them more than they need the boss, is the day that we can set about fixing what the greedtocracy has given us.

Do you like slaving away 40 hours a week, 50 weeks a year, for 40 years just so you can retire to a cat food sandwich in the trailer park of your waning years?

C'mon, nobody likes being a corporate drone.
We do it because we have to eat.
In order to survive

author: freebornangel
title: It's Sunday!
body:
The day of the week some folks use to recharge their batteries of what life in the belly of the beast takes out of them.

Some folks do it in the finest cathedrals.
![burnpar2.jpg](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/ysBvZvLi-burnpar2.jpg)

Some of them do it in [humble forest chapels.](https://steempeak.com/photography/@olga.maslievich/trees-monks)

But only the most fortunate of the fortunate few, can do it here, on:

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/GHTnzhDv-image.png)

Ahahaha, you thought I was going somewhere!
Didn't ya?

You thought I was going to bang my drum just like every other day of the week!

I couldn't let my humble daily readers down like that.
You occasional folks can come in a sit a spell, too.
If you like.

I'm just gonna fill this terribly crappy shitpost out to what I figure is 'sufficient length' and call it a day.

title: Savings, variable interest rates, and you, Steemizen!
body:
@edicted's perfectly wonderful [proposal!](https://steempeak.com/steem/@edicted/vault-dividends-clarification-and-conclusion)

The [initial draft.](https://steempeak.com/interest/@edicted/investment-test-steem-interest-rates-and-liquidity-sinks)

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/r0IlVjwe-image.png)
[source](https://procuredfromedicted)

The proposal is for the inflation currently going to sp holders to go to savings holders.

Not all of it, mind you, just a yet to be determined %.

I figure no more than 5%.

That would make the deal, 10% for sp holders, and 5% for (nearly) cash steem holders.

I think that being able to hold cash, subject to the three day access currently standard in the wallet, that will draw (some) interest, would attract some attention.

Holding liquid steem in the savings account will not give voting rights to the steem, that would still require powering up.

Holding steem in an interest bearing account will attract the speculators that only want to s
root_title: Savings, variable interest rates, and you, Steemizen!

author: freebornangel
title: Are you voting for proposals in the sps?
body:
If you are not voting proposals in the sps, what is wrong with you, Steemizen!
You hold stake in this platform, get your voice heard.

I know, I know, your measly 2mv's don't add much to the pile, but, believe it, or not, the big fish do listen to popular opinion.
They have to, if they want to stay ahead of the ball.

### **Look through the proposals and VOTE!**

# [DO IT NOW!](https://steempeak.com/me/proposals)

(You will need your active key, or keychain.)

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/AkAainNn-image.png)




If you don't like any of the proposals, or the people behind them, down vote them all by upvoting the return proposal.

### Voting for the return proposal is only for down voting **all proposals**.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/6Zeje5qI-image.png)

If you are voting for the return proposal, and a proposal that you like, you are blocking your own vote.

Only vote the return proposal when you don't like any proposals.

author: freebornangel
title: Looking Backwards by Edward Bellamy
body:
If you are not aware of this book, dear reader, it is because it has been intentionally omitted from your syllabus.

For us slower readers, that means that you will not find this book in your elementary level library, nor will you find it in any teacher's manuals.

I didn't find this book until I was given an exclusive tour of a number of small libraries.
I found it in the last one.
I found a couple more, but they bear no relevance here.

[Looking Backwards](https://archive.org/details/lookingbackward01bellgoog/page/n6) by Ed Bellamy published 1887

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/TmiXno2d-image.png)
[source](https://archive.org/services/img/lookingbackward_0909_librivox&scale=3)

In this book we learn of a time traveler that wakes up in the year 2000.

It is mighty convenient that we can look back on that date and see how correct Mr. Belllamy was in his predictions.

His plan has been hijacked by those that would profit from its demise.

Had he been successful, we would
root_title: Looking Backwards by Edward Bellamy

title: Survival Saturday #27:  How to make Laughing Gas!
body:
Yes, dear reader, this is a viable recipe to make what you can probably buy at the welding supply store for a few bucks.

Buying at the welding supply store may get you adulterated gas, too.

Perhaps your state, like mine, allows medical grade NO2 to be sold over the counter.

Maybe you don't want your medical purchases to be recorded for later use against you.

Whatever your reason, it is Kurt to the rescue.

![image.png](https://files.steempeak.com/file/steempeak/freebornangel/kBHyO9Em-image.png)

## Simply follow the directions carefully.

In my state they don't allow pure ammonium nitrate to be sold anymore, it made big headlines two decades back, though not for this.
Check to see that you have pure NH4NO3.

If you don't know what that is, a
